loans.name: Marcos Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marcos, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio de cosméticos y lociones, comprándose un nuevo pedido de cremas para el pelo, esmaltes, maquillaje, prendedores de cabello, lociones, entre otros productos que sean necesarios para mejorar la variedad en el negocio.
El préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda, siempre para el negocio, del cual ha tenido mejores ganancias, aproximadamente el 30% del producto, esto le ayuda a mantener en su hogar lo necesario, sus hijos continúan estudiando.
texts.en:
Marcos is applying for a new loan to invest in her cosmetics and lotions business, purchasing a new order of hair creams, nail polish, makeup, hairclips and lotions among other products that are necessary to improve the variety in her business.

The previous loan was very helpful to her and always for her business, from which she has had better earnings, approximately 30% of the product.  This helps her to maintain the needs of her household and her children to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy hair creams, nail polish, makeup and hair clips

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 41 years old. He is married with four school-going children. He is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past 12 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD. He paid all of his previous loans in good time. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase dairy feeds and to repair his cow shed.

He hopes to become a leading dairy farmer in his area.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds and repair his cow shed.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been selling timber in Olkalou town for the last three years. He also sells firewood from the chunks of timber that he cuts to sell. He is married to Egidia, and they have three children.

This will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy more timber to sell and thereby meet the demand of his clients, who mostly come from various construction sites.

John hopes to grow his business, make more income, and open a cereals store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Phoebe has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks, and beverages. Phoebe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so she can support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Olkalou town. He does mixed farming, rearing livestock and planting cash crops to sell. He is 42 years old and married to Margaret; they have four children.

This will be his third loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the money to buy fertilizer and potato seeds for this planting season. He also plans to buy a heifer cow and increase his stock of livestock.

In the future, John would like to grow his agricultural business and make more income, which will enable him to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and a heifer cow.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Eva has a tailoring shop where she makes and sells ready-to-wear clothes. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of textiles to make school uniforms and sports attire.

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so that she can support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more textiles for making school uniforms and sports attire

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly is 32 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of merchandise to sell.

Cherly has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Cherly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia works hard to support her family. Leticia is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Leticia is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old, a  single mother of two children aged 11 and eight years. She sells clothes, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.


She has requested a first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase two bales of children's wear. The profit she earns will be ploughed back into her business. 


Her hopes and dreams are to succeed in life as well as educate her two children.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of children's wear.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide works hard to support five children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Heide requested a PHP 4100 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Heide is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support four children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Teresa requested a PHP 7500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Teresa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years of age, married, and has five children. To make a living, Gloria  owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector, raising and harvesting vegetables for sale. Gloria  sells her vegetable harvest at the public market of her town. Gloria  has been in this business for 15 years and earns approximately 3,300 PHP per month. This is her primary source of income.
 
She came to the GDMPC office and applied for a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of her vegetables. Gloria's revenue will be reinvested back into the business to double the return and a portion of the profit will be used for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of her vegetables

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo vive en el suroccidente de la ciudad donde tiene varios negocios al mismo tiempo que maneja con una gran maestría: una remontadora de calzado, realiza trabajos de electricidad  y vende minutos a celulares al mismo tiempo. Reynaldo inicialmente trabajó en una empresa como mensajero hace 20 años y hace 15 trabajó el tema de la electricidad, para finalmente independizarse y emprender su propia aventura de negocios,  en estos dos servicios y aprovechando su punto estratégico de contacto con los clientes, también adicionó servicios de comunicaciones manejando 4 planes a celulares con los cuales genera otros ingresos. En sus negocios es muy reconocido en el sector, porque los servicios los ofrece a domicilio y esto ayuda a fortalecer su mercado. Gradualmente su clientela ha crecido y necesita tener inventarios de materias primas e insumos, para lograr dar una respuesta bien rápida, cuando algún calzado se le daña a sus clientes y porque ellos necesitan que se les responda oportunamente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva con el cual comprará suelas, puntillas, pegantes, capelladas para cambiar el estilo de los calzados, que le traen para ser actualizados y esto es lo que hará que su credikiva sea efectivo y el se promocione mucho mas.
texts.en:
Reynaldo lives in the southwestern part of the city where, with great skill, he manages various businesses simultaneously.  He is a cobbler, he does electrical work, and he sells cell-phone minutes at the same time.

Initially, 20 years ago, Reynaldo worked in a business as a messenger, and 15 years ago he worked in electricity.  Finally he went out on his own and set up his own business venture in these two services.  To make the most of his customer contacts he added communication services, managing four cell-phone plans to generate additional income.  He is very well known in his business area because he offers home service, which helps to strengthen his market.  His clientele has grown gradually and he needs to have inventory of raw materials and supplies to be able to respond quickly when a customer needs a shoe repaired, because they need him to respond opportunely.

For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan to buy soles, lace, glue, and synthetic materials to change the style of shoes that are brought to him to be updated.

This is what will make his Kiva loan effective, and he can better promote himself.

loans.use: to buy soles, lace, glue, and synthetic materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.

Maribeth has a food retail shop or sari-sari (convenience) store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Maribeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Maribeth hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergent and beverages

loans.name: Jamat

texts.en:
Jamat is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Jamat has been working hard to manage her small business, selling charcoal to the local people. 

To help expand her business, Jamat has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more bags of charcoal, and it will help Jamat to generate greater profits and learn to save from the profits she earns. Jamat hopes that, in the future, she will be able to have a larger area of operation. 

Jamat is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jamat who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder darle continuidad al negocio, se comprara una variedad de prendas enchapadas en aretes, pulseras, anillos, cadenas, además hará un pedido de cosméticos a las revistas para disponer de mejor  variedad.
Ella manifiesta tener un efecto positivo  con la utilización de los préstamos, ya que ha logrado realizar la inversión deseada para crecer en el negocio, aumentando sus ventas, considera que esta satisfecha con este servicio, porque le permiten mejorar su inventario y mantener esta fuente de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is seeking a new loan so that she will be able to continue in her business activities.  She will buy a variety of jewelry, including earrings, bracelets, rings, and necklaces.  Also, she will place an order for cosmetics from catalogs so that she can make a greater variety of products available to her customers.  

She reports that the loans have had a positive effect on her business.  She has been enable to invest so that she can grow her business and increase her sales. She is very grateful for this opportunity, since it permits her to improve her inventory and maintain this source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy earrings, bracelets, rings and necklaces.

loans.name: Patricia Elena

texts.es:
Patricia  de 36 años vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas en las edades de 5 y 3 años, en el municipio de Soledad, muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene su negocio mediante el cual comercializa productos a través de guías especializadas o catálogos, con los cuales vende prendas de vestir y productos de belleza, aprovechando que también ofrece el servicio de mejoramiento de la imagen personal a sus clientes, con peinados, tintes, alisados de cabello, blowers etc. 
Su idea de negocio comenzó en el año 1997,  cuando su vecina con su propio ejemplo, estimuló esta actividad, que ella había desarrollado desde muy niña, porque siempre le gustó el negocio. Poco a poco ha alcanzado a ver el fruto de su hoy actividad laboral, porque sus ingresos han crecido; hace 2 años se dedicó a aprender todo lo relacionado con la belleza e hizo un curso, que fue fundamental para ofrecer este servicio, siendo sus principales clientes los mismos que le compran las mercancías variadas que ella vende y también vecinos de su barrio y de los alrededores de su sector que acuden para recibir el servicio de embellecimiento. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local de gran tamaño, para ofrecer en una sala de belleza, la amplitud y un ambiente confortable a sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará accesorios de acero inoxidable, ropa exterior e interior femenina y productos de belleza, con los que ella misma asesora a sus clientes y estos le hacen su compra permanentemente. Su mayor desafío, es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para comprar en mayor cantidad, diversos productos que demanda su creciente clientela y que ella poco a poco y con el apoyo de Kiva logrará.
texts.en:
Patricia is 36 years old and she lives with her husband and their two daughters ages 5 and 3 in the municipality of Soledad, very close to Barranquilla, where her activity is located. She sells products though specialized products guides or by catalogues: the products she sells are clothes and beauty products, as she also offers beauty treatment services to her customers, such as hairdos, hair dyes, hair straightening, dryer chairs and many more.
She started her activity in 1997: she was inspired by one of her neighbors engaging in the same activity, as she had always liked this kind of activity and she has been engaged in it since she was a young girl. Little by little she has succeed in seeing her current activity profit, because her income has increased, and 2 years ago she decided to learn everything related to beauty by attending a fundamental course in order to offer this service. Her main customers are the same who buy from her the different products she sells, as well as her neighbors and people coming from the neighboring areas to receive beauty treatments. Her future goal is to own a big locale to offer her customers the spaciousness and the comfortable environment of a beauty salon. She is currently requesting a loan to buy stainless steel accessories, underwear for women and beauty products: these are items she needs to tend to her customers so that they always buy from her. Her greatest challenge is not having enough working capital to buy bigger quantities of the different products her customers request, but she will achieve this goal little by little and thanks to Kiva’s support.

loans.use: To buy stainless steel accessories, underwear for women and beauty products.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
This is Maria Luisa. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maria Luisa hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Reyna Guadalupe

texts.es:
Reyna, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para el negocio, ya que considera estar aumentando la clientela y es adecuado realizar una nueva inversión en productos frescos como conchas, camarones y pescado.
Con esta inversión Reyna espera mantener un buen nivel de ventas y a la vez generar mejores ingresos familiares,  ya que su experiencia con los préstamos le han dado la seguridad de contar con este negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is asking for a new loan to buy more merchandise for her business because she feels her clientele is increasing and it’s necessary to make a new investment in fresh products like clams, shrimp and fish.

With this investment, Reyna hopes to maintain a good level of sales while insuring better family income since her experience with loans has given her the security of being able to rely on this business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and seafood.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemino tiene 53 años y vive en casa propia de material rustico y de corte tradicional, junto con  su esposa y 01 de sus hijas de 17 años de edad. El vive en una Zona rural en el norte del Peru. Este es su segundo credito con el apoyo de Kiva y el primero fue un exito total, dado que le ayudo a consolidar su negocio de frutas y verduras.

La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales. Adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura.  Dentro de su ambiente familiar, de condiciones humildes pero se aprecia bastante voluntad para sus actividades laborales y  cooperación con sus vecinos. Su principal  actividad comercial es el comercio de verduras, contando con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro; por lo que compra maíz y lentejas en las chacras de poblados aledaños para posteriormente venderlos en las Ciudades de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Adicionalmente Cliente también Siembra 01 ha de Maíz en su parcela ubicada al lado del domicilio.

Su conviviente también posee crías de animales menores, en su mayoría patos, los cuales después de 45 días de nacidos son vendidos en la Ciudad de Chiclayo. Esta vez el préstamo será invertido parte (S/. 1,000) en compra de alimento para animales y en animales menores con fines de engorde, y la diferencia en capital de trabajo en el negocio de Verduras y Menestra; y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida tano de él como de su familia. Arteminio demonstro ser muy responsable en el pago del credito anterior.
texts.en:
Artemio, 53, lives in his own house made from insubstantial materials in a traditional style with his wife and one of his daughters who is 17-years-old.  He lives in a rural zone in northern Peru.  This is his second loan with Kiva’s support and the first one was a total success because it helped him consolidate his fruit and vegetable business.

His community’s quality of life is at the subsistence level.  Most are independent workers in commerce and raise animals.  Some also work in agriculture.  Within his family environment there are humble conditions but quite a strong will for his work activities and neighborly cooperation.  His main commercial activity is selling vegetables.  He has ten years’ experience in this line of work.  He buys corn and lentils from nearby fields to then sell in the cities of Chiclayo and Lambayeque.  He also has one hectare of corn planted next to his house.  His spouse also raises small farm animals, mostly ducks that are sold in the city of Chiclayo 45 days after hatching.  

This time the loan (1,000 soles) will be used partly to buy animal feed and small farm animals to raise and the rest as working capital in his vegetable and fruit business to thus improve both his and his family’s quality of life.  Artemio was very responsible with his previous loan’s repayment.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, animals, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Zully

texts.es: Zully de 50 años vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 24 y 34 años. Allí tiene su negocio mediante el cual comercializa mercancías como artículos de relojería, ropa y ofrece de tratamientos de belleza facial y corporal.  Zully aprovechando que en el año 1990 trabajó con una estilista española muy reconocida en la ciudad, construyó su experiencia y se entusiasmó estudiando y perfeccionándose  durante 8 años, para luego  emprender su propia aventura de negocios, enfocándose en el mercado de mujeres y adicionando a su actividad el comercio de tratamientos faciales y de estética en general. Con este negocio le fue muy bien, pues encontró en él una clientela que además necesitaba otros artículos, razón por la cual agregó a su oferta electrodomésticos y poco a poco otros artículos, de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes; en su negocio  vende mediante el sistema de crédito, ofreciendo a su clientela la oportunidad de acceder a los productos que ella ofrece y sus  compras las realiza  de contado;    Sus dos negocios los realiza simultáneamente y le han suministrado múltiples satisfacciones personales y a nivel económico. Su meta  es lograr un mayor bienestar y la sostenibilidad financiera de su negocio para conseguir tener una vejez tranquila. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará prendas de vestir exterior masculina, artículos de relojería, accesorios en plata y productos de estética, con los que logrará que sus clientes estén satisfechos y logren fidelizarse cada día mas y todo esto es gracias a su credikiva.
texts.en: Zully is 50 years old and she lives in the municipality of Soledad with her husband and their 2 children aged 24 and 34. She runs her activity there, selling products such as watches and clothes, as well as offering facial and body treatments. Zully took advantage of the work she did in 1990 with a Spanish stylist very famous in her town, and she built her experience and she got excited by studying and improving herself for 8 years in order to the start her own business adventure, targeting women and implementing her activity with facial and general aesthetics treatments. Things went very well for her with this activity, as she met with customers needing also other products: for this reason she started selling electrical household appliances and other articles, according to her customers’ requests. She sells on credit, giving her customers the chance to buy the products she offers, and she buys cash. She engages simultaneously in her two activities, and both have given her multiple personal and economic satisfactions. Her goal is to achieve a better standard of living and an economic stability for he activity in order to live a peaceful old age. She is currently requesting her first loan to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy male clothes, watches, golden accessories and beauty products, thanks to which she will succeed in satisfying her customers’ requests as well as in developing their loyalty every day more, and all of this thanks to her loan.

loans.use: To buy male clothes, watches, golden accessories and beauty products.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 30 years old. She is married to John and together they have two children aged six and two years. She operates a beauty salon and also sells cosmetics. She has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of about KES 10,000 from the business.

This is her first loan in KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by her friend who is one of our clients. She will use the loan amount to purchase hair weaves, oils and hair relaxers as stock for her business.

She hopes to expand her business by opening a barber shop.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, oils and hair relaxers as stock for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 59 years old and widowed with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from rice grains retail.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business. This is her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Solomon has been working hard to manage his store, which sells clothing material at wholesale and retail. 

To help expand his business, Solomon has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his fabric supply, and will help Solomon to generate greater profits and to increase his capital stock. Solomon hopes that in the future he will be able to improve the business. 

Solomon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Solomon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to expand his fabric supply.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio,  está solicitando un préstamo para continuar sembrando maíz y frijol, además sembrara una parcela de tomates y chile, esto le ayudara a crecer en sus cultivos, se comprara el abono, herbicidas, semilla de chile y tomate, poliducto para el riego,  y otros materiales que le son útiles en la siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo  anterior logro mantener una buena siembra, además cubrió algunas necesidades del hogar, en su familia todos se mantienen.
texts.en: Julio is asking for a loan to continue planting corn and beans; he will also plant a parcel of tomatoes and chilies.  This will help him expand his crops.  He will buy manure, herbicide, chili and tomato seeds, irrigation supplies and other materials that are useful to plant basic grains and greens.  He states that the previous loan allowed him to have a good harvest and he was also able to cover some household needs; everyone in the family continues well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm supplies and pvc tubing.

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagro, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque considera tener una buena experiencia en el negocio a través de los préstamos, este lo invertirá en quesillo, aceite, condimentos, también plátanos verdes, refrescos, entre otros productos para fortalecer el negocio.
El efecto que le dio el préstamo anterior al negocio, fue positivo, con las ganancias ha logrado ayudar a su familia, manteniendo las condiciones adecuadas en su hogar, su experiencia en creditos va creciendo ya que tiene un historial en la institucion.
texts.en:
Milagro is asking for a new loan because she feels she’s had a good business experience with the loans.  She will invest this one in string cheese, oil, condiments and also green plantains and soft-drinks among other products to boost the business.

The previous loan’s effect was positive.  She was able to help her family with the profits maintaining adequate conditions in her home.  Her experience with loans is growing since she now has a history with the institution.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Diomedes Armando

texts.es:
Diomedes, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar dándole mejoras a sus cultivos, invirtiendo en insumos agrícolas como el abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, que son necesarios para prevenir al cultivo de las plagas y fortalecer su desarrollo.
El préstamo anterior le permitió tener el ganado (vaca y ternero), creciendo tambien en la producción, teniendo las herramientas necesarias para  continuar trabajando, sus condiciones en la familia han cambiado, mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Diomedes is asking for a new loan to be able to continue improving his crops.  He will buy such things as manure, herbicide and insecticide which are necessary to protect the crops from infestations and to strengthen their development.

The previous loan allowed him to have livestock (cow and calf); production also increased having the necessary tools to continue working.  His family conditions have changed improving his income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres hijos, quienes le ayudan a José a realizar la siembra de maíz y frijol, él trabaja desde pequeño con su padre, quien le enseño todo el proceso, quien tiene una experiencia de 10 años.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de los insumos para la agricultura, comprándose abono, semilla mejorada e insecticidas, esto le ayudara a mejorar la producción de granos básicos y los prevendrá de las plagas, dándole la oportunidad de crecer.
La aspiración de José es apoyar a su familia para salir adelante, mejorando su trabajo y la producción de granos básicos.
texts.en:
José is a farmer growing corn. He lives in his own house with his wife and their three children, who help José in planting corn and beans. He has been working since he was a young boy with his father who taught him the entire process. He has 10 years of experience.
He is requesting a loan to buy agriculture supplies such as manure, improved seeds and insecticides. This will help him improve his basic grains production, preserving them form blight and giving them a chance to grow.
José wishes to support his family so that they can get ahead in life by improving his job and his basic grains production.

loans.use: To  buy  manure, improved seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 35 years old and married with 3 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. Lourdes aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Shelmith

texts.en:
Shelmith is 28 years and married with four children. She is a farmer in Nyahururu town where she rears livestock and also plants cash crops such as potatoes and maize.

She plans to use this second loan from KADET LTD to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm during this rainy season.

In the future, Shelmith hopes to grow her farming business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 55 years old and is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widow and blessed with eight children. Evelyn works in an agricultural business project raising vegetables like eggplant, okra, string beans and others to earn an income. She has been in this business for 11 years and earns about 2,800 PHP per month. 

Recently, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain financial services from the cooperative as additional investment in her existing business. She requested a loan in the amount of 5,200 PHP to purchase vegetable fertilizer for growth and good nourishment. Evelyn plans that the income generated from her loan will be invested back into the business and ultimately hopes to expand the size of the business. Additionally, Evelyn hopes that continued success in her business will allow her to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable fertilizer for growth and good nourishment.

loans.name: Savouern

texts.en:
Savouern is aged 44 years old and also a mother of five children, four of whom are dependent on her as they are still in school. She and her husband work as rice farmers on half-hectare of farmland and they also work as construction workers to better feed their kids with the additional income. They have been with these businesses for 10 years. 

The main challenges for Savoern are drought, which makes the crop yield decline, and insufficient working capital. She can earn up to around 5 US dollars per day.

This is the first loan for Savouern with KIVA's partner, VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan in amount of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current businesses and to have a decent food.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. Noel has a party shop that caters different kinds of parties, like birthdays, anniversaries, debuts and weddings. He has had this business for 11 years. 

He requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more decorations and materials to use in different kinds of parties, like chairs, flowers, balloons and curtains.

He has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011. In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more decorations and materials to use in different kinds of parties.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina works hard to support 6 children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,100 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Charina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Icela

texts.es:
Icela es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la calurosa ciudad de Ica la cual se caracteriza porque aquí se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva esparrago, paprika, entre otros, también se caracteriza por sus danzas en especial el festejo ya que en esta ciudad habitan muchos descendientes de origen afroperuano, asimismo tiene una variada gastronomía y se encuentra la alaguna de Huacachina , la cual es visitada por infinidad de turistas en todo el año ya que se ubica en medio de maravillosas dunas. Icela en sus tiempo libres le gusta mucho leer y en especial y sobre todo le gusta comer uno de sus platos típicos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco”.

Con mucho esfuerzo Icela trabaja en su pequeño negocio de peluquería, ella realiza corte de cabello, laciados, peinados, entre otros, trabaja alrededor e 8 horas diarias, pro los fines de semana puede llegar a trabajar alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender diariamente 20 clientes; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene mucha creatividad para realizar su trabajo.

Icela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprara insumos para realizar su trabajo como tientes de buena calidad, cortadoras de cabello, mandiles, tijeras, entre otros, de esta manera ella podrá tener los implementos necesarios para poder desarrollar su trabajo y poder dar una mejor atención a sus clientes, así ella mejorar sus ingresos  y podrá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un Spa en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad”.
texts.en:
Icela, 20, is a young woman living in the hot city of Ica noted for agriculture, especially cotton, asparagus, grapes and paprika, among others.  It’s also noted for its dances especially its festivals since many people of Afro-Peruvian ancestry live here.  It also has a varied cuisine and the Huacachina Lagoon is located here which receives innumerable tourists year-round since it’s located in the midst of marvelous dunes.  Icela enjoys reading very much in her free time and above all enjoys eating one of her favorite traditional dishes, the very delicious “Seco.”

With much effort Icela works in her small beauty salon.  She does haircuts, hair straightening and hair styling among others.  She works about 8 hours daily but on weekends might work up to 10 hours and can see 20 customers daily.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s very kind to all her customers and above all because she’s very creative in doing her work.

Icela is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy supplies for her work like good quality hair dyes, hair clippers, aprons and scissors, among others.  In this way she will be able to have the necessary tools to carry out her work and provide better customer service thus improving her income and being able to continue striving day to day to make her greatest dream a reality: to own a spa in a centrally-located spot in the city.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para el fortalecimiento del negocio comprándose más mercadería para refrescos, también queso, carnes, condimentos, empaque, aderezos, entre otros para la elaboración de hamburguesas y panes.
Con el préstamo anterior Doris logro comprarse una variedad de productos que le ayudaron a mantener la venta, atendiendo a un buen número de clientes con lo que ha estado trabajando, ella considera que esta superándose en el negocio.
texts.en:
Doris is applying for a new loan to strengthen her business by buying more merchandise like soft drinks as well as cheese, meats, condiments, packaging and dressings among other things for making hamburgers and bread.

With the previous loan Doris managed to buy a variety of products that helped her to maintain her sales, attending to a good number of customers with whom she had been working.  She considers herself to be excelling in her business.

loans.use: to buy cheese, meats, condiments, packaging, dressings and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Areli

texts.es:
Rosa, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para crecer con mercadería para el negocio, comprándose una variedad de medicamentos naturales y químicos para distintos malestares corporales y enfermedades, con la intensión de mejorar la capacidad de atención a las necesidades de los clientes.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, cambiando las circunstancias familiares y tener nuevos productos a la venta, mejorando sus ingresos a la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa decided on a new loan in order to grow with merchandise for her business.  She will do this by purchasing a variety of natural medicines and chemicals for body discomforts and illnesses.  She will do this with the intention of improving her capacity to tend to her customers’ needs.

The effect she had with the previous loan was positive.  It changed her family’s circumstance and provided new products to sell.  This improved her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy medicines for different discomforts.

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica Perú. El distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de espárragos, algodón, maíz, pallares, frejoles, entre otros, en este distrito encontramos a muchas empresas agroexportadoras, las cuales brindan mucho puestos de trabajo a los pobladores de la zona. Gloria es madre de un hijo de 15 años de edad a quien ama muchísimo es su motor para salir adelante cada día ya que el padre de su hijo la abandono y desde ese entones se convirtió en padre y madre para el,, es su adoración y por ello se esfuerza mucho para que el sea mucho mejor de lo que ella es. A Gloria le gusta mucho en sus tiempos libres ver televisión y en especial pasar un tiempo de familia con su hijo y en ocasiones le gusta cocinar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de enfermería.

Día a día Gloria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas, ella traba alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo muy trabajadora ya que su gran motivación es sacar adelante a su hijo.

Gloria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería en golosinas como chocolates, galletas, caramelos, gaseosa, snacks, entre otros al por mayor y de esta manera poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder mejorar su ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo y poder seguir luchando en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a su hijos y tener una tienda distribuidora en su barro”.
texts.en:
Gloria, 43, lives in Santiago District in Ica, Perú.  Santiago district is noted for its hot climate and also for its agriculture especially asparagus, cotton, corn, lima beans and broad beans, among others.  In this district we also find many agro exporting firms that provide many jobs to residents in the zone.

Gloria is the mother of a 15-year-old son who she loves very much and is her motivating factor to get ahead every day since the father of her son abandoned them and since then she became both mother and father for him.  He is her love and joy and why she strives so hard so that he’ll be so much better than she is.  

In her free time Gloria very much enjoys watching television and especially spending time with her son.  Sometimes she likes to cook one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Arroz con Pato.”  Due to her parents’ few economic resources, she only attended secondary school but she would have liked to have studied Nursing.

Day to day Gloria works in her small business selling snacks.  She works about 10 hours daily and can see up to ten customers per day.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s very kind and above all very hardworking since moving her son forward is her great motivation.

Gloria is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy merchandise like chocolates, cookies, candy, soft-drinks and snacks, among others at wholesale to have more variety of products on hand to offer her customers and to be able to improve her income which will allow her to continue growing and striving towards making her great dream a reality: to give her son a good education and to have a distributing store in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente de 36 años de edad ofrece desde su vivienda el servicio de alquiler de maquinas para lavar. Él vive en el municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos de 3 a 12 años de edad. De su actividad en la construcción de viviendas, Vicente pasó a tener un negocio que le ofrece más estabilidad en sus ingresos, en tanto a que su oficio en la construcción es estacionario y él tiene una obligación familiar con la cual cumplir. Por eso hace 18 meses inició con una lavadora y en la medida en que ha crecido su mercada, ha ido comprando una cada vez. Hoy está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará maquinas lavadoras, para atender su demanda de este servicio. Su cónyuge lo apoya mucho en la tarea y tiene en su negocio un potencial de crecimiento importante al cual abordar, pues el barrio en el que habita se encuentra en desarrollo y muchas familias nuevas tienen la necesidad de acceder al alquiler de lavadoras, especialmente las mujeres, para disminuir el cansancio de su combinadas tareas domésticas y generadoras de ingresos y  resguardarse un poco del fuerte sol del Caribe Colombiano
texts.en: Vicente is 36 years old and he runs a laundry in his house, renting out his washing machines. He lives in a municipality located a very short distance form Barranquilla with his wife and their 4 children aged between 3 and 12. Previously engaged in building houses, Vicente has moved to an activity offering him more fixed earnings, as opposed to his job in the constructions, and he has his family to constantly provide for. For this reason 18 months ago he started with one washing machine, gradually adding one more machine as his market was expanding. He is currently requesting his first loan to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy washing machines to tend to the requests for this service that he gets. His wife greatly supports him in his task. His activity has a significant potential of growth to make the most of, as his neighborhood is expanding and improving, and many new families need to rent washing machines; women in particular need to get relief from the tiredness deriving from the combination of their domestic chores and their working activities, and as well as to shield themselves a little form the hot sun of the Colombian Caribbean.

loans.use: To buy washing machines.

loans.name: Manuel Ivan

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 27 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, caracterizada por su clima cálido y hermosas playa; Manuel es una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos, no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Contabilidad; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo para hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con sus padres y hermanos.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, desde hace varios años Manuel trabaja como agente de seguridad de una empresa de su ciudad, el labora un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, Manuel se encuentra a gusto en su trabajo ya que lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y su trato amable y respetuoso hacia los demás.
 Manuel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar materiales, tales como: esteras, cañas de huayaquil, palos, madera y alambres para poder realizar el cambio de techo y el cercado de la parte trasera de su vivienda; de esta manera Manuel podrá contar con una vivienda más segura y en mejores condiciones, hasta que pueda cumplir si gran sueño de construir su vivienda con materiales adecuados y resistentes.
texts.en:
Manuel, 27, is a single man living in the city of Pisco which is notable for its hot climate and beautiful beach.  Manuel is a very cheerful, enthusiastic, hardworking person who has a strong drive for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, because he needed to work to cover his expenses, he wasn’t able to study a professional career but would have liked to have studied Accounting.  He likes to spend some of his free time playing sports and sometimes cooks a very delicious “Arroz con Pato” [rice with duck] to share with his parents and siblings.

On his own initiative and thanks to support from his parents, Manuel has worked as a security guard for several years in a firm in the city.  He works about 12 hours daily.  Manuel is happy with his work since he’s held in high regard because of his good work and the kind, respectful way he treats others.

Manuel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will buy supplies like rush matting, stalks, posts, lumber and wire to replace the roof and rear fence at his house.  In this way Manuel will have a safer house that’s in better condition until he reaches his dream of building his house with adequate, resistant materials.

loans.use: to replace the roof and build a rear fence.

loans.name: Jean Paul Richard

texts.es:
Richard es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Ingenio, Nazca, Perú. El distrito e ingenio se caracteriza por desarrollarse como actividad principal la agricultura en especial el tuna, cochinilla, algodón, frejol , frutales como el mango, naranja entre otros. Richard es muy trabajador y sobre todo optimista, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho escuchar música sobre todo ´para despejarse un poco del cansancio y obtener más fuerza para poder realizar su trabajo con gusto, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería.

Con mucho ingenio y esfuerzo Richard logro ahorrar y decidió iniciar su negocio de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, se animo gracias a su padre ya que en el distrito donde el vive hay varias festividades patronales y siempre consumen gran cantidad de estos productos, Richard traja alrededor de 9 horas diaria y el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y siempre les brinda un buen trato.

Richard está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercaderia para su negocio ( cervezas y gaseosas) y acondicionar una parte de su vivienda en una pequeña fuente de soda para que pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y brindarles más comodidad, con ello podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo y luchar para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Richard, 20, is a young man living in the Ingenio district in Nazca, Perú.  Ingenio district is noted for its main activity, agriculture, especially cactus apples, cochineal, cotton, broad beans and fruit like mangoes, oranges and others.  Richard is very hardworking and above all optimistic but when he has a little free time available he very much enjoys listening to music especially to distract him and get over the tiredness to recover his strength to continue working happily.  He also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “Arroz con Pollo” [chicken with rice].  Due to his parents’ limited resources, he only had secondary school education but would have liked to have studied Engineering.

With much ingenuity and effort, Richard managed to save up and decided to start his own soft-drink and beer business.  He was encouraged thanks to his father since the district they live in has several feast days and these products are consumed in large amounts.  Richard works about 9 hours daily and believes that he does well in his business because he’s very kind to customers and always treats them well.

Richard is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy merchandise for his business (beer and soft-drinks) and set up a soda fountain in part of his house where he’ll be able to provide better service to his customers and provide them with more comfort.  With that he will be able to improve his income and continue growing and striving to make his great dream a reality: to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft-drinks and to set up a soda fountain.

loans.name: Balentina Avelina

texts.es:
Balentina es una mujer de 56 años, se encuentra felizmente casada, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ella siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que junto con su esposo han unido sus esfuerzos para salir adelante; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar sus estudios secundario y tampoco una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la crianza de sus cuyes, a quienes considera sus mascotas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Estofado de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su esposo, Balentina se dedica a la agricultura, ella cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra frejoles, desde tempranas horas de la mañana Balentina se dedica a realizar diversas labores de campo, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, ella se encuentra muy a gusto con el trabajo que realiza ya que siempre le ha gustado el campo.
Balentina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos y el mantenimiento de su cultivo, comprando el abono necesario; de esta manera podrá mantener su cultivo en buenas condiciones y así cuando su cosecha termine podrá obtener buenas ganancias, con las cuales en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder cultivar diversos sembríos.
texts.en:
Balentina is a 56-year-old woman who is happily married living in the city of Camaná.  She’s always been a very cheerful, enthusiastic, hardworking person who has joined efforts with her husband to get ahead.  Unfortunately, because she needed to work and cover expenses she was unable to attend secondary school or study a professional career either but she would have liked to have done so very much.  She likes to spend some of her free time caring for her guinea pigs which she considers her pets and sometimes cooks a very delicious “Estofado de Pollo” to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with help from her husband, Balentina works in agriculture.  She has a small parcel of land where she grows broad beans.  Balentina works doing various field chores starting very early in the morning.  She can work about 10 hours daily and she’s very happy with the work she does since she’s always enjoyed working in the fields.

Balentina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to cover costs of maintaining her crops buying necessary manure.  In this way she will be able to keep her crops in good condition and when harvest is over will obtain good profits which in a not too distant future she’ll be able to use to plant various other crops.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para el cultivo de pipián, ya que está iniciando el proceso del nuevo cultivo, para esto deberá comprarse abono, herbicidas, y otros tratamientos adecuados para la siembra de hortalizas.
Él considera que este préstamo le ayudara mediante los recursos económicos para obtener mejores resultados de sus siembras, con el préstamo anterior considera haber tenido una buena experiencia.
texts.en: Pedro is requesting a new loan for his pipián [a type of squash] crops. He is starting the process of new planting and that is why he needs to buy manure, herbicides, and other necessary supplies for vegetable planting. He believes that this loan will help him as a financial resource to get better results with his crops. He considers his experience with the previous loan to have been good.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 40 years old.  He is married to Tecla and they are blessed with three children, aged 12, 9 and 5. He owns a posho mill, a business he started a year ago which earns him a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Paul is requesting for a first loan of KES 50,000 to purchase bags of maize for sale. The profit he earns from it will be ploughed back to his business. He hopes to see his business succeed.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Dadyluz

texts.en:
Dadyluz is 64 years old and is a widow with 4 children.

Dadyluz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running it for 10 years.  She also earns an income from livestock retail.

Dadyluz requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.  She has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Dadyluz aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children that he supports. He has been doing tea farming for the last seven years and gets a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

With a loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, Erick plans to buy fertilizers for his farm as well as pay labour for cultivation.  The anticipated profits will be ploughed back to business and diversify on other farm produce. His future dream is to start a shop and build rental houses.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita works hard to support her family.  Janita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Janita is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Janita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money and is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old and happily married. She has five children, all at school-age level. They live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Virginia's family is doing well despite the hardships that they are experiencing. 

Virginia decided to engage in a business activity to help her husband in acquiring income. Virginia has a retail business locally known as 'sari-sari' store, selling a variety of products in the community. She has been in this business for 7 years and has a proven track record of being able to generate revenue. Monthly, she has a return of approximately PHP 1,500.

Virginia joined GDMPC to gain financial access to engage in further business activities and expand her business. She is requesting a loan of PHP  3,800 to purchase supplementary grocery goods to sell in her store. She is hoping that through her income, she can further support the education of her children until college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris works hard to support her 2 children. She is married and has a vegetables and fruits business in the Philippines.

Maricris requested a PHP 4100 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Maricris is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 38 years old, married and blessed with three children that she supports. She is a tea farmer, and she has been in farming for the past 11 years. Her monthly income is KES. 7,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES. 15,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to purchase fertilizers to prepare the land for farming.

She intends to use anticipated profits to reinvest.  Her future dream is to be successful and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to prepare the land for farming.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a married woman with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a clothes selling business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mary Joy requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall.

Mary Joy is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 45 years old and married with 6 children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Estrella has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 22 years and also earns an income from sari sari store.

Estrella aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Radilla

texts.en:
Radilla  is from Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 51 years old and married. Radilla has two grown dependents. 

Radilla owns and operates a retail store at home to support her day-to-day needs. For 5 years, she has been able to manage the store properly. Every month she receives PHP1,000 from her business undertakings.

To reverse her financial difficulty, Radilla joined GDMPC. The cooperative gives her the chance to access financial services. As a matter of fact, she has already drawn two loans, making this current loan application her third. Her loan this time is for PHP 2,200. This will be used to purchase daily use commodities to sell such as canned goods, spices, shampoo and more. With the probable revenue to gain, Radilla hopes to sustain further the livelihood and sell more products to increase the regular monthly income she receives.

loans.use: to purchase daily-use commodities to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. Juliet is married and has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old married to Margaret and blessed with five children aged 12, 11, 9, 7 years and the last born being four months old. He operates an electronic repair shop, a business he started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase mobile phone accessories for sale. The anticipated profit will help him open another branch within the town.

He dreams of buying his own home and settling in it as well as having a stable and successful business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories for sale.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 5 years, Deborah has been working hard to manage her salon, where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Deborah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve her business, and will help Deborah to generate greater profits and to increase on her capital size. Deborah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a branch in town.

Deborah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Deborah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve her business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 37 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Lorena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
Ma.Aida works hard to support her family. Ma.Aida is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma.Aida requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Ma.Aida has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ma.Aida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in his business selling beef.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Notre client s’appelle Amadou, il est technicien de l’agriculture de profession. Métier qu’il exerce depuis 2010 jusqu’à maintenant. Il est marié et père de famille. Il possède 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a  15 ans et le cadet 5 ans. Il vient solliciter un crédit pour acheter des semences des intrants afin de préparer la campagne agricole hivernale qui est à ses débuts. Pour cela, il a besoin d’un crédit de 300000F CFA .Avec les bénéfices générés par ce crédit  il va pouvoir payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants , de rembourser normalement  sa dette et d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Amadou gère les besoins quotidiens de ses enfants et de sa famille.
Comme projet futur, il veut associer l’agriculture, à l’élevage, et à l’embouche ovine donc il aura besoin d’un fond pour  démarrer et  donc l’appui de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Our client is called Amadou, and is an agricultural technician by profession. He has worked in this job since 2010. He is married and a father to four children, the oldest of whom is 15 and the youngest 5 years of age. 

Amadou has requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to prepare for the agricultural rainy season, which has just begun. He needs a loan of 300,000 francs CFA. With the profits generated from this loan, he will be able to pay for his children’s education, repay his debt as agreed and improve his family’s dietary conditions.


Amadou is responsible for the daily needs of his children and family. In the future, he would like to work in agriculture, cattle raising and sheep fattening. He therefore needs funds to start off these businesses, and has asked for the support of UIMCEC.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer products for the agricultural rainy season.

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Madame Mariame est une dame qui est récemment entré dans le commerce il ya de cela  1 an seulement. Ne voulant pas toujours dépendre de son époux et ne pouvant rester sans rien faire de sa  vie, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de savon. Elle a déjà eu à bénéficier d’un crédit une fois et demande un renouvellement de 30000F CFA pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande.
Elle n’a pas d’enfants et s’occupe de ses charges personnelles. Grace à son activité de petit commerce, elle réussi à épargner et à transformer son patrimoine en or.
texts.en:
Mariame is a woman who recently started working as a retailer, and has done so for just one year. As she didn’t want to always have to depend on her husband, and couldn’t live a life where she did nothing, she decided to sell soap.

Mariame has already had one loan, and has asked for another of 30,000 francs CFA to meet her current demand. She has no children and is responsible for her own personal expenses. Thanks to her small business, she has managed to save and exchange her money for gold.

loans.use: To buy soap for resale.

loans.name: Dieynaba Ndiogou

texts.fr: Madame Dieynaba Ndiogou, mariée et mère de 3 enfants âgés entre 13 et 8 ans, est une débutante dans le métier. Elle a démarré il y a moins d’un an avec un maigre revenu dans la vente de légumes. Métier qu’elle a longtemps voulu exercer. C’est sa 1ère  fois à l’IMCEC et elle sollicite un montant de 100000F CFA. Elle gère ses propres besoins et grâce aux revenus de son activité, elle commence petit à petit à mettre de l’épargne de coté en le transformant en or qui se conserve plus surement.
texts.en:
Dieynaba Ndiogou is a married mother of three children, aged between 8 and 13. Less than a year ago she started to sell vegetables, with a small amount of money. She had wanted to have this job for a long time. 

This is the first time that Dieynaba Ndiogou has requested a UIMCEC loan, and she has asked for 100,000 francs CFA. She is responsible for her own needs and, thanks to the income from her business, she has started to save a little. She has put this money aside to exchange for gold, which will be safer to keep.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Houlèye Samba

texts.fr: Madame Houleye Samba est commerçante d’habits depuis plus de 7 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainé a 20 ans. Elle est âgée mais cela ne l’empêche pas de s’activer afin d’avoir de quoi satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Seulement pour ne pas trop se fatiguer, elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à13h. Elle vend des boubous et demande un crédit de 150000F CFA. Marchandises qu’elle va écouler dans le quartier ou elle compte le plus grand nombre de sa clientèle. Avec le crédit elle peut maintenant épargner et nourri même l’ambition d’élargir son commerce dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Houleye Samba has worked selling clothing for more than seven years. She is married and a mother of four children, the oldest of whom is 20. She is elderly but this does not stop her from working, so that she can have enough to cover her personal needs. So that she does not get too tired, she starts work at 8 am and finishes at 1 pm.

Houleye Samba works selling “boubous” (long, flowing suits or dresses), and has requested a loan of 150,000 francs CFA. She sells this merchandise in her neighborhood, where she has a large part of her customer base. With this loan she will be able to save, and move closer to her dream of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jiparkul

texts.ru:
Жыпаркул 47 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Жыпаркул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 23 года назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  хозяйство Жыпаркул приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Жыпаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Jiparkul is 47 years old, is married and is raising 2 children.  Jiparkul started raising livestock and farming 23 years ago as a main source of income for her family.  She started this business with a sum of 25,000 somoni (KGS), today Jiparkul's holdings earn around 12,000 somoni per month from selling milk and dairy products.

In order to further grow her business, Jiparkul has turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 30,000 somoni (KGS) to purchase young livestock.  Jiparkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase her holdings.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.es:
Santiaga, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, ya que con el anterior obtuvo varias ventajas y oportunidades de mejorar, se comprara con este fondo ocho quintales de maíz para fortalecer la tortillería, cada uno cuesta $20.00, tambien comprara otros materiales que le hagan falta, esto le ayudara a tener los materiales que se necesitan para continuar en la venta de tortillas.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue incrementar la producción del comedor y las tortillas, generándole mejores ganancias, con esto ahora goza de mejores condiciones con su familia, mejorando su vida cotidiana.
texts.en:
Santiaga found with her previous loan several advantages and opportunities to improve. She decided for her new loan to buy 8 quintals of corn to strengthen her store where she sells tortillas. Each quintal costs $20.00; she would also purchase other supplies that she does not have. This would help her to get all of the supplies that are needed in order to continue selling tortillas.

The effect that the previous loan had was increasing the production of tortillas as well as the eatery, generating better earnings. With this she now enjoys better conditions for her family, thus improving her everyday life.

loans.use: To buy 8 quintals of corn to strengthen her store where she sells tortillas.

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es:
Orlando, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, este negocio lo comenzó hace un año, realizando viajes a la capital para distribuir su producto con los clientes y al mercado, él vive con sus tres hijos quienes ya son adultos, su esposa se encuentra trabajando en el extranjero.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de una variedad de mariscos frescos como pescado de varias especies, camarones, conchas, ostiones, que le servirán para surtir el negocio, variando sus productos y mejorando el servicio a la clientela.
La aspiración de Orlando es tener un puesto de venta propio, en la capital, donde pueda instalarse sin ningún inconveniente, esto le ayudaría para crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Orlando has been selling shellfish for the past year. He goes to the capital to sell his product to customers and in the market. He lives with his three children, who are adults. His wife is working outside the country.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy a variety of fresh shellfish such as various types of fish, shrimp, conch and clams in order to provide a greater variety of goods in his business. This will improve his customer service.
In the future, Orlando hopes to have a booth where he sells fresh seafood in the capital. It will be more convenient to sell from his own booth, which will help him to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy various types of fish, shrimp, conch and clams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese and cream.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, estos negocios los aprendió de su madre, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde hace siete años, ofreciendo prendas de vestir para damas, niños. Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de blusas, ropa interior y cosméticos en variedad, invirtiendo en mercadería de calidad, con nuevos estilos apegados a la moda actual, esta compra le ayudara para incrementar sus inventarios.
La aspiración de Martha es fortalecer su negocio, desarrollándose más, ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha makes a living by selling clothes and cosmetics. She learned these businesses from her mother. She works Monday through Friday and has been in this business for seven years, offering clothing for women and children. She lives with her husband and two children.

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of blouses, underwear, and cosmetics so she can invest in good quality merchandise according to current fashion trends. This purchase will help her increase her inventory.

Martha's dream is to strengthen and continue to develop her business, in order to offer her family and children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of blouses, underwear, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ilario

texts.es:
Ilario, es agricultor y ganadero, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él tiene 27 años de dedicarse a la agricultura lo aprendió de su padre, como una fuente de trabajo de la que puede recibir el sustento para su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, pues se dispone a sembrar en la temporada el maíz para esto deberá comprarse abono, herbicidas, semilla y pagara el alquiler del terreno donde desarrollara la siembra, este préstamo será un gran apoyo para Ilario ya que podrá tener el lugar y lo necesario para continuar trabajando la agricultura.
La aspiración de él es mejorar su vivienda, instalando la energía eléctrica, tambien quiere crecer en sus cultivos agregando nuevas siembras.
texts.en:
Llario is a farmer and a rancher. He lives with his wife and three children. He is 27 years old. He learned how to be a farmer from his father It is a line of work that he can do to sustain his family.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy agricultural materials. It is the season to plant corn. He needs to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and seeds and to pay the rent for the land where he plants his crops. This loan is a great help to Llario. It gives him the ability to have a place and the supplies necessary to continue working in agriculture.
He dreams of improving his home and of installing electricity. He also would like to grow new types of crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, sees and to pay the rent on his land.

loans.name: Jose Exequiel

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad, viven en casa propia, él tiene 10 años de estar realizando las siembras en la tierra, estos quehaceres los aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente está preparándose para la nueva siembra, para esto solicita un préstamo que le cubra el gasto de materiales agrícolas como el abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, que son los necesarios para prevenir la plaga al cultivo y fortalecer la producción.
Él quiere tener buenas cosechas y mejorar los ingresos para su familia, considera que a través del trabajo con préstamos puede alcanzar superarse.
texts.en:
Jose grows corn. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 15 and 6. They live in their own house. He has been farming for the past ten years. He learned this skill from his father.
Actually, he is preparing to grow a new crop. This loan will be used to cover the cost of agricultural materials such fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides, which are necessary to prevent agricultural diseases and improve his production.
