He would like to have a good harvest and improve the earnings he provides for his family. He believes that working with the benefit of the loan, he will be able to succeed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie works hard to support her family. Marjorie is married and has a coconut business in the Philippines.

Marjorie requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Marjorie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 72 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Emilia has a shop that sells corn, beans and rice. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more corn, beans and rice.

Emilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emilia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of corn, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 37 years old and married with one child who is in school. Mary Jean works very hard to provide for the family.

Mary Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mary Jean has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as spices, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Morena Marisol

texts.es:
Morena, se dedica a la venta de mariscos y administra un chalet, aprendió por iniciativa propia el negocio, tiene 14 años de estar en el, vive con su familia, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de seguir adelante.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra mas mercadería para el chalet como gaseosas, agua, boquitas, pan, entre otros que sean necesarios para mejorar el inventario de su negocio, agregando tambien otros productos que sean del agrado de sus clientes.
Su aspiración es mejorar las instalaciones de la vivienda, mejorar tambien el local del chalet, dándole una mejor vistosidad, esto le ayudara a llamar la atención de más clientes, ella espera tener una buena experiencia con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Morena sells seafood and runs a snack bar. She learned the business on her own initiative, and has been in it for 14 years. She lives with her family. She is a hard-working woman with a desire to move forward.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise for the snack bar such as soft drinks, water, snacks, and bread, among other items which may be necessary to improve her business' inventory, adding also other products that may please her clients.

Her aspiration is to improve her dwelling's facilities, as well as improving the premises of the snack bar, giving it more color. This will help her to attract the attention of more customers. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, water, snacks, and bread.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana. Por esto acceder a credito para personas como Rosa puede ser un poco mas dificil y la tarea de Kiva y Edpyme Alternativa es crucial.

Este es el segundo credito de Rosa con Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva y demonstro ser muy responsable en su pago. Desde hace 6 años aproximadamente Rosa se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc), útiles de limpieza y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

Para poder  seguir consolidando su negocio y luego del exito de su primer credito, ella le ha soicitado un credito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 soles nuevos soles compra de capital de trabajo para bodega y compra de productos farmacéuticos, con el único objetivo de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes. Rosa es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para su familia al igual que brindarle otras oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, lives with her husband and children in their own house, but it doesn’t have basic utilities.  Their home is located in the rural district of Tambogrande in Piura department which is a zone characterized by farming, cattle raising and arts and crafts.  To get financing for a person like Rosa can be a little more difficult, and the work of Kiva and Edpyme Alternativa is crucial.

This is her second loan with Edpyme Alternativa  and Kiva’s support and she has proven to be responsible in her payments.  For about the last 6 years Rosa has sold groceries (products of daily use such as: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc) cleaning articles and drinks.  She has her business in her own house for her comfort and security.  She tries to use the earnings from her sales to cover all the household needs and expenses.

To be able to continue consolidating her business and because of the success of her first loan, she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa  of 2000 new sols for working capital to buy pharmaceutical products and items for the business.  Her only goal is that her business grows and she has more products to offer her customers.  

Rosa is a hardworking person who is dedicated to her business and she worries about giving her family a comfortable life and offering opportunities to her children.
.

loans.use: to get working capital for her store and to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Hector Belisario

texts.es:
HECTOR BELISARIO tiene 65 años de edad es casado tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

HECTOR BELISARIO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol además se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno.

Solicita el crédito para comprar  semillas, urea, insecticidas, urea, líquidos para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en san miguel.
El sueño es poder comprar un terreno más. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte, visitar a la familia, pescar disfrutar de las festividades de l patrón San Miguel y el Carnaval.
texts.en:
HECTOR BELISARIO is 65 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He lives with his wife and children in San Miguel, Bolivar province. 

He is a member of the PATRON SAN MIGUEL communal bank located in the community of Paila Loma, in the San Miguel canton. It is about 40 minutes from the office of the Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes. The members work in agriculture and raising animals.  

HECTOR BELISARIO works a a farmer. He grows corn and beans. He also raises cattle. 

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, and liquid herbicides. His dream is to be able to buy another plot of land. In his free time he likes to play sports, visit his family, fish and enjoy the festivals of the patron Saint Miguel and Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, and liquid herbicides.

loans.name: Jairo Vinicio

texts.es:
Jairo Vinicio tiene 22 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con los padres en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Jairo Vinicio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, además es ayudante de transporte. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza, ranger. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para los cultivos. El sueño es poder comprar una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, disfrutar de las fiestas den arcángel san Miguel.
texts.en:
Jairo Vinicio is 22 years old. He is single and has a son. He lives with his parents in San Miguel, Bolívar province.

He is a member of the PATRON SAN MIGUEL communal bank. It is located in the community of  Paila Loma, San Miguel canton. It is located about 40 minutes from the office of the Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes. The members work in agricuture and raising animals. 

Jairo Vinicio works as a farmer. He plants corn, beans and is a transportation assistant. He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, and liquid herbicide.   

With the help of a loan he will be able to buy ferttilizer for his crops. His dream is to able to buy a house. In his free time he likes to play sports and enjoy the festival of the Archangel San Miguel.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, and liquid herbicide.

loans.name: Elizabeth Eliana

texts.es:
Elizabeth Eliana tiene 21 años de edad es soltera vive con los padres en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Elizabeth Eliana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos orgánicos, químicos, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hacen.

Las compras y las ventas lo hacen en san pablo de Atenas. El sueño es poder comprar una casa.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, salir a pasear, disfrutar de las fiestas del patrón san Miguel.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Eliana is 21 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Chillanes, Bolivar province.  

She is a member of the PATRON SAN MIGUEL communal bank in the community of Paila Loma, San Miguel canton. It is about 40 minutes from the office of the Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes. The members work in agriculture and raising animals.  

Elizabeth Eliana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno.

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, organic and chemical fetilizers, and insecticides. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers that she needs so much.  

She does her buying and selling in San Pablo de Atenas. Her dream is to buy a house. In her free time she likes to watch television, go out for walks, and enjoy the festivals of the Patron Saint Miguel.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, and insecticide.

loans.name: Benadatta

texts.en:
Benadatta is 28 years old and is married to Sudi, a military officer. They are blessed with three children aged 12, five and three years respectively. Benadatta owns rental houses which she constructed five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 from rent. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 20,000  from KADET LTD to purchase materials to furnish the rooms in her rental houses.

The profit Benadatta earns will help her to pay her children's school fees and provide for her family's basic needs. Her dream is to build more rental houses for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase furnishing materials for her rental houses.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years. Leonora also earns income from  a sari-sari (variety) store and raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Yolanda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yolanda Esmeralda tiene 49 años de edad de estado civil unión vive con el conyugue y la hija en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Yolanda Esmeralda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz suave, fréjol, papas, arveja, mora, además se dedica a la cría de ganado, chanchos, borregos, gallinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, pollos y balanceado.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar más animales para aumentar la ganancia.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San miguel los días Jueves cada 7 días. El sueño es poder dar el estudio a los hijos para que sean profesionales.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, salir al pueblo a pasear, disfrutar de las fiestas del carnaval, fiestas del Patrón San Miguel y San Francisco.
texts.en:
Yolanda Esmeralda is 49 years old and married. She lives with her spouse and daughter in the Bolívar district of the province of San Miguel. 

She is a member of Patrón San Miguel ["Patron Saint Michael"] community bank, which is located in the Paila Loma community of San Miguel, about 40 minutes away from the Chillanes office of Cooperativa San José. Its members work in agriculture and raise animals. 

Yolanda is a farmer and grows soft maize, beans, potatoes, peas, and berries. In addition she raises livestock: pigs, sheep, and chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, chickens, and feed. With the help of these funds, she will be able to buy more animals to increase her earnings. 

She buys and sells in San Miguel on Thursday every week. Her dream is to be able to give an education to her children so that they can have professional careers. 

In her free time she likes to watch television, walk around town, and enjoy Carnaval parties and festivals for the patron saints Michael and Francis.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, chickens, and feed.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 55 years old and married with 12 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Asuncion has been raising livestock for four years and earns additional income from dressmaking and a sari-sari (variety) store.

Asuncion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Berliza

texts.en:
Berliza is 38 years old and is married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Berliza has been farming vegetables for six years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Berliza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 52 years old, is married and has three children. She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Carmelita has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Carmelita has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and additional livestock to raise. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza, aged 57, is a pensioner who previously worked as an accountant for 30 years in the state organization. Now, she lives with her two sons, her daughter-in-law and her nephew on a plot of land in the ger district, an area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, which has no running water, minimal roads and irregular electricity.  

Her grandson, Batbold, aged 32, runs a freight transportation business around the city and rural areas using his old truck. He has been running his business for four years and has gained a lot of experience. Actually, it is the main income source of this family. 

Lately, his truck has needed some repairs. It especially needs four new wheels and a trunk. As he said, “I don’t want to stop my business and it will be a big boost for my business if I can repair my truck”. Therefore, her grandson needs some money to buy four new wheels and a trunk for his truck.

loans.use: To buy four new wheels and a trunk for her grandson's truck.

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is 49 years old and is married with five children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Elita has been fattening pigs for 10 years and earns additional income by raising livestock and by operating a general store.

Elita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins to sell. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins to sell

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.en:
Justiniano is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Justiniano has a pig pen where he raises and sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for six years. 

Justiniano has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy animal feed, like hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher, for the pigs. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Justiniano hopes to improve his business to support his children's education.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is 45 years old and married. She has 2 children.

Marlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dried coconut meat retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan, through NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell.

Marlina has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dried coconut meat retail business for 16 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and a general store.

Marlina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence still runs M-Pesa which is a local money transfer centre and his monthly income is 20,000 Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to increase his M-Pesa float so that he can better serve his customers. The anticipated profits will be used to expand his mobile accessories' business.

This is the second loan that Lawrence has taken out from KADET LTD and he has completely repaid the previous loan. He hopes to expand his M-Pesa point and also to open another outlet at Mlolongo.

loans.use: to increase his M-Pesa float to better serve his customers.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
51-year-old Flaviana is a married woman with 6 children. She does farming for a living. She earns 4500 PHP per month growing and selling rice. Flaviana works hard to meet her family's needs. She also hopes to fund her youngest child's college education.

Flaviana is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use any extra income for school fees, food and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a mango farm in the Philippines.

Melinda has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase pesticides and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambaa, 56, runs a grocery store in with her daughter and son-in-law in Kherlen, an eastern boundary town in Mongolia. She has 10 children and all of them have moved out from their parent’s house. 

Mrs. Byambaa has been running their store for 5 years and already has had many permanent customers. She sells the livestock meats to her customers mainly. In summer time, sales volume of her store is increased notably. Also, it depends on the satisfaction of her customers. This time she is requesting a loan to buy the meat in a large amount from the herders to increase her working capital. It is a very important thing to increase her profits and increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to buy meat in a large amount from the herders for increasing the working capital.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida  de 45 años de edad se dedica a la confección de ropa y también elabora con sus propias manos artesanías, como individuales, llaveros,  accesorios pintados con diversa técnicas y resinados. Ella dese muy joven se capacitó en confecciones, cuando estudiaba en un colegio administrado por  monjas y allí aprendió este arte, que le ha servido para potencializar su talento y desarrollar su propia fuente de ingreso y empleo. Cuando inició lo hizo con varias mujeres de su barrio, organizándose en una cooperativa  y cada una aportó su propia máquina, las cuales ubicaron en un local, e iniciaron la producción de prendas de vestir;  aunque este proyecto duró muy poco, le dio las bases para tomar de él su experiencia e independizarse;  en un principio se sintió desanimada, pero no tardó en tomar sus propias riendas y confeccionarle a vecinos, familiares, amigos, que gradualmente le fueron refiriendo a otras personas con necesidades de su servicio, hasta que estructuró su hoy clientela fija. Como Zoraida tiene un gran potencial creativo que muestra en sus diseños, ha logrado agregar valor a su trabajo, pues ha realizado cursos de artesanías que le han facilitado trabajar acabados con excelencia y también como fue patrocinada por una multinacional en su formación en las artes y técnicas para ser aplicadas a manualidades, ella se organizó con otras mujeres para producir,  aprovechando los empleados de la empresa patrocinadora, los cuales han convertido en su  clientela actual, que han ido conquistando poco a poco con las bellas artesanías y manualidades a las cuales les aplican las técnicas aprendidas y producen sus propios ingresos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará hilos, adornos, telas, pinturas, madera, e iraca; su crédito es potencialmente exitoso porque está fundamentado en pedidos que le han hecho los empleados de la multinacional que la patrocinó, que tienen gran estabilidad laboral,  a quienes les responderá con un surtido de sabanas elaboradas por sus propias manos y con ello crecerá cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Zoraida, 45, works making clothing and handicrafts by hand such as place mats, key chains, and accessories painted with different techniques and resinated products.  She became accomplished in sewing from a very young age, when she studied in a school run by nuns and learned this art, which has served her to make the most of her talent and develop her own source of income and work.

In the beginning she did it with several women in her neighborhood.  They organized themselves as a cooperative and each one brought her own machine, which they got a place for and started producing clothing.  Although this project didn't last very long, it gave her a foundation for her experience and she went out on her own.  At first she felt discouraged, but she didn't waste any time taking control of things and making clothes for neighbors, relatives, and friends, who gradually started referring her to other people who needed her services, until she formed her current steady clientele. 

Zoraida has managed to add value to her work because her great creative potential shows in her designs.  She has taken arts and crafts courses that have enabled her to do excellent finishing touches.  Also, she was sponsored by a multinational company in her art and technical courses to be applied to handicrafts.  She organized herself with other women to produce, making the most of the sponsoring company's employees, who have become her current customers.  They have won them over little by little with the beautiful handicrafts to which they apply the techniques learned, and they produce their own income.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she will buy thread, decorations, fabric, paint, wood, and "iraca" straw.  Her loan is potentially successful because it is based on requests from the employees of the multinational company that sponsored her.  They have stable work, and she will respond to them with a supply of her handmade sheets, with which she will keep growing.

loans.use: to buy thread, decorations, fabric, paint, wood, and "iraca" straw.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nergie

texts.en:
Nergie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her fishing business. Nergie has been in this business for 26 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling seaweeds.

Nergie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Elviana

texts.en: Elviana is married. She has been doing this business for a long time and now she has come to the age of 51, but she still wants to continue her business of selling things in her store. She makes a good income.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, biscuits, and other things to sell

loans.name: Guilhermina

texts.en: This 42-year-old woman is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business. With the loan, she feels that she has more working capital to get what she needs for her business, so she is happy to take this loan from Tuba Rai Metin (TRM).

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia is 20 years old. She lives in the city and is making a good income from doing this business. With the loan, she can buy more things to keep in her kiosk. She prefers to do this business because she can make money every day.

loans.use: To buy coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 41 years old and married. She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines and earns additional income from poultry. Elvira is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en: Angelica lives in the city and she is opening a kiosk. The loan of $1,000, which is offered, will help her to improve her business. She is making money from selling clothes. With the income, she can survive in her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Joninha

texts.en: A loan of $1,000 helps Joninha to continue to do her business and improve her kiosk. She can buy more things to keep in her store with the loan that she is taking out. She is happy to take out a loan from TRM because this gives her more working capital to do business.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other things to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is opening a kiosk. She makes a good income from this business. With this loan, she can buy more things to keep in her kiosk. She is happy to take out this loan from TRM.

loans.use: To buy coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 44 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Esterlita runs a general store in the Philippines which she has been running for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Esterlita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. Esterlita aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children, 3 of whom are in school.

Phoebe is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Phoebe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins.

Phoebe has been raising pigs for 27 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 3 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Phoebe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is making good money from selling things in her kiosk. She needs the loan to buy sugar and soft drinks and other needed items.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy biscuits, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, and other things to sell

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 56 years old, is married and has five children. She is in the agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Lily has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lily has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and additional livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 48 years old and married.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Teofila is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Teofila has been buying and selling livestock for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Tita

texts.en:
Ma. Tita is 42 years old and married with 4 children, 2 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Tita has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Ma. Tita requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more personal products like body lotion, perfume and so on to sell to her customers.

Ma. Tita has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Ma. Tita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase personal products like body lotion and perfume to sell to her customers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khavakhon

texts.ru:
Хавахон 60 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Хавахон на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Хавахон в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова,20 домашних птиц. Продажа молока, молочных продуктов и яиц приносит около 20,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Хавахон обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Хавахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины и закончить строительство дома для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Khavakhon is 60 years old, she is married and has two children. Khavakhon has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 30 years having started this business with an amount of 5,000 som. Because of her hard work Khavakhon now has one milk cow and twenty poultry. The sale of milk and dairy products with eggs bring around 20,000 som (KGS) a month.

With a goal to further grow her business she has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som to buy a milk cow which will allow her to increase her milk volume. Khavakhon plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase her livestock and finish building the house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 27 years old, is married to Everlyne and they are blessed with a two-year-old child.  He operates a phone accessories shop where he also repairs mobile phones. James started this business eight years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. The anticipated profit will help him open another branch of this business in a different location for additional income. He dreams of buying his own home and settling in it.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 34 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines which she has been running for 25 years and also earns an income from selling frozen products.

Lorna has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roquesa is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Roquesa has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 9 years. 

Roquesa requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Roquesa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Roquesa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Olandina

texts.en: Olandina is requesting a loan of $1,500 to make her business bigger. She makes a good income from selling clothes. She is married and is 33 years old.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks, coffee, and other needed items to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is 46 years old and married. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She lives in the city and is making a good income. With the loan, she can buy what she needs for her own use and for her family.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, and other needed items to sell

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg, aged 42, is a sewer in a textile product company in Mongolia. Since 1992 she has been working continuously for this company and she is one of the skilful masters. Her husband works as a plumber.  She lives with her husband and her two children in her common apartment which was built in the communist era in Mongolia. It has two rooms and has never been completely repaired or renovated. Also, much heat is lost through the windows and walls in winter time which is very harmful to their health and money. In winter, Altantsetseg usually uses the furnace that uses smoky coal and other kinds of fuel just to stay warm. Therefore, she has decided to repair her apartment by insulating the walls and windows. The wall insulation will be made from cement, rock wool and other insulation materials. At her calculation, it will cost about 4,000,000 MNT for all the costs.

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries. This is due to the long cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40 degrees Celsius (-40 degrees Fahrenheit) even in the cities.  Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families who are simply trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of main reasons for Mongolian air pollution. 

In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems and also so they can buy cars that run on natural gas. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and the health of Mongolians. The loan that Altantsetseg is taking out will be used to buy the building and insulation materials to repair her apartment.

loans.use: To buy building and insulation materials to repair her apartment.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina, aged 55, is from Bien Unido, Bohol and is married with six children. Her eldest is 23 and her youngest is 11. Angelina helps her fisherman husband by farming seaweed to earn an extra income. She is asking for a loan to buy plastic rope, wooden stakes and gasoline for their boat. She strives hard in her business so that her children can go to school. Her income also takes care of her family's needs for nutritious food and the transportation expenses for her children going to school.

loans.use: to buy plastic rope, wooden stakes and gasoline

loans.name: Ivonia

texts.en: Ivonia is 36 years old. She has a kiosk in the city, the place where she stays. When she wants things to keep in her kiosk, she has to go to the market. The market is not so far from her business place. She is happy with the loan that she is taking out.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and cigarettes to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 34 years old and living in the city. She is taking out a loan of $600 to improve her business. She does not have enough working capital, so she is requesting this loan to buy more things to keep in her kiosk.

loans.use: To buy candles, coffee, sugar, and other things to sell

loans.name: Alcina

texts.en: A loan of $1,000 helps Alcina move on with her business. With the loan, she will be able to buy more clothes to sell. She lives in the city. She is making a good income from selling clothes. She is happy with the loan that is being offered.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is 27 years old and she is married. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to improve her business. She is opening a kiosk. With the loan, she will be able to buy more things to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, and other needed items to sell

loans.name: Maria Ellen

texts.en:
Maria Ellen is 53 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 15 years and also earns an income from selling meat.

Maria Ellen has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. Maria Ellen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice farm

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is 38 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Marigen has been running a general store in the Philippines for eight years and also earns an income from selling food.

Marigen has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. Marigen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 37 years old and a single mother of two children aged 15 and 10 years old. She operates a cereals shop in the Bomet area, and has been running the business for 10 years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has taken her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, with which she intends to purchase more cereals for her business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children. Roseline's dream is to improve her living standards and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her cereals shop.

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 27 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ana Mae is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Mae has been raising pigs for 8 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old.  She is married to Kenneth and together they have two children, aged 10 and 8.  Grace sells cosmetics and has been in this business for the past seven years.  She gets a monthly income of KES 16,000 from the business.

This is Grace's second term loan from KADET LTD.  She repaid her previous loan well and in good time. Grace was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase hair weaves, hair oils, and relaxers for her business.  She hopes to open a wholesale cosmetics shop.

loans.use: buy hair weaves, hair oils and relaxers

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La señora Edith, es socia del banco comunal “Dulce Vida II”. Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, es casada, tiene 32 años de edad y cuatro hijos.
Lleva 2 años trabajando con este banco comunal quie la acogió muy bien e hizo nuevas amistades, tiene un restaurante en el mercado numero uno de la ciudad, casi todo el día tiene que llevar a su bebe al trabajo para poder estar tranquila y atenderlo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles  comprará: un juego de ollas medianas, 2 tazones, 1 set de coladores, 2 docenas de platos, 2 docenas de vasos.
Con este negocio ha podido comprar algunas cosas y hacer arreglos en su hogar, está contenta porque está consiguiendo lo que quería,  tiene a tres personas trabajando para ella y espera seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the “Dulce Vida II” communal bank in Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 32, married, and has four children.

She has been working with this communal bank for two years. It has really welcomed her and she has made new friendships. 

She has a restaurant in the number one market of the city. Almost every day she has to carry her baby to work; to be able to look after it and have peace of mind.

With the new loan of 1,300 nuevos soles, she will buy a set of medium-sized pots, two bowls, one set of strainers, two dozen plates and two dozen glasses.

With this business, she has been able to buy a few things and do repairs to her house. She is happy because she is getting what she wanted, has three people working for her and hopes to continue working with Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy pots.

loans.name: Ma.clarence

texts.en:
Ma. Clarence is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Ma.Clarence has a mini store that sells homemade peanut butter.  Aside from that, she also sells hot dogs and sausages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients in making peanut butter like sugar and peanut.

Ma. Clarence has been a member of HSPI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make peanut butter

loans.name: Ekariut

texts.en:
Ekariut is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Ekariut has been working hard to manage his shop where he has a video library, sells movies and burns music and movies. 

To help expand his business, Ekariut has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock, and will help Ekariut to generate greater profits and to expand the business. Ekariut hopes that in the future he will be able to create other businesses. 

Ekariut is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ekariut who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy stock for his video store

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children, 2 of the children are in school.

Ivy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  Ivy requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Ivy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha Cecilia tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil actual es unión libre vive con el conyugue en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Martha Cecilia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, habas, fréjol, mora, además se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos, gallinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar  insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos, semillas, urea, pollos y balanceado. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los pollos y la alimentación para criarlos y engordarlos para venderlos aún buen precio.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel. El sueño es poder darles el estudio a los hijos para que sean profesionales y comprar un terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es las enfermedades a los animales.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, jugar con los hijos, disfrutar de las fiestas del patrón San Miguel y San Francisco de las Guardias.
texts.en:
Martha Cecilia is 40 years old. She lives with her partner in San Miguel, in Bolívar Province.

She is a member of the Patron San Miguel communal bank, in the community of Paila Loma San Miguel, 40 minutes from the office of the Cooperative San José Agencia Chillanes. Members of the group work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Martha Cecilia works in agriculture, planting corn, broad beans, black beans, and blackberries, and raising cattle, pigs and chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy inputs for crops such as fertilizer, seeds and nitrates, as well as chickens and balanced chicken feed. With the help of the loan she can buy the chickens and feed to raise and fatten them, and still get a good price when she sells them. She buys and sells in San Miguel. Her dreams are to give her children an education so they can grow up to be professionals, and to buy land. The challenge she faces in her work iskeeping her animals healthy.
In her spare time she enjoys watching TV, playing with her children, and enjoying the local fiestas of the patron saint San Miguel and of San Francisco de las Guardias.

loans.use: To buy inputs for crops, such as fertilizer, seed and nitrates, as well as chickens and balanced chickenfeed.

loans.name: Klever Antonio

texts.es:
Klever Antonio tiene 28 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con los padres en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Klever Antonio se dedica a la siembra de maíz, papas, mora, además se dedica a la cría de pollos, cerdos y es chofer profesional. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de maíz y mora, urea, insecticidas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de buena calidad. El sueño es poder tener casa propia.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la pérdida de la producción  por presencia de plagas y enfermedades.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval, Patrón San Miguel, San Francisco.
texts.en:
Klever Antonio is 28 years old and single. He has a son, and lives with his parents in San Miguel, Bolívar province.

He is a member of the Patron San Miguel communal bank, located in the community of Paila Loma in San Miguel canton, 40 minutes from the branch office of Cooperativa San José Agencia in Chillanes. The members work in farming and livestock-raising.

Klever Antonio grows corn, potatoes, blackberries, and also raises chickens, pigs, and is a professional driver. He is requesting the loan in order to buy seeds for corn and blackberries, as well as fertilizers and insecticides. 

With the loan's help, he will be able to buy good quality seeds. His dream is to be able to have his own house. The challenge he is facing is the loss of production from crop diseases and pest infestations.

In his free time he likes to play sports and enjoy the festivals of Carnival, Patrón San Miguel, and San Francisco.

loans.use: To buy seeds for corn and blackberries, as well as urea and insecticides.

loans.name: Nickson Alimas

texts.en:
Nickson is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has three children between the ages of two and nine, one of whom goes to school. 

Nickson runs a fish selling business and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions and she is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase more goods.  

In five years, she wants to increase her stock.

Her major challenges include the high cost to transport her goods. 

She is happy to take a loan from Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Candia Elias

texts.en:
Candia is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 12, two of whom go to school. 

Candia runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients  and she is taking a loan of 1,600 SDG to purchase more goods.  

In five years, she wants to open a big shop.

Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

She is happy to take a loan from Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy oil, azam, batteries etc

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en:
Casiana works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Casiana requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shoes, slippers, bags and other dry goods.

In the future, Casiana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes, slippers, bags and other dry goods.

loans.name: Christine John

texts.en:
Christine is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and she has three children between the ages of 6 and 12. Three of her children go to school. 

Christine runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients and she is taking a loan of 1,600 SDG to purchase more goods.

In five years, she wants to open a big shop.

Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

She is happy to take a loan from Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, oil, etc

loans.name: Moriku William

texts.en:
Moriku is a 28-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has two children between the ages of two and six years old, one of whom goes to school. 

Moriku runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients and she is taking a loan of 1,600 SDG to purchase more goods.

In five years, she wants to open a big shop.

Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice and sorghum

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Joan has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Joan requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Joan has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. 

In the future, Joan hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 42 years old and married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.  Ma. Cecilia has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Ma. Cecilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Vicky Osa

texts.en:
Vicky Osa is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has two children between the ages of four and eight, one of whom goes to school. 

Vicky runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients and she is taking a loan of 1,600 SDG to purchase more goods.

In five years, she wants to open a big shop. Her major challenges include inflation in the market. 

She is happy to get loans from Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, beans oil, etc

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 24 years old. She is married to James and blessed with a baby who is four months old. She is a landlady and owns rental rooms that earn her a monthly income of KES 15,000. She started this business three years ago. 

She wants to open a boutique and has requested her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase new clothes and shoes for sale. 

The profit from this business will help her buy more stock. Her dream is to have one of the biggest boutiques in Eldoret town.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes for her new line of business, a boutique.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 50 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Corazon has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail for two years and also earns income from selling bananas.

Corazon aspires to save money and improve living standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Margret has been working hard to manage her hardware retail store, where she sells building materials. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings. The loan will be used to stock more products and will help Margret to generate greater profits and to widen her sales. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big store. 

Margret is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To stock more building materials in her hardware store

loans.name: Silvia Mandera

texts.en:
Mandera is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has two children between the ages of four and eight, one of whom goes to school. 

Mandera runs a hotel (restaurant) and has been in business for two years. She has three employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients and she is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more goods.

In five years, she wants to open a big hotel (restaurant). Her major challenges include inflation in the market. 

She is happy to get loans from Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy meat, beans, rice etc

loans.name: Sezerina Kaku

texts.en:
Sezerina is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between the ages of 8 and 18, three of whom go to school. 

Sezerina runs a food store and has been in business for two years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients and   she is taking a loan of 700 SDG to purchase more goods.

In five years, she wants to open a big shop. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

She is happy to get loans from Finance Sudan and  Kiva as a partner.

loans.use: to buy items like maize, onions, beans etc

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is 52 years old and married. Virginia has three grown dependents. Her husband is a private employee. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store to earn a living. She has been able to manage the store properly for about 20 years. Every month she receives PHP 8,500 from her business venture to cover financial needs.

The previous loan Virginia took for coconut plantation fertilizer was of great help. Her farm goes well and she is now taking another loan for her general store.

Virginia joined GDMPC have to access to financial services. She is a member of good standing in the cooperative. She is now in the 14th cycle of the loan. She is now applying for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase supplementary products to sell in the community. Virginia hopes that in the future her business will have credible income to gain, that she can further sustain her livelihood, and that she can sell more products to increase her regular monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 32 years old, married, and supports a family of two people. He has been a tea farmer for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

He is requesting his first loan of KES 15,000, which he intends to use to purchase fertilizers and pay the labor costs for spraying, pruning, and picking the tea leaves on his farm.

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to own a large-scale tea plantation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay the labor costs for spraying, pruning, and picking the tea leaves on his farm

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila runs a scrap materials retail business in the Philippines and is requesting a loan PHP 50,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional stock to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Amylie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Amylie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from lumpia (spring roll) wrapper making. Amylie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock and ingredients to sell in her food vending business.

Amylie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Joyce Daniel

texts.en:
Joyce is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 10, two of whom go to school. 

Joyce runs a general store and has been in business for two years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients and   she is taking a loan of 700 SDG to purchase more goods.

In five years, she wants to open a big shop. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

She is happy to get loans from Finance Sudan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like maize flour, sorghum, beans etc

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 56 years old and married with five children.

Celsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items like shampoo, soft drinks, and beverages to sell in her store.

Celsa has previously borrowed and repaid three loans through NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 36 years and also earns an income from fishing, farming bananas, and raising livestock.

Celsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items like shampoo, soft drinks, and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Ma. Villa

texts.en:
Ma. Villa is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Villa is 47 years old and has five children, who are in school.

Ma. Villa has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Ma. Villa has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 39 years old and has a motorcycle transport business in the town of Nakuru, Kenya. He is married to Ann, who has a green grocery store. Together they have three children, aged 14,10, and six years.

He has been in the transport business for six years, and it has been very profitable.This will be his first loan with KADET, and Stephen plans to use the loan to buy another motorcycle. With the anticipated profits, he plans to boost his wife's business with more stock for additional income.

In the future, Stephen hopes to invest more in the transport business by buying a passenger service vehicle. He also hopes to provide a better education to his children.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old, married and a father of six children. He is a maize and wheat farmer, and has been in this business for the last seven years with a monthly income of KES 11,000. 

He is taking his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, and this will facilitate him in his preparation of the farm and purchasing of farm inputs.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dream is to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and prepare the farmland.

loans.name: Sezerina Nanaa

texts.en:
Sezerina is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 12, two of whom go to school. 

Sezerina runs a general store and has been in business for two years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients and she is taking a loan of 700 SDG to purchase more goods.

In five years, she wants to open a big shop. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

She is happy to get loans from Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy items like sorghum, maize, etc

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora es socia del banco comunal “Fruto Bendito” del Distrito de Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos y solo uno de ellos vive aun en su casa.
 Son tres años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de papas, compra por sacos y luego lo vende por kilos a las bodegas de la zona, su esposo se desempeña como albañil.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 sacos de papas, 1 balanza, pagara el alquiler de la movilidad que la transporta para repartir su producto.
Está muy contenta porque ahora cuenta con un ingreso más para su hogar y podrá ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de los estudios de su hijo, agradece a Manuela por darle los préstamos cada vez que requiere.  Espera seguir trabajando hasta que su salud se lo permita.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the communal bank "Fruto Bendito" in the Manantay District, department of Ucayali.  She is 62, married and has two children, one of whom still lives at home.

For three years she has been working with Manuela Ramos and selling potatoes.  She buys sacks of potatoes and then sells them by the kilo to stores in the area.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

With the new loan in the amount of 1,300 PEN, she will buy five sacks of potatoes, a scale, and pay for vehicle rental to transport her product.

She is very happy because now she has extra income for her household and can help her husband with their son's education costs.  She is grateful to Manuela for the loans she receives whenever she needs one, and hopes to continue working as long as her health permits.

loans.use: To buy sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 41 years old and married, with three children who are in school. Magdalena works very hard to provide for them.

Magdalena runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional stock to sell.

Magdalena has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and spices. 

In the future, Magdalena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Cristina is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continuing to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 52 years old and married.

She runs a beauty products direct sales business in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell.

Sherlita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as lotion, perfumes, and cologne. 

In the future, Sherlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Angelo Arat

texts.en:
Angelo is a 36-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children between the ages of 8 and 12. Two of the children go to school. 

Angelo runs a general store and has been in business for two years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through loan officers' promotions and she is taking a loan of 700 SDG to purchase more goods.

In five years, she wants to open a big store. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

She is happy to get loans from Finance Sudan and looks forward to getting more loans as long as Kiva supports Finance Sudan.

loans.use: for buying items like, onions,beans, surghum etc

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres con Futuro" del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 
Lleva dos años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de pasamanería y lo hace en su misma casa, hace algún tiempo compró una vitrina donde exhibe sus productos, está acondicionando un espacio de su casa para poder implementar su negocio y no tenga que estar moviendo sus cosas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 ciento de ganchos, 1 ciento de carmines, 1 ciento de pilimilis, 1 caja de vaselina, 1 caja de peines, 50 vinchas, 1 caja de alfileres,  1caja de betún, 1 caja de desodorante en sache, 1 caja de leche magnesia.
Su hija es la que le ayuda con la atención a los clientes cuando está en su casa.
Ana María está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por la ayuda económica  prestada que con mucho gusto devuelve cada mes.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres con Futuro" in the Calleria District, department of Ucayali.  She is 45, married and has four children.

For two years she has been working with loans through Manuela Ramos.  She sells personal care items out of her home.  Some time ago she bought a display case for her products, and she is renovating a space in her house to be able to run the business without having to move her things around.

With the new loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN, she will buy: 100 hairs pins, 100 lipsticks, 100 hair bands, one box of vaselina, one box of combs, 50 headbands, one box of pins, one box of shoe polish, one box of sachet deodorant, and one box of milk of magnesia.

Ana María is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the financial support that she is happy to pay back every month.

loans.use: To buy hair pins, combs, bands, etc.

loans.name: Jesucito Geovanny

texts.es:
JESUCITO GEOVANNY tiene 23 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de unos familiares en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

JESUCITO GEOVANNY es albañil, Solicita el crédito para pagar la matricula en la universidad. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir estudiando para llegar hacer profesional.

La matricula la pagará en Guaranda. El sueño es poder ejercer la profesión. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar práctica instrumental.
texts.en:
Jesucito Geovanny, 23, is single and has no children.  He lives with relatives in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.

Jesucito Geovanny is a bricklayer who is requesting a loan to pay for university tuition.  The loan will help him continue his education so he can become a professional.

He will pay the tuition in Guaranda and his dream is to have a profession.  In his free time he enjoys playing an instrument.

loans.use: To pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 46 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are in school.

Janet is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Janet is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs on her farm.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past through NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Janet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for the pigs on her farm

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
This is Madel, age 29, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rene, and the mother of two children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Madel believes that a college diploma is the best legacy parents could leave to their children.

Madel operates an internet café. Now there is more need than before for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who use her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the internet and use social networks. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profits every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Madel dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work running her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Emedita

texts.en:
Emedita is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emedita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell to customers.

Emedita has been in this business for 35 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, Emedita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell to customers

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is 36 years old and married with two children.

Cindy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell.

Cindy has borrowed and repaid two loans through NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

For the future, Cindy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Elsie is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es:
JUAN PEDRO tiene 25 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los familiares en Guaranda Provinca de Bolívra.

JUAN PEDRO trabaja en una institución Privada. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar los animales para que la granja se mantenga bien.

Las compras lo hará en Guaranda. El sueño es poder tener una granja con muchos animales.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es surgir y superarse. En el tiempo libre le gusta ayudar a la familia.
texts.en:
Juan Pedro, 25, is single and has no children.  He lives with relatives in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.

Juan Pedro works at a private institution and is requesting a loan to buy chickens.  With the help of the loan he will be able to increase the number of animals at his farm to keep it running.

He will makes his purchases in Guaranda.  His dream is to have a farm with a lot of animals.

One of the challenges he faces is to better himself and his lifestyle.  In his free time he enjoys helping the family.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Gelcia

texts.es:
La señora Gelcia es socia del banco comunal “Dulce vida II” del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Lleva trabajando cuatro años con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y su negocio se ubica en un espacio dendtro de su propia casa porque se ubica en una avenida principal.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 cajas de cerveza, 7 cajas de gaseosas de diferentes sabores, 1 paquete de sorbete, 2 docenas de vasos, 1 paquete de agua mineral.
Su hijo le ayuda en su negocio cuando tiene que acomodar las bebidas y también en la atención a los clientes, su esposo es empleado público. 
Está agradecida con Manuela Ramos por los cuatro años que viene trabajando con ella.
texts.en:
Gelcia is a member of the communal bank "Dulce Vida II" in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali.  She is 47, married and has two children.

For four years she has been working with loans through Manuela Ramos.  She sells sodas out of a space in her own house, which is on the main avenue.

With the new loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN, she will buy: 10 cases of beer, seven cases of different flavored soda, one package of sorbet, two dozen cups, and one package of mineral water.

Her son helps her handle the beverages and with customer service.  Her husband is a public employee.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the four years she has been working with her.

loans.use: To buy sodas, beer and cups.
