She has been active in this business for 26 years and has generated a good return to date and earns about PHP 22,300.

Prior to this loan she took about PHP 10,000 to purchase livestock and feed and other supplies. This loan was successfully done and she was able to repay her amortization. 

Recently she join GDMPC and applied for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase feed for the pigs' growth and nourishment. She plans that in the near future a portion of the income generated will be reinvested into the business for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food sales business.

NWTF is relisting Condrada's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food sales business.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 28 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 5 years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her salon, where she plaits and treats hair as well as sells cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics, and will help Teopista to generate greater profits and expansion in business. Teopista hopes that in the future she will be able to reach a wholesale level. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teopista who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetable to sell for her business.

Susan has been in this business for 18 years. Susan earns more income from the general store.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
This is Tomasa, a 51-year-old resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, who is employed, and she is the mother of her children. By the grace of God, Tomasa has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to sustain their daily expenses.

Tomasa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Tomasa hopes to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
This is Pinky. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Pinky dreams of being able to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 65, is resident of Cavite, Philippines, and is married to Rolando, a jeepney operator. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a direct-selling business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Teresita sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer who has one month to pay on credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers gain as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also operates a canteen. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 44, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Teresita hopes to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 35 лет. В 2010 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Назира начала свой бизнес в торговле детской одеждой. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Назира сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 20,000 сом (KGS). Товар Назира закупает на рынке столицы, приезжая 2 раза в месяц и делая закуп в среднем на 30,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Назира обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Назира  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Nazira is 35 years old.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business of selling children's clothing in 2010.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Nazira was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  She buys merchandise valued at an average sum of 30,000 som (KGS) at a market in the capital twice per month.  Today, her merchandise selection is limited and this is why Nazira requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further development of her business.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store business.

NWTF is relisting Cresencia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her store like shampoo, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married and blessed with two children. She is 49 years old and lives at Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Narcisa owns and operates a specialized retail store selling jewelry. She has been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 13,200 PHP. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional jewelry and accessories to sell. 

Narcisa successfully repaid her previous loan. She extends her utmost thanks to the people who helped her. Now, she is requesting another loan to invest in her existing business to acquire more jewelry to sell and to increase her return. She hopes that her business will prosper with good inflows.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is 24 years old, married and a mother to one son. Her husband works raising sheep and farming, but his income isn't enough to cover the family's needs and pay the education expenses.
Amneh is studying at the university, specializing in business administration. Amneh wants to pay the university fees to complete her studies, so she is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Amneh and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is a sari-sari (convenience) store owner from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 45 years old, married, and has seven children, 10 to 24 years old. Martina is asking for a loan to buy rice, soft drinks, seasoning, eggs, noodles and toiletries. She aims to make her business more profitable by increasing her inventory. Her store is her main livelihood that provides for her family's basic needs. Her profit will then be used for her children's education and her family's healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, seasoning, eggs, noodles and toiletries.

loans.name: Aruna H

texts.en: Aruna is 28 years old and single. In 2007, after the death of his father, he left school and established a motorbikes business. He works seven days a week, 11 hours a day and earns about Le 1,000,000 a month. He is requesting a loan for Le 4,000,000 to buy a motorbike (for Le 3,480,000) and three mobile phones (for Le 140,000 each). He will use the remainder of the loan to pay for transport. In the future, Aruna plans to travel abroad and become an international business man. He is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and three mobile phones.

loans.name: Jacinta Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres con Futuro” del Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad.
Los quince años que está trabajando con el préstamo de Manuela Ramos le han servido de mucho porque ahora cuenta con habitaciones para dar en alquiler que le está generando buenos ingresos mensuales.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 bolsas de cemento, 1 metro de ripio, 1 metro de arena, 1 ciento de madera, una puerta de madera.
Las ganancias que genera éste negocio sirve para solventar sus gastos y seguir haciendo arreglos en su casa para poder tener sus ambientes adecuados y así poder alquilarlos.  Está muy agradecida por los préstamos brindados por Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the 'Mujeres con Futuro' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 60 years old, married, and has three grown-up children.

Jacinta has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 15 years and they have been a great help to her because she now has rooms which she is able to rent out and this is making her good monthly income.

Jacinta will use her new loan for 1,000 soles to buy: 5 bags of cement, 1 meter of gravel, 1 meter of sand, 100 wooden planks and a wooden door.

Jacinta uses the profits that she makes in her business to cover her costs and continue making repairs to her house so that her rooms are in good condition and she is able to rent them out.  She is very grateful for the loans she has received from Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Bai

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Bai. He is married and has four children aged 13, 10 (twins), and 6 years. In 2001, Bai established his clothing business, selling sneakers, shirts, skirts, shoes, t-shirts and jeans. He began his business as a means of earning his own living. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from his business and he would like to take out a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Bai has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase sneakers and men's shirts. In the future, Bai plans to educate his children, since he did not have the opportunity to be well educated. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and men's shirts for his clothing business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, 28, is married and has two children ages 3 and 4 years. In 2006, Mohamed established a business selling radios, tapes, flash drives, mp3, touch light, toys, etc. He started the business to be self reliant.  Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 . Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid three loans. Now, he requires a new loan to buy:
10 batteries Tape - 2 pieces @ Le300,000
Six batteries Tape - 3 pieces @ Le150,000
Four batteries Tape - 13 pieces @ Le80,000
Three batteries Tape - 6 pieces @ Le45,000,
Three batteries Radio - 1 carton @ Le1,080,000
Three batteries USB Radio - 12 pieces @ Le55,000
Four batteries Radio - 8 pieces @ Le55,000
Two batteries Radio - 18 pieces @ Le25,000. 
The balance, Le 60, 000, will be used for transport. In the future, Mohamed plans to build a house, and acquire a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy batteries for his electronics business.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en: Araceli is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more items to sell in her general store. Her other business, which involves selling clothing and which she funded though NWTF and Kiva, continues to provide Araceli and her family with an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nestor Ruperto

texts.es:
NESTOR RUPERTO tiene 47 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en casa de unos familiares en Guaranda provincia de los Ríos.

 NESTOR RUPERTO es guardia, además se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para comprar un terreno. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar el terreno y sembrar maíz. 

La compra lo hará en Ventanas. El sueño es sembrar más hectareas de terreno maíz suave. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y jugar indor.
texts.en: Nestor Ruperto is 47 years old, single and has one child. He lives with his child in a family member's house in Guaranda, in los Ríos province. Nestor Ruperto is a policeman who also farms. He is requesting this loan to buy a plot of land. With the help of this loan he will be able to buy the plot of land and grow corn. He will make his purchase in Ventanas. His dream is to sow more hectares of land with 'soft maize' (zea mays amylacea). In his free time, Nestor Ruperto enjoys resting and playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Nancy Noemi

texts.es:
NANCY NOEMI tiene 38 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

NANCY NOEMI es empleada doméstica. Solicita el crédito para comprar una refrigeradora, mocroondas, cocina. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta. 

La compra lo hará en Ventanas.

El sueño es poder tener un restaurante. En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir.
texts.en:
Nancy Noemí is 38 years old, single and has two children.  She lives with her children in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

Nancy Noemí is a domestic worker.  She is requesting this loan to buy a refrigerator, microwave and stove.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs.  She will make her purchases in Ventanas.

Nancy Noemí's dream is to own a restaurant.  In her free time she likes to sleep.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, microwave and stove

loans.name: Evylen

texts.en:
Evylen is married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evylen is 32 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Evylen has a videoke rental business in the Philippines. Evylen requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional unit of videoke for her business.

Evylen has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Evylen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit of videoke for her business.

loans.name: Osman Malam

texts.en: Osman Malam is 43 years old, married and the father of seven children who range in age from 6 to 28 years old. In 2009, he went into the business of selling school and traveling bags. He did this because he wanted to generate his own income and be self-reliant. He now works seven days a week, 12 hours a day, and earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He is requesting a loan for Le 3,000,000 to buy 50 more traveling bags (for Le. 35,000 each) and 50 more school bags (for Le. 25,000 each) to sell to his customers. In the future, he plans to expand his business so that his children have a bright future and get the kind of education he was not able to have. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more school and traveling bags to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
La señora Camila, es socia del banco comunal “Fruto Bendito” del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos, solo dos de ellos están a su cargo.
Desde hace 2 años trabaja con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad (comestibles), tiene instalada en su propia casa una pequeña bodega.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: una caja de leche, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de mantequilla, 1 caja de condimentos, 3 paquetes de papel higiénico, una caja de te filtro, 1caja de nescafe, 1 caja de mermelada
Este negocio que está en crecimiento le permite pagar las cuotas del préstamo brindado por Manuela Ramos, cada mes cumple con sus pagos a tiempo, tiene mucho que agradecer  por la oportunidad que le dieron para pertenecer a este banco comunal en el que se siente muy contenta.
texts.en:
Camila is a member of the “Blessed Fruit” Communal Bank in Manantay District, Ucayali department. She is 43 years old, married, and has 5 children, 2 of whom are still under her care.

For nearly 2 years now she has worked with loans from Manuela Ramos. Camila sells articles of primary necessity (groceries) at her little store, installed in her own home.

With her new loan of 1,700 new sols, Camila will buy a case of milk, a sack of sugar, a bag of rice, a box of cooking oil, a carton of butter, a case of condiments, 3 packets of toilet paper, a carton of tea bags, a box of Nescafe, and a case of marmalade.

This business, which is growing, will permit Camila to repay the loan offered through Manuela Ramos. Each month she will make her payments on time. Camila has much to be tankful for, including the opportunity she has been given to belong to this communal bank, in which she feels very content.

loans.use: to buy butter, milk and other merchandise for the little grocery store she operates from her home.

loans.name: Oscar Urbamey

texts.es:
OSCAR URBAMEY tiene 22 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con los padres en ventanas provincia de los rïos.

OSCAR URBAMEY es chofer en una cooperativa de transporte. Solicita el crédito para comprar una moto. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la moto para poder movilizarce al trabajo pués. 

La compra lo hará en Quinsaloma. El sueño es poder tener una casa propia. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
Oscar Urbamey is 22 years old, single and has two children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

Oscar Urbamey works as a driver in a transport cooperative.  He is requesting this loan to buy a motorcycle.  With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy a motorcycle for traveling to and from work.  He will make his purchase in Quinsaloma.

Oscar Urbamey's dream is to own his own home.  In his free time, he enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is 46 years old and married. Lydia has only three grown dependents. Lydia owns and operates a retail store buying and selling charcoal. 

Lydia has been able to manage the specialized retail store well and she has been in this business for about four years. Each month she earns PHP 12000 from her business undertakings. 

Prior to this loan, Lydia applied for a loan for the purpose of purchasing new items to expand her business and it really worked.

Presently, Lydia joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She is requesting a loan of the amount of PHP 25000 to purchase additional charcoal to sell. Charcoal is used for cooking. 

Lydia's profit gain will help to sustain further the business and sell more charcoal to increase the income obtained.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Kadiatu J

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has two children aged 4 years and 5 months old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her in foster care.  

In 1998, Kadiatu established her vegetable oil, flour, sugar, tomato paste, butter, ketchup, Maggi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews), mayonnaise, etc. business. She began her business because she did not have the opportunity to attend school. She used to assist her uncle's wife in business. When she got married, her husband gave her some amount of money to start a business.  

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Kadiatu  requires a loan in order to buy eggs - 5 cartons @ Le220,000, Maggi - 3 cartons @ Le175,000, vegetable oil - 3 rubber containers @ Le155,000, sugar - 3 bags @ Le240,000, mayonnaise - 1 carton @ Le190,000.  

In the future, Kadiatu plans to build a house, provide quality education for her children, and acquire a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy eggs - 5 cartons @ Le220,000, Maggi - 3 cartons @ Le175,000, vegetable oil - 3 rubber containers @ Le155,000, sugar - 3 bags @ Le240,000, mayonnaise - 1 carton @ Le190,000.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a halo-halo business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12500 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her halo-halo.

Emelda has been in this business for 5 years. Emelda earns more income from a welding shop.

Emelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her halo-halo.

loans.name: Dalisay

texts.en:
Dalisay is 51 years old and married with 5 children. With 2 children in school, Dalisay works very hard to provide for them.

Dalisay runs a charcoal and firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal & firewood to sell.

Dalisay has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Dalisay would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of charcoal & firewood to sell

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita, 64 years old, is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is living on her own since she is not married, but she works hard in order to support herself and extend a hand to her relatives. She owns a sari-sari store (convenience store), which she started four years ago. Lucita is asking for a loan to buy gasoline, canned goods and rice to sell in her store. By expanding her merchandise, she is more confident of meeting her future needs. Her profits will be used for her family's daily expenses and savings.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, canned goods and rice

loans.name: Chynarkan

texts.ru:
Чынаркан 51 год, замужем, воспитывает сына 16 лет. Чынаркан на протяжении 16 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 4,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Чынаркан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  25 овец. Продажа мяса и мясных продуктов приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец для приплода.  Доходы от кредита Чынаркан планирует вложить в оплату образования для ее сына.
texts.en: Chynarkan is 51 years old, married and raising a 16 year-old son.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for 16 years, having started this business with a sum of 4,000 som.  Thanks to her hard work, today Chynarkan's business contains 25 sheep.  Sales of meat and meat products yield about 5,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Chynarkan requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase sheep for offspring.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into paying for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Cholponay

texts.ru:
Чолпонай  - лидер группы «Илим - 1», ей 36 лет, работает преподавателем математики в школе села Ноокен. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Чолпонай на протяжении 7 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 1,500 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпонай в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  20 овец и 1 корова, продажа молока и мяса приносит около 20,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпонай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Чолпонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства.
texts.en: Cholponay is the leader of the "Ilim-1" group.  She is 36 years old and works as a mathematics teacher at the Nooken village school.  To provide an additional source of income for her family, Cholponay has been involved in animal husbandry for seven years, having started this business with a sum of 1,500 som.  Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 20 sheep and one cow, and the sales of milk and meat yield about 20,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Cholponay requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane réside au Sénégal. Il est célibataire. Il vit sous le toit   familial   et  prend en charge le  paiement  des factures d’électricité en guise de participation aux frais de la maison. Il est employé dans une bijouterie qui se trouve dans sa localité d’habitation. Il exerce   cette activité  depuis  1999.  Membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC, il sollicite un  crédit d’un montant de 100.000 francs CFA pour acheter de l’or avec lequel il va fabriquer des bagues pour l’offrir a sa maman. Son  est  de faire plaisir a sa mère. Dans l’avenir, son plus grand souhait est d’acquérir  une bijouterie qui lui est propre.
texts.en:
Mister Ousmane lives in Sénégal. He is single. He lives in the family home and takes care of paying the electricity bills as a way of participating in the household expenses. 

He is employed in a jewelry store which is located in the region where he lives. He has been practicing this business since 1999. 

A member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC, he is requesting a loan of the sum of 100,000 FCFA to buy gold with which he is going to make rings to give to his mom. His goal is to please his mother. In the future, his greatest wish is to have his own jewelry store.

loans.use: to buy gold to make rings.

loans.name: Juansito

texts.es:
Juansito tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive en el Municipio de Yamaranguila, La Esperanza.
Juansito la actividad que le genera ingresos es la agricultura. El se dedica a la siembra de brócoli, coliflor, lechuga y remolacha. Vende su producto fresco en el mercado local, recibiendo buen precio por la venta. Además de la experiencia porque desde joven el se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra junto a su padre. La zona donde vive es apta para los cultivos y trabaja todo el día para darle una buena asistencia.
El solicita su segundo préstamo de 11,000 lempiras para la compra de semillas de coliflor, brócoli, abono e insecticida para darle una mejor asistencia a los cultivos para aumentar la producción y vender un buen producto.

Su meta es trabajar y con las ganancias que obtenga ahorrar para el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juansito, age 39, is married and has six children.  He lives in the Yamarangila municipality in La Esperanza.

The business activity that generates income for Juansito is agriculture.  He grows broccoli, cauliflower, lettuce, and beets.  He sells his product fresh at the local market, and he receives a good price for the sale.  Also, he has experience because ever since he was a young man he worked the land together with his father.  The area where he lives is suitable for the crops.  He works all day in order to give them good care.

He is requesting his second loan for 11,000 lempiras in order to buy cauliflower and broccoli seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide.  He will do this in order to give the crops better care.  He will do this so that he can increase production and sell a good product.

His goal is to work and to save the income that he gets for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cauliflower and broccoli seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: Don Filemon, cliente Kiva es un humilde agricultor que habita en la zona Isiqui- Estelí, casado, padre de dos hijos que están a su cargo. El se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde los 15 años de edad con ayuda de un amigo, Filemon dice que su primer préstamo fue de ayuda porque pudo invertir en el mantenimiento de su cosecha además con  la ganancia que le quedo logro reparar sus cercas para evitar el paso de los animales a su parcela, utilizo el crédito para comprar los insumos que le hacían falta para sembrar maíz y frijol, el cual permitió obtener buenos rendimientos de la cosecha, incrementaron sus ventas generando a la vez mejores ganancias, pero el quiere diversificarse aun mas en productos para poder satisfacer a sus clientes es por ese motivo que hoy en día solicita de un nuevo crédito al igual para invertir en su cosecha para comprar  insumos, abono, fertilizantes, etc, para sembrar una manzana de frijol y una manzana de maíz. Filemon estima  que esta nueva inversión será de gran ayuda pues podrá mantener su negocio activo, podra  incrementar aun más sus ventas con el objetivo de mejorar sus ganancias, sus planes futuros es cancelar el préstamo con las ganancias que le genere la cosecha, sus metas próximas es seguir trabajando en su negocio para ampliar el numero de áreas sembradas, espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para lograr sus sueños  y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Filemon is a Kiva client.  He is a humble farmer who lives in Isiqui, Estelí.  Filemon is married and the father of two children who are in his care.  He has been growing corn and beans with the help of a friend since he was 15 years old.  He says that his first loan was helpful because he was able to invest in maintaining his crops.  He also used the profits that he made to repair his fences so that he could prevent animals from coming onto his plot of land.  He used his loan to buy the supplies that he needed for growing his corn and beans.  This enabled him to enjoy a good yield at harvest time.  His sales increased and he made better profits.  However, he would like to buy more products in order to further satisfy his customers.  He is requesting a new loan to invest in buying supplies, manure, fertilizers, etc. so that he can sow one 'manzana' (1.68 acres) with beans and another with corn.  Filemon believes that this new investment will be a lot of help as he will be able to keep his business running and further increase his sales with the aim of improving his profits.  His future plans are to repay his loan with the profits that he makes from his harvest.  His immediate goals are to continue working in his business and to expand the area over which he grows his crops.  He hopes to receive Kiva's support in fulfilling his dreams and providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, manure, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for furniture making.

Teresita has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for furniture making

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is married with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dina is 39 years old and has 6 children who are in school.

Dina has an ice cream business in the Philippines. Dina requested a loan of PHP 11500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

Dina has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Dina would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

loans.name: Thimana

texts.en:
Thimana is 38 years old and lives in the town of Paidha in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Thimana has been working hard to manage his produce, which sells sorghum flour in the market. 

To help expand his business, Thimana has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of sorghum for resale, and will help Thimana to generate greater profits and buy more stock. Thimana hopes that in the future he will be able to use loan profits to pay fees and medical expenses. 

Thimana is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Thimana who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sorghum for resale

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Alfreda has been in this business for 34 years. Alfreda earns more income from pig raising, vegetable vending and sari-sari store.

Alfreda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Darlinda

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Darlinda. She is married and has four children aged 11, 8, 4 and 2 years. In 2009, Darlinda established a business selling wax and local printed cotton. She began her business because when she dropped out of school in form 3, she had to join her mother at work because she did not have anyone to pay her school fees. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from her business. She would like to take out a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Darlinda has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more wax and cotton. In the future, Darlinda plans to open another outlet and even become a supplier. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax and cotton for her retail business

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en: Mbalu is 43 years old, married and the mother of five children who range in age from 7 to 22 years old. In 2007, she went into the business of selling food items such as oil, salt, mayonnaise, butter, flour, milk, eggs and sugar. She began this business because her parents did not send her to school, and instead had her work with her mother. Now she has a business of her own, works seven days a week, 11 hours a day, and earns about Le 748,000 a month. She is requesting a loan for Le 4,000,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers, including mayonnaise, flour, couscous, salt, shrimps and luncheon meats. In the future, Mbalu plans to open a large store so she can earn enough money to provide her children with a higher education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Razykan

texts.ru:
Разыкан  - участник группы «Илим - 1», ей 32 года, работает преподавателем литературы в школе села Ноокен. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Разыкан на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Разыкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  20 овец и 3 коровы, продажа молока и мяса приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. Дополнительно, Разыкан обрабатывает 0,75 га земли , где выращивает хлопок и кукурузу.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Разыкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота и удобрений для земли.  Доходы от кредита Разыкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства, чтобы в будущем иметь возможность обучить детей в хорошем ВУЗе.
texts.en: Razykan is a participant of the "Ilim-1" group.  She is 32 years old and works as a literature teacher at the Nooken village school.  To provide an additional source of income for her family, Razykan has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for five years, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som.  Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 20 sheep and three cows, and the sales of milk and meat yield about 15,000 som per month.  Additionally, Razykan works on 0.75 hectares of land, where she grows cotton and corn.  In order to further develop her business, Razykan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock and fertilizers for the soil.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business in order to have a future ability to educate her children at a good university.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizers

loans.name: Elver

texts.es: Ever de 45 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge  y sus tres hijos en las edades de 6 a 18 años, en un municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tienen el negocio de vender carnes frías, el cual inició cuando comprando algunas ofertas en un volumen importante, vendió al detalle y empezó a generar utilidades; su primer mercado lo conformaron los vecinos de su barrio y gradualmente fue creciendo, hasta abordar las tiendas de su sector, con las cuales hoy trabaja, le  ha ido muy bien y en las que tiene un potencial de crecimiento, si se extiende hacia otros sectores del mismo municipio. Sus compras las hace a distribuidores mayorista de la ciudad de Barranquilla y sus ventas las realiza a crédito con pagos semanales por parte de su clientela, aunque tiene también algunas ventas de contado. En la medida en que su negocio se extiende, su capital de trabajo parece insuficiente para atender la demanda del día a día y esto se ha convertido en uno de sus desafíos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará una mayor cantidad de carnes frías, para responder a los pedidos solicitados en su preventa de mercados a su alrededor y   que a futuro con un nuevo capital de trabajo le permitirá abordar poco a poco los mercados de los municipios, que es la meta en la que mas adelante está enfocado.
texts.en:
Ever, 45, lives with his spouse and their three children whose ages range from 6 to 18 years in a town very near the city of Barranquilla.  They have a business there selling cold cuts that he started by buying some offers in considerable amount.  He sold at retail and started to generate profits.  His initial market was composed of his neighbors and gradually grew to include local stores he works with at present.  He’s done very well and has growth potential if he moves into other sectors in the same town.

He makes his purchases from wholesale distributors in the city of Barranquilla and he sells on credit collecting weekly payments from his customers although he also has some cash sales.  As his business grows, his working capital becomes insufficient to meet daily demand and this has become one of his challenges which is the reason why he’s calling on his Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy a large amount of cold cuts to respond to pending orders in his market and surrounding areas and that in the future with new working capital will allow him to gradually access markets in other towns which is the goal he’s focused on for later on.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of cold cuts.

loans.name: Weichafe Ruka Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Weichafe Ruka” (casa de guerrero), está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de leña, repostería, venta de perfumes, venta de pan amasado, venta de carbón, venta de ropa, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Angol.
Elizabeth, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas, vistiendo un poleron de color negro con letras blancas, su cabello es de color negro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de repostería, específicamente en tortas y pasteles, desde hace 4 años. Comenta que trabaja con la ayuda de madre, de lunes a viernes y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que su hija es pequeña.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes supermercados de la ciudad, y en distribuidoras de moldes para tortas.
Con el crédito comprará harina, huevos, aceites, mantequilla, decoraciones, para realizar sus tortas.
Una de las metas de Elizabeth en su negocio, son tener la oportunidad de instalar un local amplio en su propia casa, en el cual pueda atender a sus clientes.
Elizabeth vive junto a sus padres y su hija de 9 meses de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es instalar un local apto para ventas de tortas y pasteles, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Angol se ubica a 128 km. al noroeste de Temuco (capital de la novena región) y a 608 km. al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). Su nombre significa en mapudungun (lengua del pueblo mapuche) “subida a gatas”. Sus habitantes se dedican fuertemente a labores agrícolas y silvo agropecuarias, áreas en las que actualmente han adquirido relevancia, particularmente, aquellas vinculadas a la producción frutícola y hortícola.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named “Weichafe Ruka” (Home of the Warrior).  It is comprised of 17 entrepreneurs who devote themselves to different fields of work.  Among them you can find selling firewood, baking, selling perfumes, selling 'pan amasado' (a type of Chilean bread), selling charcoal, selling clothes, and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Angol. 

Elizabeth is the president of the communal bank.  She can be seen kneeling in the photo, and she is wearing a black shirt with white letters.  Her hair is black, and she wears it pulled back.  She devotes herself to baking.  Specifically, she has been making cakes and pastries for four years.  She says that her mother helps her work from Mondays through Fridays.  She makes her work schedule according to her availability because his daughter is little.  She buys her merchandise at different supermarkets in the city and at cake pan distributors.

She will use the loan to buy flour, eggs, cooking oils, butter, and decorations to make her cakes.  One of Elizabeth’s goals in her business is to have the opportunity to set up a spacious area in her own house where she could tend to her customers.

Elizabeth lives with her parents and her nine month old daughter.  Her dream, on a work level, is to set up a suitable place to sell cakes and pastries.  She wants to do this in order to generate greater income and adopt a better quality of life for her family.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza.  The loan will allow her to invest in her business.  Also, she feels comfortable with her communal bank, which motivates her to continue participating in the institution.  She says that in addition to the trainings, they have been useful to her in investing better in her business.

Angol is located 128 kilometers to the northeast of Temuco (capital of the ninth region) and 608 kilometers to the south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  In Mapudungun (language of the Mapuche pueblo) its name means “Climb Up”.  Its inhabitants are vigorously devoted to farming and forestry.  These areas have currently taken on importance, especially those involving fruit and vegetable production.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, cooking oils, butter, and decorations to make her cakes.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замира  - участник группы «Илим - 1», ей 50 лет, работает преподавателем кыргызского языка и литературы в школе села Ноокен. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Замира на протяжении 12 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 2,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  5 овец и 1 корова, продажа молока и мяса приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц. Дополнительно, Замира обрабатывает 0,50 га земли, где выращивает хлопок и кукурузу.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота и удобрений для земли.  Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства.
texts.en: Zamira is a participant of the "Ilim-1" group.  She is 50 years old and works as a Kyrgyz language and literature teacher at the Nooken village school.  To provide an additional source of income for her family, Zamira has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 12 years, having started this business with a sum of 2,000 som.  Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains five sheep and one cow, and the sales of milk and meat yield about 8,000 som per month.  Additionally, Zamira works on 0.50 hectares of land, where she grows cotton and corn.  In order to further develop her business, Zamira requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock and fertilizers for the soil.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fetilizers

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou  vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le secteur du commerce. Nonobstant les obstacles, elle s’est  orientée vers la vente de  balles de friperie depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle a déjà remboursé 3 prêts antérieurs au sein du guichet de l’U-IMCEC où elle est membre. Cherchant toujours à développer  son activité commercial, elle sollicite un  crédit de 150.000 francs CFA prévu  pour s’approvisionner d’avantage en balles de friperie  afin qu’elle puisse augmenter son stock et répondre a la demande croissante  de sa clientèle. Son  objectif escompté est de devenir indépendant financièrement ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter son taux d’épargne et de bonifier les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madam Seynabou lives in Sénégal. She is married and active in business. In spite of obstacles, she has been selling secondhand clothing for more than 20 years. She has already repaid 3 previous loans to the UIMCEC branch where she is a member. 

Always seeking to develop her business, she is requesting a loan of 150,000 FCFA to stock up in secondhand clothing in order to be able to expand her stock and respond to the growing demand from her clientèle. Her expected objective is to become financially independent which will allow her to increase her savings and to improve the nutrition of her family.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to resell.

loans.name: Elvia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Elvia es una humilde ama de casa de 52 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de  cuatro hijos de los cuales solo el menor  esta a su cargo. Ella además de  encargarse del manejo del hogar también es comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería, actividad que inicio  con la venta de leña y frijoles cocidos, luego vio que el negocio era rentable pues le generaba ingresos diarios y  hace 4 años establece su propio negocio en su casa de habitación, decide invertir en una mini pulpería, después con el apoyo de instituciones financieras  fue invirtiendo en su inventario para ofrecer a los clientes variedad de productos, en su pulpería  recibe el apoyo de sus hijos que le ayudan en sus tiempos libres además  su esposo y hijos le dan dinero para que se ayude  con los gastos del hogar como otros ingresos, su expectativa es mantener su negocio activo con productos de alta demanda por sus clientes es por ese motivo que requiere del préstamo para comprar aceite, arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevo, etc, el cual estima será de ayuda ya que podrá surtir  su negocio con todo tipo de producto para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del negocio y diversificarse en productos para obtener mayores ingresos y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Elvia is a humble 52-year-old housewife from Granada.  She is married and the mother of four children.  Only her youngest child is still in her care.  In addition to running her home, Elvia also has a grocery store business.  She started out selling firewood and cooked beans.  Seeing that her business was profitable as it made her daily income, she decided four years ago to set up her own store at home.  She decided to invest in a small grocery store.  With the support of financial institutions, she invested in buying stock so that she could offer her customers a variety of products.  She has the support of her children who help her in their free time.  Her husband and children also give her money to help with the household expenses.  This is another source of income.  Her goal is to keep her business active by selling products that are in high demand with her customers.  She needs this loan to buy oil, rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs etc.  She believes that this will be helpful as she will be able to stock her business with all kinds of products in order to meet the needs of her customers.  Her future plans are to expand her business area and to diversify her stock so that she can make more income and get ahead in life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs etc.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a biscuits retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 49500 through NWTF to buy items of biscuits to sell to her customers.

NWTF is relisting Robina 's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Rugiatu. She is married and has a child aged 7 years. She has one additional dependent.

In 2006, Rugiatu established her restaurant business, serving tea and bread, fried fish, achekeh (a cassava, spaghetti and egg dish), beans, etc. She began her business as she stopped Form 4, unable to proceed further because of a lack of concentration in school. She got married, and her husband gave her some amount of money to start a business.  

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,600,000 Sierra Leone leone (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy vegetable oil (five rubbers at Le180,000 each), gari or cassava flakes (five bags at Le120,000 each), eggs (five cartons at Le240,000 each), ketchup (10 cartons at Le60000 each), spaghetti (two cartons at Le75,000 each), mayonnaise (four cartons at Le260,000 each). The balance of Le10,000 will be used to pay laborers to transport the goods. In the future, Rugiatu plans to assist her husband to construct their own house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil, gari (cassava flakes), eggs, ketchup, spaghetti and mayonnaise and pay laborers to transport the goods.

loans.name: Ya Umu

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Ya Umu.  She is married and has 5 children, aged 15, 17, 22, 25 and 29 years. In 1991, Ya Umu established her jeans, skirts, shirts, shoes, travelling bags, school bags, polo, lacost etc. business. She began her business because her father didn't allow his girl children to attend school.  She was sent to school by her step-mother and at Class 2, her father stopped her.  Her step-mother introduced her to business. After she was fully matured, her parents gave her hand in marriage to a businessman. Her husband established a business for her. 
 
Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Ya Umi earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Ya Umu has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy school bags - 4 dozen @ SLL 300,000, shoes - 3 dozen @ SLL 360,000, jeans (men) - 2 dozens @ SLL 408,000, jeans (women) - 3 dozens @ SLL 336,000, travelling bags - 1 dozen @ SLL 360,000.  The balance of SLL 36,000 will be used for transportation costs. 

In the future, Ya Umu plans to open another shop, to provide quality education for her children, and to become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy school bags - 4 dozens @ SLL300,000, shoes - 3 dozens @ SLL360,000, jeans (men) - 2 dozens @ SLL408,000, jeans (women) - 3 dozens @ SLL336,000, travelling bags - 1 dozen @ SLL360,000.  The balance SLL36, 000 will be used for transport.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Paul is 46 years old and lives in the town of Olkalou with his wife and five children, who range in age from five to 25 years old. For the last 10 years, he has worked as a farmer, and he is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD. to buy fertilizer and maize seedlings. He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru:
Салтанат  60 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Салтанат на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 2,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  14 овец, 3 коровы и теленок, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салтанат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Салтанат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства.
texts.en: Saltanat 60 years old, married and is a mother of five children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 30 years, having started this business with a sum of 2,000 som.  Thanks to her hard work, today Saltanat's business contains 14 sheep, three cows and a calf, and the sales of milk and milk products yield about 15,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Saltanat requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Bukaticha

texts.ru: Букатича – лидер группы «Астра», ей  34 года, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. В 2008 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Букатича начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Букатича  сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 3 коровы,4 бычка и  ежемесячным доходом около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Букатича обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Букатича планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в будущем обучить сына.
texts.en: Bukaticha is the leader of the "Astra" group.  She is 34 years old, married and raising two children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry and farming in 2008 with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Bukaticha was able to develop her business to contain three cows and four bulls, and have a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Bukaticha requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business in order to have a future ability to educate her son.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Saliou est un forgeron qui fabrique des marmites, des fourneaux ainsi que des cuisinières artisanales.Il fabrique ces ustensiles en récupérant du fer et de l’aluminium.Saliou est marié et père de trois enfants..Il utilise les revenus tirés de son activité pour prendre en charge des besoins alimentaires, vestimentaires et sanitaires de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son capital, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour confectionner des marmites, des fourneaux,des fourneaux et des calebasses.Il vient de rembourser à l'avance un pret de 400000.
texts.en: Saliou is a blacksmith who makes pots, stoves as well as cookers by craft. He makes these implements by recuperating iron and aluminum. Saliou is married and father to three children. He uses the income from his business to take care of the food, clothing and sanitary needs of his family. In order to strengthen his capital, he is requesting a loan of 400,000f to make pots, stoves and gourds. He has just repaid a loan of 400,000 in advance.

loans.use: to make pots, stoves and gourds.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Moustapha est un homme marié.Il est père de quatre enfants dont les trois fréquentent l'école primaire.Il exerce un commerce de produits agricoles notamment de céréales comme le mil et le maïs.Les revenus tirés de ce commerce lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins alimentaires, sanitaires, vestimentaires de sa famille ainsi qu'à ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500 000 f pour acheter des céréales.Son ambition est de s'engager dans la vente en gros.
texts.en: Moustapha is a married man. He is father to four children of whom three go to primary school. He has a business selling agricultural products notably cereals like mil and corn. The income generated from this business allows him to meet the food, sanitary and clothing needs of his family as well as his own needs. In order to strengthen his working capital, he is requesting a loan of 500,000f to buy cereals. His goal is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Jose Anselmo

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, vive en un barrio de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
José tiene un negocio de venta de Jugos. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en los alrededores de la ciudad ofreciendo  jugos de frutas envasados como de naranja, de caña de azúcar, también vende hierbas medicinales como quiebra piedra, calaguala etc. Manifiesta que este negocio es rentable y hasta el momento ha podido solventar las necesidades de su familia.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 2,300 lempiras para comprar insumos para la elaboración de los jugos como naranjas, azúcar, botes plásticos para envasarlos y también otra parte la invertirá en comprar unas láminas de zinc  para cambiarle al techo de su casa que esta ya deteriorado.
Su plan es trabajar duro para tener el capital necesario para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y también poder pagar los estudios de su hija.
texts.en:
José, age 36, is in a common-law marriage and has a ten year old daughter.  He lives in a neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

José has a business selling juices.  He sells in an itinerant manner in the outskirts of the city.  He sells bottled fruit juices like orange and sugar cane.  He also sells medicinal herbs like “quiebra piedra” [frequently used as a remedy for bladder and kidney stones] and calaguala [frequently used for psoriasis], etc.  He says that this business is profitable, and so far he has been able to pay for his family’s necessities.

He is requesting a loan for 2,300 lempiras to buy supplies to make the juices.  He will buy supplies like oranges, sugar, and plastic containers to bottle them.  He will use part of the loan to buy zinc sheeting to change the roof of the house, which is in very bad condition.

His plan is to work hard in order to have the capital he needs to improve the condition of his house and to also be able to pay for his daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy supplies like oranges, sugar, and plastic containers to bottle the juices and to buy zinc sheeting to change the roof of the house.

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal “Las Fresitas” del Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad y con familia.
Son 27 ciclos los que lleva con su banquito comunal, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos de doble pechuga especialmente para el día 24 de junio en que se celebra el día de "San Juan".

Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 50 pollos bebes doble pechuga, 1 saco de purina crecimiento, 2 sacos de comida balanceada, 1 pomo vitamina, 1 vacuna para pollo, 1 litro de creso, ½ saco de cal, 2 bebederos, 2 comederos.
El espacio que tiene para criar los pollos es pequeño y como recién está empezando le alcanza solo para esa cantidad, le gustaría tener más capital y hacer un corral más grande, espera que Manuela Ramos aumente los montos de los créditos para que pueda invertir más y poder armar un pequeño galpón para pollos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Las Fresitas” communal bank in Calleria District in Ucayali Department.  She’s 49-years-old, has a spouse and four adult children with families of their own.

She’s been in her communal bank for 27 cycles.  She raises double-breasted chickens especially for June 24th which is the feast day of St. John.

She will use her new 3000 new sol loan to buy 50 double-breasted chicks, one sack of Purina feed, two sacks of nutritionally balanced feed, one jar of vitamins, 1 vaccine for chicks, 1 liter of Cresol [disinfectant], ½-sack of lime powder, two drinking troughs and two feeders.

The space she has available for raising the chickens is small and since she’s just starting out she can only fit in that number.  She’d like to have more capital to build a larger corral and hopes that Manuela Ramos will increase loan amounts so that she can invest more and be able to build a small coop for the chickens.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 57-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has four children aged 16, 22, 26, and 32 years. 

In 2002, Kadiatu established her provisions business where she sells soft drinks, Foam Surf (laundry detergent), sachet milk (small containers of milk), rice, sugar, sweets, charcoal, etc. She began her business because her parents were only subsistence farmers and she was introduced to farming. At the age of 17, she got married and her husband introduced her to business.  

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Kadiatu  requires a loan in order to buy sugar - 3 bags @ Le225,000, salt - 5 bags @ Le23,000, rice - 3 bags @ Le140,000, onions - 3 bags @ Le100,000, palm oil - 5 rubber containers @ Le100,000, vegetable oil - 4 rubber containers  @ Le100,000, biscuits - 4 cartons @ Le85,000, Maggi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews) - 2 cartons @ Le125,000. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to build another house and expand the business. She is a hardworking business woman and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sugar - 3 bags @ Le225,000, salt - 5 bags @ Le23,000, rice - 3 bags @ Le140,000, onions - 3 bags @ Le100,000, palm oil - 5 rubber containers @ Le100,000, vegetable oil - 4 rubber containers  @ Le100,000, biscuits - 4 cartons @ Le85,000, Maggi - 2 cartons @ Le125,000.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Isatu. She is married and has 5 children, aged 7, 10, 13, 16, and 19 years. In 1996, Isatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because her foster parents didn't send her to school but had her assist them in business.  When she was mature, she got married to a tailor who gave her an amount of money to be selling palm oil. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Isatu has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans. She now requires a new loan in order to  buy palm oil - 5 drums @ SLL900,000. In the future, Isatu plans to acquire a store, to educate her children and to build a house. This loan will help to increase her income and improve the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil - 5 drums @ SLL900,000.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Emma. She is married and has 4 children, aged 10, 13, 16 and 19 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her because she got her from the war.  

In 2009, Emma established her onions, maggi (boullion cubes/powder), mayonnaise, salt, butter, pop corn, baking powder, ketchup etc. business. She began her business because she stopped schooling at form I due to poverty.  She later got her teacher certificate and taught for 2 years but because of poor condition of service, she left and started a business.  

Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Emma requires a loan in order to purchase Maggi - 4 cartons @ SLL 290,000, sugar - 2 bags @ SLL 255,000, vegetable oil - 5 rubbers @ SLL 160,000, tin tomatoes 12 cartons @ SLL 42,000, salt - 1 bundle @ SLL 20,000.  The balance of SLL 6,000 will be used to pay laborers to carry the items.  

In the future, Emma plans to acquire a shop, provide quality education for her children and to become an international business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy maggi - 4 cartons @SLL 290,000, sugar - 2 bags @ SLL 255,000, vegetable oil - 5 rubbers @ SLL 160,000, tin tomatoes 12 cartons @ SLL 42,000, salt - 1 bundle @ SLL 20,000.  The balance of SLL 6,000 will be used to pay laborers to carry the items

loans.name: Iris Yaneth

texts.es:
Iris, tiene 30 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene una hija, vive en el Municipio de Azacualpa. 
Iris Yaneth es muy trabajadora, tiene 2 años de tener establecido un negocio de vender mercadería como, ropa interior, de mujer y de hombre, calcetas, calcetines, camisas y blusas. Ella anteriormente trabajaba en una funeraria. Logró establecer su propio negocio. De este negocio obtiene los ingresos necesarios para el estudio de su hija y los gastos del hogar. 
Su meta es ver el negocio más surtido y con sus ganancias cubrir gastos de estudio de su hija hasta que se gradúe y llegar a tener su propia vivienda. Con este préstamo va comprar más ropa interior, calcetines y camisas, para aprovechar esta temporada de venta.
texts.en:
Iris, 30, is a single mother; she has a daughter and lives in the town of Azacualpa.

Iris Yaneth is very hardworking.  She’s been selling merchandise like underwear for women and men, socks, stockings, shirts and blouses for two years.  She used to work in a funeral parlor and managed to establish her own business.  From this business she earns income needed for her daughter’s schooling and for household expenses.

Her goal is to see the business better stocked and to use profits to cover her daughter’s schooling costs until she graduates and to manage to acquire a house of her own.  She will use this loan to buy more underwear, socks and shirts to take advantage of this sales season.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Pape Kassene

texts.fr: Monsieur Pape kassene réside au Sénégal. Il  est marié et s’est  pleinement  investi dans le secteur du commerce. Il est vendeur de  denrées alimentaires et exerce  cette activité depuis 2009. Il capitalise une expérience  de 3 ans  dans ce domaine. Il est membre au guichet de l’U-IMCEC où il sollicite un crédit de 100.000 francs CFA. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus et de ré hausser  le niveau de son épargne. L’objectif visé  est de développer son activité commerciale. Ainsi, il pourra satisfaire certains besoins familiaux au sein du foyer  à savoir l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires et la rénovation des conditions  d’habitation. Son  projet dans le futur se traduit par son désir de devenir  commerçant grossiste dans le secteur d’activité ou il évolue.
texts.en:
Mister Pape Kassene lives in Sénégal. He is married and completely invested in business. He is a seller of foodstuffs and has been practicing this business since 2009. He has 3 years experience in this field. 

He is a member of the branch of the UIMCEC where he is requesting a loan of 100,000 FCFA. This financing will allow him to grow his income and to enhance the level of his savings. The objective in sight is to develop his business. Thus, he will be able to satisfy certain family needs in his home for example nutrition and the renovation of living conditions. His project in the future is fed by his desire to become a wholesaler in the sector where he works.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to resell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 56 year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has 5 children, aged 12, 13,18, 20 and 25 years. In 1999, Kadiatu established her cooking and household utensils - knives, tea kettles, buckets, plates, and plastic bowls business. She began her business because, after the war, things were difficult with the husband so she decided to go into business to sustain the home.  

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans. She now requires a new loan in order to buy drinking buckets – 30 pieces @ SLL 65, 000, pans (large size) – 25 sets @ SLL 60, 000, tea kettles – 15 pieces @ SLL 25, 000, rubber bowls – 30 pieces @ SLL 20, 000 and spoons – 5 dozen @ SLL 5, 000. The balance of SLL 50, 000 will be used as to transport the goods. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to have a large shop with different dishes and latest patterns of pans and dishes. This loan will help her to buy goods that her customers want, in large quantities. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinking buckets – 30 pieces @ SLL 65, 000, pans (large size) – 25 sets @ SLL 60, 000, tea kettle – 15 pieces @ SLL 25, 000, rubber bowls – 30 pieces @ SLL 20, 000 and spoons – 5 dozens @ SLL 5, 000, the balance of SLL 50, 000 will be used for the cost of transporting goods.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 32 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She runs a retail shop, and has been in the business for the past three years in Narok area. She earns a monthly income of KES 80,000. 

With her first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET, Josphine intends to purchase additional stock like sugar, maize flour, tea leaves to sell, as this will boost her profit margins.

She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. Her future plans is to become a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, maize flour, tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 36 years old. A business man, he is married to Catherine who is a business lady. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a chemist shop for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 5,100, which he uses to support his family.  

Francis will use the loan to buy a stock of drugs. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to expand the business and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stock of drugs.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 30 years old and married. She has two children who are underage. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mwanaidi runs a retail shop in Mombasa, Kenya. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as beans, soap, sugar, rice, wheat flour, etc. She has requested a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to Yehu Microfinance, through Kiva partner, to buy additional items to sell. 

In the future, Mwanaidi would like to save enough money to open a wholesale business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Shafic

texts.en:
Shafic is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale, in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Shafic has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells sweaters. 

To help expand his business, Shafic has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business, and will help Shafic to generate greater profits and help to purchase more items that are needed. Shafic hopes that, in the future, he will be able to make a bigger shop than this and to employ more workers and to supply goods country-wide. 

Shafic is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Shafic, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand the business.

loans.name: Dilbarkhan

texts.ru: Дилбархан  –участник группы «Астра», ей  57 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. В 1995 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Дилбархан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Дилбархан сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 2 коровы с приплодом и  ежемесячным доходом около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дилбархан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого скота.  Доходы от кредита Дилбархан планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Dilbarkhan is a participant of the "Astra" group.  She is 57 years old, married and a mother of two children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry and farming in 1995 with an initial sum of 4,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Dilbarkhan was able to develop her business to contain two cows with offspring and have a monthly income of about 5,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Dilbarkhan requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of small livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Karla Rosita

texts.es:
La señora Karla, es socia del banco comunal “Las fresitas” del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, tiene un moto-car que lo entrega en alquiler y le redime un ingreso diario.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una batería, un sistema de arrastre, una bujía, 6  focos para intermitente, una llanta de repuesto, una cámara, 2 litros de aceite, una caja de cera.
