Con este pequeño ingreso puede juntar para el mantenimiento de su moto y las cuotas mensuales a Manuela Ramos porque no quiere quedar mal con las demás socias, que están cuidando que su banquito no pase con mora.  Su esposo trabaja como operario en construcción.
texts.en:
Karla is a member of the communal bank "Las Fresitas," located in the Yarinacocha district in the department of Ucayali.  She is 22 years old, married, and has a child.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for 2 years.  She has a moto-car that she rents out which provides her with a daily income.  

With her new loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy: a battery, a belt drive, a spark plug, 6 flashing light bulbs, a spare tire, an inner tube, 2 liters of motor oil, and a box of wax. 

With her small income, she can gather together the funds to do maintenance on her moto and make her monthly payments to Manuela Ramos. She wants to stay on good terms with the other members of her communal bank, who are careful not to let their bank's payments to fall into arrears.  Her husband works in construction.

loans.use: to buy motor oil, spark plugs and other parts for her moto-taxi

loans.name: Suyapa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Suyapa tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, con quienes vive en el pedregal zona suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Ella tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas de maíz, y venta de pollo frito con tajadas, su negocio está establecido en un local comunal cerca a su casa y es muy conocido. Durante el día vende las tortillas y por la noche vende el pollo. Esta solicitando un préstamo de Lps.6,500.00 para comprar harina de maíz para elaborar tortillas y para comprar una estufa para cocinar el pollo. Con esta inversión se abastece de insumos como la harina de maíz y va mejorar la atención al cliente. Ella espera que su negocio crezca y obtener los ingresos que necesita para darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Suyapa, 38, is a single mother; she has three children living with her in El Pedregal, a suburban zone in San Pedro Sula.

She’s been selling corn tortillas and fried chicken with fried plantain slices for 8 years.  Her business is located in a communal locale near her house and is very well-known.  She sells tortillas during the day and sells the chicken at night.  

She’s asking for a 6,500 lempira loan to buy corn flour to make the tortillas and to buy a stove to cook the chicken.  With this investment, she will stock up on supplies like corn flour and will improve customer service.  She hopes that her business will grow and to obtain the income she needs to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy corn flour to make tortillas and to buy a stove.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is 47 years old. He lives in a small village in the Akhaltsikhe District of Georgia with his family: wife Knarik and two children (7 and 10 years old). Both of his children go to the local school. Knarik is a housewife and she helps Stepan with the family agricultural business. They have three milk cows and three calves. They produce cheese and curds every day. Part of their produce is used by the family and the rest is sold locally. The family owns a plot of land as well, where they grow potato, wheat, haricot beans and barley. Stepan and Knarik work hard during the spring and summer seasons to produce a good harvest. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Georgian lari.

Stepan has requested a loan for purchasing calves. He will raise the calves and sell them after several months for a profit. As a result of the above-mentioned activities, the income of the family will increase. With the increased profit, Stepan will be able to reinvest in the family business to expand it and make it more profitable, improving the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos, vive en una aldea del Municipio de Intibucá, La Esperanza.
Maria tiene una actividad que le genera los ingresos necesarios para los gastos del hogar. Ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de papa. Desde muy pequeña ha trabajado con su familia, hace 5 años ha logrado establecer su propia parcela.  Donde ella  vive es una zona apta para la agricultura, en este caso de papa. Le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo y le apoya su familia con los gastos en el hogar. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. 
Es su primer préstamo de 10,000 lempiras que solicita y lo va invertir en insumos para la siembra de papas, compra de fertilizante y fungicida, con el propósito de mejorar el nivel de producción. 
Su meta es obteniendo la ayuda que Odef le ha brindado y que le ha ayudado a darle una buena asistencia a los cultivos y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
.
texts.en:
María, 35, is married and has six children; she lives in a village in Intibucá Municipality, La Esperanza.

María has an activity that generates income necessary for household expenses.  She works in agriculture, specifically growing potatoes.  She worked alongside her family since she was little and set up her own parcel five years ago.   The zone she lives in is apt for agriculture, in this case for potatoes.  She dedicates most of her time to it and supports her family with household expenses.  She sells her crops in the local market.

This is her first, 10,000 lempira, loan that she’s going to use to buy supplies for her potato crops; she will buy fertilizer and fungicide to improve production levels.  Her goal is to use the help ODEF has given her to provide good crop maintenance thus improving her family’s standard of living.

.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has been raising poultry for the last two years with a monthly income of about KES 10,000 which she uses to cover her child’s basic needs. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully.

Victoria will use the loan to purchase poultry feeds and chicks. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into a mixed crop farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and more chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jambul

texts.en:
Jambul is 27 years old. He is married and lives in a small village with his family: his wife, Lela, his parents and a brother. His brother has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. The family members earn their living through an agricultural business. They have 2 milk cows. They produce dairy food every day, like cheese and curds. Part of the dairy food is used by the family members and the rest is sold locally. The family owns a plot of land as well, where they grow potatoes, haricot (green beans) and maize. To get a good harvest they are especially busy with the plot during the spring and summer seasons. Harvested products are sold on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari, which is hardly enough for food for the 5 members of the family. 

Jambul requested a loan for purchasing an additional milk cow. With three milk cows the family will be able to produce more dairy foods. They will sell them for a good price and hope to get a good profit. Jambul will reinvest the additional earnings to expand their agricultural enterprise to make it more profitable, thereby improving their living conditions. The family members hope for your help and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Gpf Taiba 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le GPF Taïba 3 est un groupe qui s’est formé dans le voisinage : des femmes du même quartier .Elle font du commerce de d’habit  prêt à porter. La responsable du groupe s’appelle Aboye, elle  fait du commerce depuis 3 ans .Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des habits prêt à porter pour enfants qu’elle va revendre. Grace  au crédit, elle peut mettre de l’argent de coté.
Elle est mariée et participe à la dépense quotidienne.
Elle a comme ambition d’ouvrir un grand magasin de prêts à porter et de diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
The GPF Taïba 3 group was formed in the neighborhood and comprises female members who all live in the same part of town. They work selling ready-to-wear clothing. The head of the group is called Aboye, and she has worked in retail for the past three years. She plans to use her loan to buy ready-to-wear clothing for children, which she will resell.

This loan will allow Aboye to put some money aside. She is married, and helps with the daily expenses. Her ambition is to open a large ready-to-wear clothing store, as well as to diversify the products she wants to sell.

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothes for resale.

loans.name: Valerian

texts.en:
Valerian is 49 years old. He is married and lives in a small village in the Abasha District with his family: his wife, Natalia, and three children (11, 12 and 16 years old). All three study in the village school. Valerian and Natalia are busy with agricultural activities. They are busy with cattle breeding. They have 5 milk cows, from which they produce cheese. They sell approximately 90 kg. of cheese per month on the local open market. Also, they have a pig and sell piglets. 

Along with the cattle breeding, Valerian and Natalia are busy with farming. They own 1.25 hectare of land, where tomatoes and maize are grown. They sell on average 600 kg. of maize per season. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Lari. They work hard but still don’t have enough income to make some savings for purchasing additional household goods or for renovation of the house. 

Valerian requested a loan for his agricultural land. He will cultivate his land and sow more maize and tomatoes. He will work hard during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. After properly done seasonal work, he hopes to get a greater harvest of maize and tomatoes, and his sales will increase. With increased profits Valerian plans to repair the house, because the existing one is old and uncomfortable. As a result of the above mentioned activities the family will be able to spend their evenings after a hardworking day in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to cultivate his agricultural land.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a 40-year-old married woman who lives with her two sons. She runs a kiosk business to cover the household expenses and her first son’s educational needs. 

At the moment, Mwanalima is seeking additional business capital as she has used part of her business capital to cover her son’s educational expenses. She went to the Yehu Microfinance office to apply for a loan of KES 25,000. The loan will enable her to add more kiosk inventory, for example to purchase snacks, detergent, maize flour, etc. She is putting her hopes on the loan assistance to help her improve her business. Her dream is to open a wholesale business and to hire employees. Mwanalima and her family reside in their own house which has no electricity, neither does it have piped water.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, detergent, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 34 years old and married to Phyllis. They are blessed with three children, age 12, eight, and two years respectively. Patrick runs an auto repair shop where he sells motor vehicle spares, motorbike and bicycle spares. He started this business 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 

He has requested for a sixth loan of KES 70,000 to purchase motor bike and bicycle spare parts to sello. The profit he earns from his business will aid him in paying school fees for his children. He hopes to succeed in his business and in life.

loans.use: to purchase a motor bike and bicycle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Gnana's Group

texts.fr:
Ces 02 femmes bénéficiaires de prêts auprès de CAURIE-MF font partie du Banc Villageois de sitacourou. Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

Ainsi madame Gnana levant le bras gauche sur la photo est responsable de son groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 03 enfants dont 02 filles, âgés respectivement de 28 ans ,17ans et 12 ans.

Madame gnana  est agricultrice, elle cultive le riz et l'arachide et pratique en meme temps le commerce du sucre et du savon.

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter 04 moutons,05 kg de semences de riz et le reste des semences d'arachides.

Avec le bénéfice réalisé,elle pourra subvenir aux besoins de la famille et assurer la scolarité de son enfant âgé de 12 ans.
texts.en:
These two women, who are beneficiaries of CAURIE-MF loans, form part of the Sitacourou banc villageois. Their main businesses are retail and agriculture.


Gnana is pictured with her left hand raised in the photo, and she is the head of the group. She is 47 years of age, married, and a mother to three children (two daughters and a son), aged 28, 17 and 12. She is a farmer and works growing rice and peanuts. At the same time she also sells sugar and soap.


Gnana plans to use the loan to buy four sheep and five kilos of rice seed, and to use the rest of the money to buy peanut seeds. The profit generated will enable her to provide for her family, and to ensure that the costs of her 12-year-old child’s schooling are met.

loans.use: To buy four sheep and five kilos of rice seed, and use the rest of the money to buy peanut seeds.

loans.name: Antoinette Odile

texts.fr:
Antoinnette est une jeune femme de 37 ans, célibataire, mère de 02 enfants dont l'âge est respectivement de 10 et 18 ans. Ils vont à l'école.Elle est commerçante et exerce son activité  dans un quartier de la capitale depuis deux ans où elle vend des vivres frais(tomate,arachides,gingimbre,piments,harrengs)et de la nourriture.
Son commerce fonctionne mais rapporte peu à cause des ruptures permanente de stocks  dues à la petité de son capital. d'où son besoin de finance pour se ravitailler en gros en achetants  des cajots tomate ,des  sacs d'arachide et le petit necessaire pour son commerc, les ustensils de cuisine et le petit matéreil pour les plats qu'elle cuisine tous les jours. Cela augmentera ses ventes, dont son bénefice et l'aidera à économiser pour s'ouvrir un restaurant.
texts.en:
Antoinette is a young, 37-year-old woman. She is single and mother to two children aged 10 and 8. They both go to school. She works in retail, operating in a neighborhood of the capital for 10 years, where she sells fresh food (tomato, peanuts, ginger, peppers, herrings) and other foodstuffs.


Antoinette’s business works well, but brings in little income because of her constant stock shortages, a result of her low capital. This is why she needs financing, so that she can buy bulk items such as crates of tomatoes, bags of peanuts and all she needs for her business, as well as kitchen utensils and small items for the dishes she cooks every day. This will increase her sales, and the profit will help her to save so that she can open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy wholesale food items and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Regard De Jesus 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Macius est le coordinateur de son groupe Regard de Jesus. Il est un veuf et il a 2 enfants. Macius  habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Macius a dirigé son commerce pendant les dernières 12 années. Il  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans l'epicerie dont il vend des produits divers.

Macius  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de sont groupe  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon le produits divers et cosmétiques.

Macius dit que ses défis principal sont les manques d,achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit. Il dit que son but principal est d'avoir un plus d'argent pour obtenir un grand commerce avec l`aide de Dieu.
texts.en:
Macius is the coordinator of his group, which is called Regard de Jesus. He is a widower, and has two children. He lives in the north of Haiti, where electricity is rare and the water supply is very limited.

Macius has run his business for the past 12 years, and would like to use this loan to invest in the grocery store where he sells miscellaneous products. He hopes that the loan will help him have a bigger business. Other members of his group need loans for businesses such as coal, miscellaneous products and cosmetic sales.

Macius says that his biggest challenge is the lack of purchases, and the fact that too many people ask him for credit. He says that his main goal is to have more money so that, with the help of God, he can have a large business.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products for sale.

loans.name: Sylvie Michelle

texts.fr: Sylvie est une jeune femme de 28 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant qui va à l'école. Elle a également à sa charge deux autres personnes. Elle fait la teinture à son domicile des vêtements de toutes sortes qu'elle revend depuis 11 ans déjà.Son activité fonctionne à merveille grâce à la bonne qualité de ses services et à son expérience dans ce domaine elle a acquise une clientèle considérable.Mais le souci est qu'elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de cette clientèle à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter les produits en détails pour satisfaire une vague et attendre qu'elle soit payée par celle-ci pour pouvoir satisfaire l'autre vague. D'où la nécessité de ce crédit qui l'aidera à acheter son matériel en gros pour travailler et lui permettra de satisfaire toute sa clientèle,d'augmenter ses bénéfices.Elle économisera une partie de ce profit pour ouvrir une boutique avec le temps et l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sylvie is a young, 28-year-old woman who is married and has one child who goes to school. She has a further two people under her care. She has worked from home for 11 years, dyeing all kinds of clothing which she then resells. Her business is really successful thanks to the good quality of her services, as well as her experience in this area, which has helped her build up a considerable customer base.

Sylvie’s concern, however, is that she will not be able to meet the needs of these customers, as her capital is so low. This means she has to buy products on a retail basis to meet one wave of demand, before waiting to be paid before she is able to meet the needs of more customers. She therefore needs a loan to help her buy bulk material to use for her work, allowing her to meet all her customers’ needs and increase her income. She will save part of this profit to open a store over time, and the other part of her profits will help her to provide for her family on a daily basis.

loans.use: To buy bulk dyeing materials.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La señora Margot es socia del banco comunal “Las Fresitas” en el Distrito yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 23 años de edad, conviviente, 1 hijo pequeño.
Lleva cuatro años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y tiene una vulcanizadora donde trabaja junto a su pareja y como no tiene con quien dejar a su hijo tiene que estar con ellos todo el día, es un poco fastidioso  porque a veces no les deja trabajar tranquilos, tiene que estar pendientes de él en todo momento.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprara: 25 catalinas, 20 cadenas, 12 cámaras, 2 planchas de parches, 1 litro de pegamento.
Con los préstamo que tiene cada ciclo puede ir implementando su negocio, tiene clientes porque están en una avenida muy transitada y es la única vulcanizadora en cinco cuadras, agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado en estos cuatro años
texts.en:
Margot is a member of the “Las Fresitas” communal bank in Yarinacocha District in Ucayali Department.  She’s 23-years-old, has a spouse and a little boy.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  She has a tire repair shop where she works alongside her spouse and since she has no one to leave her son with he spends the day with them too.  It’s a little bothersome sometimes because he keeps them from being able to work in peace; she has to be watching over him all the time.

She will use her new, 2500 new sol loan, to buy 25 gears, 20 chains, 12 inner tubes, 2 patching irons and one liter of adhesive.

With loans she gets each cycle she can stock her business.  She has customers because they are located on a very busy avenue and they are the only tire repair shop in five blocks.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for all the support she’s received these last four years.

loans.use: to buy chains and inner tubes.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married with four school-attending children. She is married to a farmer and they are working very hard to ensure that they meet their family's needs. She does farming as her side job where she earns another source of income. She resides in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water, and she spends much of her monthly income on school fees for her four children.

She got starting capital from her sister. Then she was introduced to Yehu by her neighbor and she was content with their terms of joining, so she is requesting a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, and fruits to stock her grocery store.

Mwanakombo dreams of opening a shop in the future, even as she expands her grocery that is located opposite her house. The grocery has been operating for the past ten years, and it is a very hardworking lady who makes sure that her customers' needs are always met.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, and fruits

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
La señora Charito, es socia del banco comunal “EL Paraíso” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos menores.
Son cuatro años que viene trabajando con los  préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la  venta  de comida que cada día lleva por los aserraderos para vender a los obreros que ahí laboran y son sus principales clientes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: una carreta, 1 docena de platos, 1 balde, 1 docena de vasos de plástico, ½ saco de arroz, 10 kilos de azúcar, 1 galón de aceite.
Con la venta de sus comidas puede ayudar con los gastos de la casa, su esposo también trabaja  para mantener el hogar y no quiere que le falte nada a sus hijos que aun están pequeños, están contentos porque pueden dar  a su familia calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Charito is a member of the “El Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank in Coronel Portillo District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 34-years-old, married and has two minor children.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  She sells food that she takes to sawmills to sell to laborers who work there and who are her main customers.

She will use her new, 1200 new sol, loan to buy a cart, a dozen plates, a bucket, a dozen plastic drinking glasses, 1/2 –sack of rice, 10 kilos of sugar and one gallon of oil.

She is able to help cover household expenses with her sales.  Her husband also works to support the home and she doesn’t want her children who are still little to lack anything.  They are happy because they can provide their family with quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and a food cart.

loans.name: Aleksander

texts.en:
Aleksander is 35 years old. He is from the Samtredia District and lives with his family: his wife, Maka, his mother and two children (4 and 12 years old). The younger daughter goes to the kindergarten and the elder studies in the village school. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. 

They have 2 milk cows and a calf. They produce traditional West Georgian cheese which is sold on the local open market. The family’s main activity is farming. They have a greenhouse where they grow tomatoes and various greens. They sell 2.5 – 3 tons of greens and tomatoes in a year. They have a plot of land as well, where watermelon is grown. They sell 10-15 tons of watermelon per season. 

Along with the agricultural activities, Aleksander’s mother is busy with trading. She sells clothing locally. The family has the additional income in the amount of 250-300 Lari. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Lari. 

Aleksander requested a loan for his agricultural activities. He will cultivate and fertilize the land. Also, he plans to make an irrigation system. The family will work hard on their plot during the spring and summer seasons. After properly completed seasonal work the family will get a better and greater harvest than in the last year. They will sell it through known distribution channels for a good price and get profit which will be used for purchasing household goods. As a result of the above mentioned activities, the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to cultivate and fertilize the agricultural land.

loans.name: Rostom

texts.en:
Rostom is 57 years old. He is from the village of Tuzi in West Georgia. He lives there with his family: his wife, Ketino, his 25-year-old son, his daughter-in-law and his 1-year-old grandson. His son works as a private master and gets a service fee. 

Rostom and Ketino run a small dairy farm with two milk cows and 1 hectare of vineyard, where 500 vine trees are grown. They pick grapes in late summer and sell them on the local open market. Ketino milks cows twice in a day and makes cheese which is sold in nearby villages. Along with the family business, Rostom works as a security guard and gets additional income. The total average monthly income of the family is 370 Lari. 

Rostom requested a loan for purchasing a tractor. He will cultivate the land owned by the family. Also, Rostom will use the tractor to provide seasonal agricultural services to local farmers. This will significantly increase the income for his family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a 26-year-old married woman from Mwambalazi, Kenya. She has a grocery business that she has been operating for the past 8 years. She lives in her own house with her husband and five children. She says that much of her monthly expense goes to school fees for her three children who are in school.

She has applied for her first loan from Yehu Microfinance to enable her to buy more onions, tomatoes and green peppers to add to her stock for sale. She says her business will do well after the loan and hopes to see her business expand. She operates her business selling to the people at the market.

Angelica hopes to own a retail shop in the near future. She is working very hard to ensure that her dream comes true, though she faces a challenge of high transport costs when transporting her goods to the market.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes and green peppers.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una madre de familia que tiene 33 años de edad, ella tiene 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, dicha casa está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura en el Norte del Peru. Liliana vive en una zona rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz. Este esta el tercer prestamo que Liliana puede recibir gracias al apoyo de Kiva. Ella ha demonstrado ser muy responsable en sus pagos y el credito le ha ayudado a consolidar su negocio.

Liliana se dedica ala crianza y comercialización de animales menores como ganado ovino (ovejas) y para esta a actividad cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años, para ello ella ha construido corrales apropiados y espaciosos para una mejor crianza de sus animales. Los animales cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Ella una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que la conocen la consideran alguien tranquila y bastante responsable. Este nuevo prestamo lo solicita para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y seguir contribuyendo con el desarrollo economico de su familia.
texts.en:
Liliana is 33 years old and she is the mother of two children that she cares for.  She lives in her own home with her husband and their children.  She says that her house is in the district of Tambogrande in the region of Piura in the north of Peru.  Liliana lives in a rural area in the region but her home has electricity.  This is the third loan that Liliana will receive thanks to the support of Kiva.  She has proven to be very responsible in her payments and this loan will help her build her business.

Liliana raises animals and sells animals such as sheep and she has done this work for 6 years.  She built suitable corrals and pens for the best possible upbringing of her animals.  When her animals grow to full-size and the ideal weight, she sells them in the local market.  She is rather well-known and esteemed by her neighbors in the region where she lives.  The people that know her consider her a very quiet and responsible person.  This new loan will help her buy nutritious food for her animals so that she can continue financially contributing to her household and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy nutritious food for the animals.

loans.name: Eleine

texts.fr: Madame Eleine réside au Sénégal. C’est une femme mariée qui s’est orientée vers  le secteur du commerce depuis 2000. Elle vend a crédit et  par commande du poisson fumé, de l’huile de palme et de la crevette aux détaillants des différentes marchés de sa localité. Elle est membre d'un guichet de  l’U-IMCEC et à déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur.Elle sollicite un prêt de 300 000 frs dans l'objectif   d’élargir son activité mais aussi dans le but    satisfaire  la demande de sa clientèle qui s'est accrue  et augmenter les bénéfices qui seront générés par son activité.Par conséquent elle sera capable de satisfaire ses quelques besoins sociaux et prendre en charge le paiement des frais de scolarité et de transport de ses enfants ainsi que la réfection du lieu d'habitation d sa famille.  Son ambition est d’occuper une place importante dans le secteur du commerce particulièrement dans le domaine de l’import-export.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eleine is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She became a merchant in 2000, selling smoked fish, palm oil and shrimp by order to retailers from various markets in her district, on credit. She is a member of the local U-IMCEC branch, and has previously received and repaid one loan. 

She is seeking a loan of 300,000F to expand her business, to meet the needs of a growing customer base, and to bolster the profits earned through her activity. This will allow her to fulfill her social needs, to pay for her children’s tuition and transportation, and to pay for repairs to the family’s home. 

Her goal is to become a leader in her sector of activity, particularly in the field of import-export.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and supports a family of six. Three of his children are in school while the others have completed their studies. He has run a grocery shop for the past 7 years, earning a monthly income of about KES 5,000. 

Francis is applying for his first loan of KES 40,000 from Yehu Microfinance, as he plans to restock his shop with more cereals. The anticipated profits will help in the expansion of the store. His future dream is to improve his living standards
 
In addition, Francis does farming where he sells his goods from home, and he previously operated a café. He is working hard to satisfy his clients.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 69 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Mary who is also a farmer. They are blessed with four adult children. He has been in the farming business for the past 30 years with the monthly income of about KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Ben will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for use on the farm for better crop yields. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy pesticide. His hopes and dreams are to educate his grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old with a single child who is about three years old. He is from Mwambalazi, a village on the south coast of Kenya.

He is working hard in his scrap business to meet his family’s basic household needs. For 2 years, he has been engaged in buying and selling scrap metals like scrap iron and empty cans. He is asking for a loan to buy more scrap materials. 

In the future, he would like to improve his business and make it even bigger so he can have a better profit and save enough for old age. Daniel lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is married and she works hard to support her family of five. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past 1 year, Mwanapili has operated a dry fish vending business in Mwambalazi, Kenya. 

Previously, she was a very hardworking farmer selling her farm products to her neighbors, which enabled her to get starting capital for this business. She has requested a Ksh 25,000 loan through Yehu to buy fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and open a kiosk. 

Despite the fact that her goal is to open a kiosk, she faces a major challenge of seasonality since these fish become scarce in certain seasons which greatly affects her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Begaiym

texts.ru: Бегайым –участник группы «Астра», ей  51 год, имеет 3 детей. В 1993 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Бегайым начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Бегайым сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 3 коровы, 5 лошадей и  ежемесячным доходом около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бегайым обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы будут использованы на расширение сарая для скота.
texts.en: Begaiym is a participant of the "Astra" group.  She is 51 years old and has three children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Begaiym started her own business in animal husbandry and farming in 1993 with an initial sum of 2,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, she was able to develop her business to contain three cows, five horses, and have a monthly income of about 12,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Begaiym requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a dairy cow.  The earnings will be used to expand a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Robert, who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the dairy farming business for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Martha will use the loan to buy animal feed, and also treat the cows. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to start tea farming and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият продолжает свою деятельность. Она занимается торговлей деткой, женской и мужской одежды. Хосият проживает в районе Пяндж. Она берет кредит для покупки женских платков и штанов.
texts.en: Khosiyat continues her business.  She is involved in selling children's, women's and men's clothing.  Khosiyat lives in the Pyandj.  She is requesting this loan to purchase women's scarves and pants.

loans.use: to purchase women's scarves and pants

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del banco comunal “El Paraíso” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad, es soltera y tiene siete hijos mayores.
Todo este tiempo que lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos  ha podido tener un negocio estable y rentable, ella se dedica a la venta de medicinas, tiene una botica  muy bien surtida ubicada en la provincia de atalaya, su hija le ayuda con su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 paquete de gasas, 1 paquete de algodón, 3 cajas de dolocordralan, 1 caja de alcohol, 1 caja de aspirina, 1 caja de alcohol yodado, 1 docena de aceptil rojo, 1 caja de Vic vaporu, 1 caja de panadol antigripal, 1 caja de apronax.
Este negocio facilita mucho su vida porque es el que le genera mayor ingreso y le alcanza para vivir cómodamente, gracias a Manuela Ramos por haber confiado en su persona y en su  negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the “El Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank in Coronel Portillo District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 65-years-old, single and has seven adult children.

All this time she’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans she’s been able to have a stable, profitable business.  She sells medicine.  She has a very well-stocked drug store located in Atalaya Province; her daughter helps her with the business.

She will use her new, 2200 new sol, loan to buy:  1 package of gauze, 1 package of cotton, 3 boxes of Delocordralan [non-steroidal anti-inflammatory], a box of alcohol, a box of Aspirin, a box of alcohol iodate, a dozen Red Aseptil [a topical antiseptic], a box of Vicks VapoRub, a box of Panadol flu remedy and one box of Apronax [pain killer].

This business makes her life much easier because it generates more income that’s sufficient for her to live in comfort; she thanks Manuela Ramos for having confidence in her personally and in her business.

loans.use: to buy pills, gauze and other medicine.

loans.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y habita en casa propia conjuntamente con su esposa. Este es el segundo prestamo de Pedro que el realiza para inventir en su negocio. El cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona, viven el distrito de morropon cuenta con mas de 15 mil habitantes en el Norte del Peru. El ha demonstrado ser una persona responsable con sus pagos e inovador en su rubro de al siembre de arroz.

Precisamente, este prestamo lo solicita para invertirlo en negocio de arroz, especificamente para comprar arroz en cascara , ya que el precio esta por debajo de lo proyectado, y de esa forma tengas mas ingresos para el sustento de su familia y en consecuencia una mejor condicion de vida en la zona. En estos meses del año es un buen momento para la inversion, pues hay campaña de arroz y el precio esta bueno , y las perspectivas de los comerciantes es acaparar arroz y posteriormente venderlo a un buen precio y esto trareà consigo una mejor utlidad.

Uno de sus objetivos primordiales es comprar arroz a un buen precio y venderlo  en el mes de septiembre cuando el precio este en su normalidad, para lograr todo esto el cliente se esfuerza al maximo  y trabaja todo los dias con mucha respoonsabilidad. Esto le ayudara a mejorar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 29 years old, he is married, he has two children that he cares for, and he lives in his own home with his wife.  This is the second loan that Pedro has asked for so that he can invest in his business.  He has great references from both his acquaintances and from workers in the region.  He lives with his family in the district of Morropon, which has more than 15 million inhabitants in the north of Peru.  He has proven to be responsible with his payments and innovative in planting rice.

This loan will be invested in his rice business, specifically in buying rice seeds since the current price is much lower than projections.  By doing this, he will have more income for supporting his family and as a consequence, they will have betting living conditions.  These months of the year are the best time for the investment since the rice is in season and the price is very good.  Also, retailers like to hoard the rice and sell it later at a better price and this will bring a better value to them.

One of his primary objectives is to buy rice at a good price and then sell it in the month of September when the prices have normalized.  In order to succeed at doing this, he will need to put in a lot of effort and work responsibly every day.  This will help improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds as the price is currently lower than projected.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi lives in the Coastal region of Kenya, in Mwambalazi village. She owns a clothing store, which has been operating for ten years. She started the business through a loan from her brother. Her main business challenge is the lack of on time payments by some customers. Despite this, Chizi is determined to expand the business and be in a position to open other stores in the future. 

She was introduced to Yehu by her friends and is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of clothes. The additional income from this loan will help her restock the store.

Chizi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water and she describes school fees to be her greatest monthly expense, paying for her five school going children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.ru: Нематулло проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он более пятнадцати лет занимается торговлей. Нематулло арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает хозяйственные товары и продукты. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания.
texts.en: Nematullo lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 43 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Nematullo has been involved in sales for over fifteen years.  He leases a retail outlet at a market, where he sells household good and products.  He is requesting this loan to purchase food products.

loans.use: to purchase butter, waffles and chocolate

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.ru: Наимжон проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он более восьми лет занимается растениеводством. В этом ему помогает жена. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Naimjon lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 33 years old, married and has four children.  He has been involved in agriculture for over eight years.  His wife helps him with this business.  Naimjon is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
La señora Clara es socia del banco comunal “El Paraíso” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 68 años de edad, está casada y tiene ocho hijos mayores.
Lleva trece años en este banco comunal, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cerveza, el negocio lo tiene en su misma casa, donde tiene la ayuda de su hija que vive en su casa y también tiene su propia familia, su esposo es un viejito que para enfermo y necesita muchos cuidados.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 10 cajas de cerveza, 5 cajas de gaseosas, 2 cajas de cifrut, 2 paquetes de agua mineral, 3 paquetes de gaseosas de 3 litros, 3 paquetes de gaseosas de un litro.
Los ingresos que genera este pequeño negocio le ayuda para algunos gastos extras que tiene, sus hijos  le ayudan económicamente  porque ya son mayores porque su esposo ya no puede trabajar.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por brindarle los préstamos a pesar de la edad que tiene.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the “El Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank in Coronel Portillo District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 68-years-old, married and has eight adult children.

She’s been in this communal bank for thirteen years.  She sells soft-drinks and beer.  Her business is home-based.  Her daughter who has her own family and lives with her helps her.  Her husband is quite old, in poor health and needs much care.

She will use her new, 1,000 new sol, loan to buy 10 cases of beer, 5 cases of soft-drinks, 2 cases of Cifrut [brand of citrus drink], two packets of mineral water, three packets of 3-liter soft-drinks and 3 packets of 1-liter soft-drinks.

Income this small business generates will help her cover some extra expenses she has.  Her children help her out economically because they are now adults and her husband is no longer able to work.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the loans despite her age.

loans.use: to buy beverages at wholesale.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Virgen de Lourdes 1", se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros. Actualmente se encuentran  en el primer ciclo, con diez integrantes.
Todas las mujeres de este comité se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, ovejas y demás. Todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con mucho entusiasmo por salir  adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Emilce es una de las miembros, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Lourdes 1" Group began by the initiative of one of its members.  The group is now in its first loan cycle and has 10 members.

All of the women in this group raise and sell farm animals such as chickens, pigs, sheep and other animals.  All of the women are very hard-working and are enthusiastic to get ahead and to help each other.

Emilce is one of the members.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy nutritious food for her animals and by doing this, she will be able to get ahead and help her family.

loans.use: to buy nutritious food for the animals.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is widowed with four children. She is 61 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 
Felicidad sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional snacks for sale. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional snacks for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 years old, married to Andrew and blessed with two children aged 18 and 13 years. She owns a retail shop where she sells a variety of goods. She started this business seven years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 


She is requesting a second loan of KES 35,000 to purchase five bales of maize meal, sugar, bar soaps and washing detergents. 


Profit she earns from her business will contribute toward her building rental houses. She hopes to live a comfortable life as well as educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase five bales of maize meal, sugar, bar soaps and washing detergents.

loans.name: Jose De La Rosa

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz. Esta ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque la cual que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera de los pobladores. Por la localizacion de su comunidad, muchas veces el accesso a capital puede ser dificil y el rol de Kiva y Edpyme Alternativa es crucial. De hecho, este es el tercer prestamo de Jose con estas entidades y ha demonstrado ser responsable y trabajador.

Gracias al credito anterior, José pudo incursionar en el negocio de la siembra del arroz. Precisamente, el negocio a mostrado ser bastante rentable y esta vez quiere invertir el credito unicamente en este pare de su actividad, al cual le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia. Ademas de esto el se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puede ofrecer a sus clientes o a los distintos mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque.
texts.en:
José, 31, lives with his wife and children in his own house that only has electricity.  It’s located in the rural part of Lambayeque Department that is noted for its residents’ agriculture and animal husbandry activities.  Because of his community’s location access to capital is sometimes difficult which is why Edpyme Alternativa’s and Kiva’s role is crucial.  In fact, this is José’s third loan with these entities and he’s been responsible and hardworking.

Thanks to his previous loan, José was able to go into the rice business which is turning out to be quite profitable so this time he wants to invest the loan just in this part of his activity that’s helped him support his family.  In addition to this he also raises pigs to sell; his corral is located in his back yard.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and when they reach optimum growth he sells them to his customers or to various markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es:
José de 25 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposa e hijos, no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos dado que esta ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande al norte del Peru. La mayoria de pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana. El ha demonstrado ser una persona muy responsable y puntual, dado que este es su segundo credito con Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva. Esta vez Jose quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de venta de pescado, asi como alimento para otros animales.

José se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco, el mismo que vende por las calles de la zona donde vive, tiene su propia clientela que le compra por la buena calidad de su producto, con los ingresos que obtiene puede solventar su gastos diarios de su familia. Su esposa cría y comercializa aves de corral y así tienen otra ayuda económica para su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose is 25 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He does not have all the basic services as his house is located in the rural district of northern Peru, Tambogrande. Most people in the area develop agriculture, livestock and crafts. He has proven to be a very responsible and punctual person, as this is his second loan with Alternative Edpyme supported by Kiva. This time Jose wants to invest in his business of selling fish, as well as food for other animals.

Jose devotes himself to the purchase and sale of fresh fish which he sells on the streets of his neighborhood.  He has clientele that purchase from him due to the good quality of his product.  With the revenue derived he will be able to afford his family's daily expenses. His wife raises and sells poultry so in this way they have additional financial support for their home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fish to increment his daily sales and also to buy food so his animals gain weight and he can sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité  ´´Virgen de Lourdes 2´´, actualmente se encuentran  en el primer ciclo, con diez integrantes, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Bernardina es una de las miembros y comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas y cerdos. Comenta que por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos, y balanceados, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia. El grupo agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Lourdes 2” communal bank is currently in its first cycle with ten members who are learning how to work together to help each other by means of teamwork.

Bernardina is one of the members and she comments that she works raising and selling barnyard animals like chickens and pigs.  She comments that she helps her family by means of this work and gives them everything they need.

She’s asking for the loan to buy chicks and feed to continue growing and helping her family.  The group is grateful for the opportunity they are getting from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Nurul Hikmah 5 Group

texts.en:
Asih is the group leader of Nurul Hikmah 5 Group. She has been selling nasi uduk and fried snacks in front of her house since 2008.  Her business is running smoothly and she has extra income to fulfill her family's daily basic needs. 

Now she is taking a loan from VisionFund Indonesia and plans to buy kitchen tools such as a pan and plate. She also wants to have more ingredients to produce more nasi uduk and fried snacks to sell. In the future she hopes she can expand her business by having more variety in the menu.  She likes to meet her customers even though she also has a competitor close to her place of business.

Other group members are opening a beauty salon and selling snacks.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and pay for ingredients to produce nasi uduk (Indonesian coconut rice) to sell.

loans.name: Maria Edwina

texts.en:
This is Edwina. She previously accessed a PHP 8,000 loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of her tricycle units (motorcycles with a passenger cab) and her karaoke machine. Her earnings were a big help toward the education of her children and their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Edwina would like to apply for another loan of PHP 12,000, which she will use to buy spare parts for the maintenance of the tricycle units. The profits from her business will help her to sustain her family's daily needs and meet the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Edwina hopes to be able to buy another tricycle. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycles

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is 50 years old and lives in Mwambalazi, a small village on the south coast of Kenya. She is married to Said and they have three children aged 13-30 years. 

As for her family's main source of income, Mwaka farms and raises livestock to sell, a business she has been doing since the purchase of one goat. Thanks to her hard work, today Mwaka has several goats, which bring her a monthly profit of KES 10,000 through their sale.

With the goal of further developing her business and purchasing some cows, Mwaka applied to Yehu Microfinance through Kiva for a loan of KES 40,000 for the purchase of young livestock. Mwaka is planning to invest the income from her loan in further developing her business. Although she remains focused to her goal, she also experiences the challenge of loss of her livestock through theft and diseases.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock.

loans.name: Nasson

texts.en:
Nasson still operates a clinic, which serves the entire neighborhood. He is a very industrious, gentle man who makes sure that his customers are always well-served. He is so grateful to both Yehu and Kiva for the previous loans that made him save money to start a new business.

His plan is to use the requested loan of Ksh 50,000 to open a grocery store just beside his house. He intends to purchase tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and fruits. Since his house has electricity and running water, the electricity will enable him to work even late at night so as to maximize his profits.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and fruits.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Madame Dieynaba habite au Sénégal. Elle est mère de famille et a choisi l'activité de vente  de jus dans le but d'acquérir des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir a certains de ses besoins personnels.  Son activité principale est la vente de crèmes glacées et de jus sous différents parfums. Cela fait plus de 4 ans qu’elle évolue  dans  dans ce domaine. Elle est membre dans un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit 75.000 francs CFA dans l'intention de démarrer une autre activité commerciale qui consiste a vendre des tissus( bazin, soie, wax). Par conséquent elle envisage d'accroitre les revenus que lui génère son activité de commerce en vue  d'épargner d'avantage d'argent et d' améliorer les conditions alimentaires  de sa famille. Son projet futur est de devenir une importatrice de diverses marchandises.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dieynaba lives in Senegal. She is a mother, and she sells juice to earn the income necessary to support some of personal needs. Her main activity is the sale of ice cream and juices in various flavors. She has four years of experience in this activity. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and has previously obtained and repaid one loan. She is seeking a loan of 75,000CFAF to start selling fabrics (bazin, silk, wax). 

This should help to increase her income, which will allow her to add to her savings and improve her family’s food situation. Her goal is to become an importer of various goods.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a beautiful 36-year-old married woman with three girls and two boys. She is very industrious and has been able to send all her children to school. She has been running a grocery store for the past seven years after being a farmer for several years. This helped her gain experience, and she has accrued some capital to start the current business. However, she tells us that she sold her three goats so as to top up her capital, which was not enough to establish the business and stock the store.

Mwanamisi is a very determined lady with a dream of opening a kiosk and also expanding the current business. Her customers love her for her jovial character, which helps her increase her clientele daily. Despite her efforts, Mwamamisi says that her major challenge is the scarcity of some fruits and vegetables, especially during the dry season. This forces her to travel longer distances to get these products to ensure that her customers do not lack and get offended. She is applying for a loan to add stocks of vegetables and fruits to her store.

loans.use: to add stocks of vegetables and fruits to her store.

loans.name: Modern

texts.en:
Modern is 27 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married. For the past six years, Modern has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells all types of essential products. 

To help expand his business, Modern has requested a loan of 2 million Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to invest in the business, and will help Modern to generate greater profits and add more stock. Modern hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a larger enterprise. 

Modern is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Modern, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: invest in his general store.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua would like to improve her sales, so she is borrowing Ksh 40,000 to start a grocery business and buy fruits and vegetables to sell. This will help boost her proceeds and enable her to save for the improvement of her family's living situation. 

She lives in her own house, but it has neither electricity nor running water. Mwanamvua is grateful to her husband, who is a farmer, for the maximum support he gives to her to make sure that their children get a quality education and that their living standards are above the poverty line. Her dream is to open a wholesale store and to save money, which will enable her children to attend college after they finish high school.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Badr

texts.en: Badr is 25 years old, a single man, and lives in Hadramout, Yemen. Badr is a person who faces a financial challenge to provide his daily expenses. He would like to improve his living conditions. He is a worker in a hotel in the city. In order to offer his mother everything she needs, he is requesting a loan of 40000 YER to buy an air conditioner for his house. He hopes to get married.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner for his rental house

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали житель города Истаравшан. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена замается шитьем. Сам он таксист. Он пять лет уже как предоставляет услугу. Кредит берет для приобретения новой машины.
texts.en: Sherali is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 30 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is involved in sewing.  Sherali is a taxi driver.  He has been providing this service for five years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Kuña Aty´´, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Fany, quien motivo a sus amigas y vecinas para formar parte del comité. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo, donde todas ellas se esfuerzan siempre para salir adelante.
La Sra. Fany y sus compañeras se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, ovejas, patos y otro tipo. Comentan que por medio de la unión de todas ellas están saliendo adelante y ayudando a sus familias.
Fany solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados, patos, gallinas y otros, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo como persona y profesional.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Aty” committee formed thanks to Fany’s initiative who motivated her girlfriends and neighbors to be part of the committee.  They are currently in their second cycle where they all strive to get ahead always.

Fany and her fellow members raise and sell barnyard animals like chickens, pigs, sheep, ducks and others.  They comment that through their joint efforts they are getting ahead and helping their families.

Fany is asking for the loan to buy feed, ducks, chickens and others to continue working and growing both as a person and as a professional.

loans.use: to buy chickens, ducks, feed, etc.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: Doña Martha, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en San Pedro Sula. Doña Martha tiene 8 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de venta de comida. Ella vende todo tipo de comidas, desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. el negocio lo tiene en el garaje de su casa y tiene buena clientela. Solicita un préstamo de 7,000.00 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de comidas como ser: carnes, lácteos, arroz, frijoles, aceite, vegetales, refrescos, condimentos etc. ya es el segundo préstamo con ODEF, con los cuales ha mantenido estable su negocio, con este otro préstamo espera obtener buenas ganancias, ya que su meta es ir mejorando poco a poco su casa y tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Martha, 51, is married living with her husband and two children in San Pedro Sula.  Martha started her own food business 8 years ago.  She sells all types of food: breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She has her business in her garage and has a good clientele.

She’s asking for a 7,000 lempira loan to buy ingredients needed to prepare her meals like meat, dairy products, beans, oil, vegetables, soft-drinks, condiments, etc.

This is her second loan with ODEF that's helped her to keep her business stable; she hopes to earn good profits with this last loan because her goal is to gradually do some home improvements to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of beauty products

loans.name: Obloqul

texts.ru: Облокул житель города Истаравшан. Он женат. Ему 47 лет. У него трое детей. Его дети занимаются растениеводством. Сам он у себя дома занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Obloqul is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 47 years old, married and has three children.  His children are involved in agriculture.  Obloqul is involved in animal husbandry at home.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Célibataire de statut familial,  monsieur Ibrahima s’active depuis 1998 dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément dans la vente de matelas, sacs, nattes et produits de quincaillerie. Il est membre   d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs dans le but d’acquérir des marchandises qui lui permettront de renforcer son stock et développer l’activité commerciale qu’elle exerce.
texts.en: Ibrahima is single and, since 1998, has worked in the retail sector selling mattresses, bags, mats and hardware items. He is a member of a branch of U-IMCEC, and has requested a loan of 500,000 francs to purchase merchandise. This will allow him to increase his stock, as well as to develop his business.

loans.use: To buy mattresses, mats and other miscellaneous articles for resale.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia, está soltera y administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y uso personal, este negocio surgió hace cuatro años con la ayuda de su madre y poco a poco ha ido creciendo y abasteciendo de nuevos productos.
Ella necesita comprarse variedad de mercadería para el negocio como azúcar, arroz, sal, aceite, frijol, jabón, y otros productos que sean necesarios para poder atender a la clientela, este crédito le ayudará a aumentar su mercadería, abasteciendo el inventario, esto también ayudará a poder aumentar el número de clientes y sus ganancias.
La aspiración de ella es mejorar cada vez más a través de los préstamos, desarrollándose para estar en una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
María, 34, lives in her own house.  She’s single and runs a store where she sells basic staple items and items of personal use.  This business arose four years ago with help from her mother and it’s been gradually growing and being stocked with new products.

She needs to buy a variety of merchandise for the business like sugar, rice, salt, oil, beans, soap and other products needed to meet customer demand.  This loan will help her increase her merchandise stocking inventory; it will also help her increase the number of her customers and her profits.

Her hope is to improve each time by means of the loans developing to attain a better economic condition.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru:
Нурзат 31 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. Нурзат работает преподавателем в школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 4,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Нурзат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  10 овец, 2 коровы, и 2  головы коз, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 2,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурзат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого рогатого скота.  Доходы от кредита Нурзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства, чтобы иметь возможность оплаты за обучение детей.
texts.en: Nurzat 31 years old, married and has four children.  She works as a school teacher and, to provide an additional source of income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business with an initial sum of 4,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, today Nurzat's business contains ten sheep, two cows and two goats, and sales of milk and milk products yield about 2,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Nurzat requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of small livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business in order to have an ability to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto vive en Bolivia - Cochabamba en la provincia Cercado en la zona de Azirumarca, tiene 59 años y es viudo. Es una persona humilde y trabajadora y tiene a su cargo un hijo; estudió sólo hasta el nivel primario, ya que no contaba con los recursos para poder estudiar más. Su familia era de muy bajos recursos económicos y desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno para producción de leche. Alberto quedó viudo hace unos meses, cuando su esposa murió de un paro cardio respiratorio en Argentina. Alberto trabaja junto a su familia ordeñando a tempranas horas, dando de comer a su ganado, limpiando los corrales y efectuando otros trabajos de la granja.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de alimento balanceado para la alimentación de su ganado, ya que su capital de operaciones fue gastado en trámites de expatriación de su esposa fallecida hace unos meses atrás.
texts.en:
Alberto lives in Bolivia in Cochabamba in Cercado Province in the Azirumaca zone.  He’s 59-years-old and a widower.  

He’s a humble, hardworking person who has a son in his care.  He only studied elementary school because he did not have the resources needed to study further.  His family was of very low income.  He’s been raising cattle for milk production for several years.  

Alberto became a widower a few months ago when his wife died of a heart attack in Argentina.  Alberto works with his family milking in the early hours, feeding the cattle, cleaning the corrals and doing other farm chores.

He needs the loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his cattle because he used up his working capital paying for the paperwork related to bringing his wife’s body back who died a few months ago.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Pluton Group

texts.fr:
Mr D.SOUMAILA  est le représentant du groupe le PLUTON. Il est marié et père d’un. Il a 02ans et ne va pas à l’école. Il a 2 personnes en charge.

Mr est gérant d’un maquis depuis 06ans. Il s’approvisionne au secteur 17 PISSY. Ses clients sont hommes et femmes.

Il veut s’acheter 50 caisses de boissons.

Mr  veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour améliorer les conditions de son activité. Il ambitionne agrandir son  activité.
texts.en:
D. Soumaila is the representative of the Pluton group. He is married and father to one child, who is 2 years of age and does not go to school. D. Soumaila has two people under his care.

He has run a restaurant for six years, and gets his supplies in an area called Pissy, known as Sector 17. His customers are both male and female.

D. Soumaila wants to buy 50 crates of drinks. He plans to use his profits to improve his working conditions, and his ambition is to increase his business.

loans.use: To buy 50 crates of drinks.

loans.name: Ricardo Adan

texts.es:
Ricardo, es empleado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos quienes son dependientes económicamente, la vivienda donde reside en  propia, él trabaja en una oficina de gobierno desde hace cuatro años aproximadamente, por el momento se encuentra con el proyecto de mejorar su vivienda.
Solicita un préstamo que le ayude en la compra de cemento, piedra, arena, para constuir una pila donde almacenas agua, para el uso diario, esto le ayudará a mejorar las instalaciones de la vivienda y al mismo tiempo ofrecerle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
La aspiración de Ricardo es que a través de su trabajo y de los préstamos pueda ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia y las instalaciones de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Ricardo is an employee; he lives with his wife and two children who depend on him economically.  He owns his house.  He has worked in a government office for four years approximately.  At present he’s involved in a home improvement project.

He’s asking for the loan to buy cement, gravel and sand to build a water storage tank for daily usage.  This will help to improve his house’s installations and at the same time provide better living conditions for his family.

Ricardo’s hope is that he can gradually improve his family’s living conditions and his house’s installations by means of his work and the loans.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel and sand.

loans.name: Yesenia Yaneth

texts.es:
Yesenia, tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo de seis años, ella se dedica a la venta de huevos al por mayor, tiene cinco años de estar en el negocio, trabaja junto con su esposo de lunes a sábado, esto le ha permitido tener una fuente de empleo y de ingresos para sus necesidades familiares.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprarse al por mayor huevos frescos, con esta compra ayudará a mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio incrementandolo, también le ayudará a generar más ingresos a su familia.
Su objetivo es fortalecer siempre el negocio, ofreciendo una mejor calidad de huevos frescos a los clientes, así poder generar una mejor condición económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 27, lives with her husband and six-year-old son.  She sells eggs at wholesale.  She’s been in business five years.  She works alongside her husband Monday through Saturday.  This has allowed her to have a source of employment and income for family needs.

She’s asking for a loan to buy fresh eggs at wholesale.  With this purchase she will help to improve availability in the business increasing stock; it will also help her generate more family income.

Her goal is to always strengthen the business offering better quality fresh eggs to customers to thus generate a better economic situation for her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh eggs.

loans.name: L,entente Group

texts.fr:
Mme AGNES représente le groupe L’ENTENTE. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé 12ans et le moins  âgé a 02ans. Un va à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des couches jetables et des bijoux depuis 01an. Mme s’approvisionne au GHANA un pays voisin. Ses clients sont les boutiquiers, les femmes (revendeurs).

Mme veut s’acheter 10 paquets de couches et 50 paires de bijoux.

Elle veut  avec ses bénéfices améliorer son activité et épargner. Mme ambitionne s’occuper de ses enfants et de ses frères.
texts.en:
Agnes is the representative of the L’Entente group. She is married and has two children. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is 2 years of age. One of her children goes to school, and she has one person under her care.

Agnes has sold disposable diapers and jewelry for one year. She gets her supplies in Ghana, a neighboring country. Her customers are store-owners and women (resellers).


She plans to buy 10 packets of diapers and 50 sets of jewelry. With her profits, she wants to improve her business and save. Her ambition is to care for her children and her brothers.

loans.use: To buy 10 packets of diapers and 50 sets of jewelry.

loans.name: Muya

texts.en:
Muya is 38 years old.  She is married and has 3 children aged 18, 16 and 8. In 2011, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Muya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili es socia del banco comunal “El Paraíso” del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos mayores.
Hace 12 años que esta como socia en este banco comunal, por  motivos de salud tuvo que dejar por un tiempo de sacar préstamos, ahora se encuentra como re ingresante desde hace dos ciclos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de s/. 1,000.00 comprará un moto-car de segunda mano para darlo en alquiler y recibir su alquiler diario, para luego pagar la cuota a Manuela  Ramos.
Al encontrarse sola en la ciudad y lejos de su esposo quiere generar algún ingreso para su hogar y esta es la manera que vio para hacerlo.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el crédito y espera que la sigan apoyando a las personas que desean seguir trabajando como ella.
texts.en:
Lili is a member of the “El Paraíso” communal bank in Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 53, married, and has four adult children.

She has been a member of this communal bank for 12 years. For health reasons she had to stop taking out loans for a time. Now she has been part of the group again for two loan cycles.

With the new loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy a moto-taxi to rent out and receive daily rent, so that she can then make her payments to Manuela  Ramos.

Finding herself alone in the city and far from her husband, she wants to generate some income for her household, and she saw this as a way of doing it. 

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loan and hopes they continue helping people like her, who wish to keep working.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand moto-taxi.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. María Elena  tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y es comerciante hace más de 5 años. Ella vive aún con sus padres, quienes apoyan moral y económicamente; la cliente dice haber concluido sus estudios sólo hasta el bachillerato.
