No pudo seguir con sus estudios superiores por problemas económicos, es así que ahora solicita el crédito para poder superarse y crecer, ya que tiene muchas aspiraciones para tener una casa propia con el tiempo, además de formar una familia; por eso la señora afirmó que desea el crédito para incrementar su capital para así tener mas mercadería y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos, puesto que con el crédito será mas fácil avanzar en lo que quiere realizar, además de sentirse más satisfecha de haber logrado lo que quiso. Además se pudo evidenciar que la cliente es responsable, ya que muchas personas que la conocen afirman eso, por tal razón se cree que es una persona con buena reputación tanto moral como económica.
texts.en: María Elena, 36, is single and has been a merchant for five years.  She still lives with her parents who support her morally and economically.  She says that she completed high school.  She was unable to continue with higher education because of economic problems which is why she’s now asking for a loan to improve and grow because she very much wants to have a house of her own in time as well as to form her own family.  This is why she affirmed that she wants the loan to increase her capital and have more merchandise to improve her income this way because with the loan it will be easier to advance in what she wants to do in addition to feeling satisfied about having attained what she wanted to.  She also wanted to have noted that she is responsible since many people know her and confirm this.  For this reason it’s believed that she’s a person with a good reputation both morally and economically.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Rupa

texts.en:
Rupa is 24 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 5. In 2008, she established her goat raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW. In the future, Rupa plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

She established her goat raising business four years ago to uplift the economic condition of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy baby goats for her business.

loans.use: to buy small baby goats

loans.name: Yorleni De La Cruz

texts.es: Yorleni de 31 años de edad, es  clienta Kiva originaria de Granada, casada, madre de una niña que esta a su cargo estudia la primaria, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica  a la venta de leña y pan. Su primer préstamo fue de gran ayuda porque pudo invertir en su negocio, incrementaron sus ventas, generando a la vez más ingresos para el hogar, el primer crédito lo utilizo para comprar leña, pan, azúcar y productos de consumo para vender al detalle, pero eso no es suficiente para Yorleni pues ella desea ampliar aun mas su negocio para estar preparada para la temporada de lluvia ya que la leña sube de precio es por ese motivo que hoy en día requiere del préstamo al igual para invertir en la compra de leña y pan con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes en esta temporada de lluvia, ella estima esta nueva inversión será de ayuda ya que podrá vender sus productos para obtener mejores ingresos, sus planes futuros es seguir trabajando con el apoyo de Kiva para mantener su negocio y poder remodelar su vivienda para tener mejores condiciones de vida y poder ofrecerle una mejor educación a su hija.
texts.en: Yorleni, 31 years old, is a Kiva borrower from Granada. She is married and is the mother of a daughter, who is in her care and attends primary school. By trade she is a merchant. She sells firewood and bread. Her first loan was a great help because she was able to invest in her business. Her sales increased, at the same time generating more income for the household. She used the first loan to buy firewood, bread, sugar, and consumables to sell at retail, but this is not enough for Yorleni. She wants to expand her business even more in order to be prepared for the rainy season, since the firewood goes up in price. This is why today she needs the loan to purchase firewood and bread, with the goal of satisfying her customers' needs in this rainy season. She believes this new investment will be of help, since she will be able to sell her products to obtain more income. Her future plans are to continue working with the support of Kiva to maintain her business, to be able to remodel her house in order to have better living conditions, and to be able to offer her daughter a better education.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and bread

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
La Joven Rosa de 23 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, madre de 1 hijo que esta a su cargo, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica a la costura desde hace 2 años, su nivel académico es hasta la primaria debido a que su situación económica no le permitió culminar sus estudios. Ella a pesar de su corta edad es una persona muy trabajadora pues desde pequeña le ayudaba a su mama ya que ella se dedicaba a la misma actividad de donde  fue adquiriendo experiencia y dominio  del negocio, después Rosa con apoyo de una amiga decide viajar a Managua en busca de mas clientes para llevarle a su mama con el objetivo de  ayudar con los gastos del hogar, luego la mama enferma, deja a cargo del negocio a Rosa el cual ha sacado adelante con arduo trabajo y esfuerzo propio, siendo este su primer negocio donde recibe el apoyo de su hermana, sus productos los comercializa en Managua y en Masaya para mayor atracción de clientes, su expectativa es crecer en producción con estilo variados para ofrecer a los clientes.
Solicita el crédito para comprar tela al por mayor, botones y encajes, todo los accesorios necesarios para realizar sus trajes. Rosa estima que esta inversión será de ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer a sus clientes nuevos estilos de productos para obtener mas ganancias para los gastos del hogar, sus planes futuros es seguir ofreciendo productos de alta calidad a sus clientes, sus metas próximas es aumentar sus ventas para obtener mejores ingresos para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 23, is from the city of Granada and is the mother of one son who is in her care.  She has been a seamstress for two years and her educational level is elementary since her economic situation prevented her from completing her studies.  

Despite her young age she’s a very hardworking person since she helped her mother while still little; her mother was in the same occupation and she gradually acquired experience and business savvy from her.  Later on, Rosa with support from a girlfriend decided to travel to Managua in search of more customers to bring to her mother with the goal of helping with household expenses.  

Then her mother became ill and left the business in Rosa’s hands which she’s moved forward with hard work and her own efforts.  This is her first business and she gets help from her sister.  She sells her products in Managua and Masaya to attract more customers.  Her hope is to grow in production with various styles to offer customers.

She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric at wholesale, buttons and lace and all necessary accessories to make her outfits.  Rosa figures that this investment will be of help because she’ll be able to offer her customers new styles of products to earn more profits for household expenses.  Her future plan is to continue to offer high quality products to her customers and her immediate goal is to increase sales to earn better income in order to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou vit au sénégal. Il est père de famille et s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis 18ans. Il est gérant  d’une boutique dont il est le propriétaire. Conscient des besoins de sa population, il s’est investi dans la vente de produits alimentaires.  Il a déjà remboursé  2 prêts  antérieurs au guichet de l’U-IMCEC où  il est membre. Présentement il sollicite un crédit  de 300.000 francs CFA qui est prévu pour s’approvisionner en denrées en vue de renforcer son stock pour mieux satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et  aussi accroitre ses ressources financières.  Le développement de son activité lui  donnera l’opportunité  d’épargner plus, de diversifier ses produits et d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet futur est de devenir un grossiste et avoir en  sa possession plusieurs boutiques dans les différentes localités de sa région pour satisfaire entièrement la demande en produits alimentaires de la zone.
texts.en: Aliou lives in Senegal.  He is a father who has been working in commerce for 18 years, running a store that he owns.  Aware of the needs of the local population, he invested in selling food products.  He has already repaid 2 previous loans from the local U-IMCEC office where he is a member.  He is currently requesting a loan for 300,000 francs which he plans to use to stock up with foodstuffs in order to strengthen his stock, better satisfy his customers' demands and grow his finances.  Developing his business will give him the opportunity to save more, diversify his products and improve his family's nutrition.  His future goal is to become a wholesaler and to own several stores in different towns in his region so that he can completely satisfy the demand for food products that exists in his area.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to re-sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 54 years old, married and has been blessed with four children that he supports. He has been doing a farming activity whereby he has grown potatoes and maize for the last 12 years, getting a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

He has applied for his second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to acquire fertilizers and pesticides for better yields.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His future dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Gyanu

texts.en: Gyanu is 54 years old. She is married and has two children aged 28 and 23. In 2008, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy small chickens for her business. In the future, Gyanu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 24 years old. She is married and has one child, aged four. In 2008, Laxmi established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

Laxmi has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy small chickens for her business. In the future, Laxmi plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens.

loans.name: Erika Ismenia

texts.es:
Erika, tiene 20 años de edad y vive con dos hermanos de 9 y 12 años, también con sus abuelos, la vivienda es propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de chile desde hace tres años, aprendió el trabajo con su madre y hoy entraba sola con sus dos hermanos porque su madre emigró al extranjero.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y foliares para la chilera, con esto podrá mejorar la producción de la hortaliza y evitar las posibles plagas que le puedan afectar.
Su objetivo es tener siempre una fuente de trabajo donde pueda realizarse con sus hermanos, también quiere tener la oportunidad a futuro de iniciar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Erika is 20 years old and lives with her two brothers, who are 9 and 12 years old, as well as her grandparents. They own the house. She has grown chili peppers for three years. She learned the work with her mother and now she started alone with her two brothers because her mother emigrated abroad.

She is asking for a loan to purchase manure and plant fertilizers for the chili crop. With this she will be able to improve the plants' yield and avoid possible infestations that could affect them. 

Her goal is to always have a source of work that she can do with her brothers. In the future, she also wants to have the opportunity to start college.

loans.use: to purchase manure and plant fertilizers for the chili pepper crop

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama est une résidente du Sénégal. Elle   est mère de famille. Elle a choisi la vente de produits détergents( eau de javel et savon en poudre), et tissus  comme activité génératrice de revenus. C’est en 2004 qu'elle a commencé a évoluer dans ce secteur. Elle place ses produits dans les différents marchés de sa localité d'habitation et vend a crédit ses produits.    Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle a déjà remboursé 3 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs  prévu pour l'achat de tissus a revendre . Cette opération  lui offrira la possibilité d’épargner d’avantage et d’élargir son commerce . Dans le futur, elle aimerait devenir indépendante financièrement afin de financer a travers ses propres fonds ses activités génératrices de revenus. 
.
texts.en: Adama is a resident of Senegal.  She is also a mother.  She chose to sell detergents (bleach and soap powder) and fabric as a way of making income.  She started working in this business in 2004.  She places her products in the different markets in her town and sells them on credit.  She is a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices and has already repaid three previous loans.  She is requesting a loan for 200,000 francs to buy fabric to re-sell.  This will enable her to save more and expand her business.  In the future, she would like to become financially independent and be able to finance her business activities with her own funds.

loans.use: to buy products to re-sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past eight years, John has been working hard to manage his store, which sells wholesale cosmetics. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase the amount of clothes he has for resale, and will help John to generate greater profits and expand the business. John hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Goma is fifty years old. She is married and has two children, ages twenty and thirty. In 2006, she established her cow raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.

Goma has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy a young milking cow. In the future, Goma plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about ten liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. 

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milking cow.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been operating a mobile phone repair and accessories shop in Mariakani, Kenya for the last five years. The area is fast developing due to the highway that passes through the town and links Kenya’s two cities. John was first employed and made savings, which formed part of his current business’ startup capital. Besides his business, Patrick is a family man, married, and has two children. 

John learned about Milango from other clients who had obtained loans from Milango to improve their businesses. With a loan capital of 52,250 Kenya shillings, he will be able to purchase other repairing tools, mobile phone accessories and a flushing computer. 

The income obtained from this business will help improve the standard of living for his family. He believes that he will also be able to venture into other businesses, in the near future, when the current business improves.

loans.use: to buy repairing tools, mobile phone accessories and a flushing computer.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is also a married mother of ten children. Mwenda is a food vendor. She bought the premise from another business person and began by purchasing assets, which she now uses in the business. The business has been in operation for eight years.

Mwenda is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings to purchase wheat and maize flour for the business and to repair her stall. Her business faces the slight challenge of seasonal business climate and inflation. She would like to own a larger hotel in the future through the savings she expects from this loan, like major players in the field in Malindi..

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour for the business and to repair her stall.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y leña, tiene 53 años de edad vive en casa propia, desde hace dos años está en el negocio lo tiene instalado en el mercado y surgió por iniciativa propia, esto le ayuda para poderse costear sus propios gastos.
Él solicita un préstamo para poderlo invertir en 20 quintales de maíz y dos camionadas de leña, esto le ayudará a Roberto a tener una mejor disponibilidad en el negocio y de esta manera poder fortalecerse y mejorar la atención a la clientela, este préstamo será un gran aporte para su desarrollo.
Su aspiración en mejorar la situacion económica a través del negocio y de los préstamos, que le permitan generar una mejor condición.
texts.en:
Roberto is 53, he sells staple grains and firewood. He lives in his own house.

He's been in the business for 2 years, he has it set up in the market and it started on Roberto's own initiative, it helps him to pay for his own expenses.

He requests this loan to invest it in 20 quintales of corn [weight measure equal to a 100lbs ~46kg] and 2 truck loads of firewood, this will help Roberto to have better availabilities in his business and thus be able to strengthen the business and improve his customers service; this loan will be a great contribution to Roberto's development.

His aspiration is to improve his economic situation through his business and the loans, this will allow him to generate a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy 20 quintales [weight measure equal to a 100lbs ~46kg] of corn and 2 truck loads of firewood.

loans.name: Jeanett Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Jeanett una humilde habitante de Granada, de 39 años de edad, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de comida, madre de 3 hijos que están a su cargo. Ella inicio su actividad trabajando de manera familiar pues le ayudaba a su cuñado y esposo ya que ellos se dedicaban a ese negocio, anteriormente era la mama de su esposo quien tenía el negocio pero por problemas de salud les dejo el negocio a sus hijos, luego Jeanett decide independizarse a los 38 años de edad, pone su propia venta de comida en su casa de habitación donde recibe el apoyo de su esposo y paga una muchacha  que le ayuda a elaborar sus platillos, sus productos los comercializa en la misma zona. Solicita el crédito para comprar sillas, mesas, manteles, carne, arroz, plátanos, vegetales para su ensalada, aceite, etc. El cual estima será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer a sus clientes nueva variedad de platillos, además podrá ofrecer una mejor presentación del negocio con la compra de sillas, mesas y manteles para atracción de más clientes generando a la vez más ingresos para el hogar, sus metas próximas es seguir remodelando su negocio  y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Jeanett is a humble resident of Granada. She is 39 years old. She is a merchant who sells food, and she is the mother of 3 children, who are in her care. She started by working with her family. She helped her brother-in-law and husband, since they were in this business. Previously it was her husband's mother who had the business, but due to health problems, she left the business to her children. Then, at 38 years old, Jeanett decided to become independent. She started her own business selling food in her house, where she receives the support of her husband and pays a girl who helps her make the dishes. She sells her products in the same area. She is asking for the loan to purchase chairs, tables, tablecloths, meat, rice, bananas, vegetables for her salad, oil, etc. She thinks the loan will be of help because she will be able to offer her customers a new variety of dishes, and will also be able to better present the business with the purchase of chairs, tables, and tablecloths to attract more customers, at the same time generating more income for the household. Her immediate goals are to continue remodeling her business and to be able to move ahead with her family.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, tablecloths, meat, rice, bananas, vegetables for her salad, oil, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 45 years old and lives in the town of Paidha in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past eight years, Alice has been working hard to manage her fish selling, which sells silverfish together with dry fish. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more silver fish, and will help Alice to generate greater profits and build a house. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to use loan profits to build a new house. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more silver fish

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.en:
Gonzalo, from a small, tight-knit community in Central Puebla, is proud of his farm and wants to add a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to increase his efficiency and sustainability. Raising cattle and tending his crops represent his family’s only income source and it has been this way for generations. 

Gonzalo, who inherited the farm from his own parents, involves his children in the business, assuring the transmission of knowledge and tradition. With the lives of his family so intrinsically tied to the land, Gonzalo knows the importance of taking care of it. With his Sistema Biobolsa purchased with this Kiva loan, he will be able to more effectively treat and use his animal waste, drastically reduce agrochemical fertilizer usage, benefit from biogas, and show his children that it is possible to implement sustainable technology while concurrently preserving the culture and tradition of the small-family farm.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a single woman, Cecilia is considered a strong farmer and a strong personality in her home state of Tlaxcala. The idea of a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for her farm and family is an excellent option because she is unwilling to fall into the typical farmer or “housewife” stereotype. As a result of the economic crisis, the farm is the only source of income for her family and she is constantly looking for ways to reduce her costs. 

This Kiva loan is being used towards the purchase of a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, which will allow her to completely eliminate the use of agrochemical fertilizers on her farm, thereby reducing her costs and her carbon footprint. She will also use the biogas to replace the LP gas she currently uses to cook for the family and heat their bathwater at the end of a long day’s work.

loans.use: to purchase a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
As a next-generation farmer, Norberto is excited to apply bioenergy on his farm, using a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to treat waste and produce biogas and organic fertilizer. Only 18 years old, Norberto already shows entrepreneurial spirit. Raised by a single mother, he has succeeded in his studies while working with his twin brother to support the family with their expenses. 

Norberto will use this Kiva loan to invest in a 4 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor in order to use the organic fertilizer produced by his gladiolas, which he sells at the local market. The current costs of agrochemical fertilizers limit how much he can plant. With the biodigester, he will be able to expand his production while concurrently reducing his costs and his impact on the environment.

loans.use: to purchase a 4 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.en: Víctor is a small farmer living in a town slowly being absorbed by the adjacent city. The urbanization of his community has forced him to reassess the feasibility of his small farm. By using this Kiva loan to invest in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will be able to continue raising animals without inconveniencing his neighbors. The biodigester will allow him to process and treat his animal waste, virtually eliminating the odor and flies normally associated with piles of manure. By being able to continue farming in the face of urban encroachment, he will preserve his community’s traditional practices while doing so in an environmentally sustainable and neighbor-friendly manner.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal “Las Fresitas”, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada.
Se dedica a la venta de remedios caseros, para vender aquí en como también lo  lleva a la ciudad de lima  que por ser tiempo de invierno es muy consumido  sus productos, lleva cuatro años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 docenas de huevo de chacra, 2 botellas de vino abuelo, 3 litros de miel de abeja pura, ½ ciento de limón regional, 1 kilo de kion, 3 kilos de corteza.
La persona que prepara los remedios es su esposo también es él quien lleva a vender todos los productos para que pueda explicar a sus clientes las propiedades que tiene cada uno de sus productos, es muy puntual con sus pagos y desea seguir trabajando por más tiempo, agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo  los prestamos que le dio has ahora.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of Las Fresitas Communal Bank in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali.  She is 54 years old and married.  She works selling home remedies, which she sells here in addition to taking them to the city of Lima where her products are in demand because it is winter.  She has been getting loans from Manuela Ramos for four years.

With her new loan for 2,500 nuevos soles [PEN] she will buy three dozen farm eggs, two bottles of aged wine, three liters of pure honey, one kilo of local lemons, one kilo of ginger, and three kilos of bark.

Her husband is the person who prepares the remedies.  He also is the one who goes to sell the products, so he can explain the properties of each product to the customers.  She is very punctual with her payments and wants to continue working longer.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for all the loans she has been granted thus far.

loans.use: to buy honey.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He runs a retail shop that has been in operation for six years. His business is located in the area normally visited by truck drivers linking two Kenyan cities. He is married and has two children. He received the startup capital from his savings.

Martin joined Milango upon introduction by his friends and is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase motor vehicle spare parts, e.g., back lights, bulbs and oil. The only challenges to the business have been price fluctuations and the high cost of retail stock. Martin believes that the business will grow and that he will soon have a chain of businesses.

loans.use: to purchase motor vehicle spare parts, e.g., back lights, bulbs and oil.

loans.name: Tanny Alberto

texts.en:
Tanny is 31 years old, living with his wife and son. They are part of a community in a rural area of Northern Peru in the district Tambogrande which only has irregular electricity service. He is a hard-working person who dedicates his life to his family and to raising sheep, pigs and poultry, so that when they reach the desired size and weight they can be commercialised at the local market. He has been doing this for the past four years. But his talents do not stop here... he also considers himself a musician and often plays with a band and earns some extra income from this.

 In the vein of pursuing his passion and working hard, he also aspires to improve the quality of his house, in order for the family to live more comfortably. Hence, he is looking to take a loan of 1300 soles, which he will use to start building an extra room in his humble house.

loans.use: to improve the quality of his house by building on an extra room.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie	is 37 years old, married, and has five children. Her eldest is 13 years old while her youngest is 9 months old. She and her family live in Trinidad, Bohol. 

Rosalie relies on fishing including catching crabs to earn a living for her family. She is asking for a loan to buy crab traps which are necessary for their day-to-day operations at sea. She hopes that with her improved business, she can have a better income. The profit goes towards school fees and daily food consumption.

loans.use: to buy crab traps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su familia, su esposo y sus hijos, todos trabajan en la familia, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja desde su casa, no tiene un horario establecido pero sí cuenta con experiencia en la atención a los clientes y el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprarse una variedad de productos y así diversificar su tienda aumentando aquellos que son más demandados por los clientes como el arroz, la sal, frijoles, aceite, boquitas, galletas, dulces, que son los más solicitados, este préstamo ayudará permitiéndole la compra y teniendo toda la mercadería necesaria para atender a los clientes.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio,  tener más clientes para poder generar mejores ingresos y al mismo tiempo crear una condición de vida más favorable con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her family, husband and children, everyone in the family works. She manages a household products' store. She started the business on her own initiative and works from home. She doesn't have established working hours but she has experience in customers service and her business.

She requests a loan to buy a variety of products and thus diversify her store, increasing the ones that are the most requested by her customers like rice, salt, beans, oil, snacks, biscuits and sweets that are the most popular ones. This loan will help her to buy and have all the merchandise she needs to serve her customers.

Her aspiration is to make her business grow, have more customers to generate better profit and at the same time create a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, beans, oil, snacks, biscuits and sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory she can keep at her home office to show potential customers

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena's business, Jamboree Party Rentals, provides inflatables and games for parties, special events, festivals and carnivals. In 2002, Helena used her retirement savings to purchase a single inflatable bouncer. The demand for that bouncer was far beyond her wildest expectations. Since then, Jamboree has grown to include ten bouncers, carnival games, and other party favorites. 

As the owner and administrator, Helena handles the day-to-day paperwork and scheduling while her husband, James, handles the delivery and customer service aspects of the business. Helena has three children ages 23, 15 and 10 and says that her family and even her extended family are involved in the business.

With the continuing success of Jamboree Party Rentals, she hopes to expand the rental business to an indoor facility. Currently Jamboree Party Rentals is a seasonal business and weather is a big factor in its success and an indoor facility will allow Helena to host parties throughout the year. She hopes Jamboree becomes a party destination for the entire Detroit metro area. This loan will be used to secure a lease for an indoor facility and to purchase new inflatables, party room equipment and supplies to get the entertainment room up and running.

loans.use: to secure a lease for an indoor party facility

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Since she got married, Rosalina, who is 52 years old, has been engaged in the fishing business. She is from Trinidad, Bohol. She has three children; her eldest is 20 and her youngest is 12 years old. Her fishing business includes catching crabs which adds to a better income for her family. She is asking for a loan to buy floaters, crab traps and lead weights. A loan will help Rosalina in covering her business needs and that of her family from the income that she generates. She will use her profit for her children's education and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy floaters, crab traps and lead weights

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Residing in Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang Province, Huon is a 46-year-old mother of seven children. As one child has been living independently, she needs to support the other six kids who are still in school. She grows corn on one-hectare of farmland as the main source of income and sells fish as additional income. She has been with these businesses for 10 years for the sake of her family. 

With the current businesses, she can earn up to 25,000 KHR (about 6 US Dollars) and is able to save about 5,000 KHR only. As a corn farmer, her main challenge is drought. Huon has never been with VisionFund before. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy not only fertilizer for her cornfield but also a motorbike as mobile transportation to sell the fish from one village to another village. She hopes to generate more income from both businesses so as to have sufficient food.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for cornfield and buy a motorbike to sell fish from one village to another

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy tools and gas

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.  Ailyn  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5  years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000  to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Ailyn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Teodora has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8  years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Teodora  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Teodora hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en: Geralyn is a 27-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She does not have children yet but hopes to have one soon. Geralyn and her husband are both farmers. They cultivate their land to plant rice crops. Geralyn does her best to keep their crops healthy. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor. Geralyn hopes to have a successful farming business. She also hopes to be able to help other farm laborers in her town.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Ulpiano

texts.en:
Ulpiano is a seaweed farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has five children. His eldest is 23 years old and the youngest is 11 years old.

Ulpiano's main livelihood is seaweed farming. He is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope and wooden stakes that are necessary for his business. He is motivated to have a successful business that will help support the future of his children through proper education.  His income will be used for family daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: buy seaweeds seedlings, plastic rope and stakes

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years of age, married and has three children. To make a living, Ruby owns and operates a business venture in agricultural sector raising and harvesting vegetables for sale. Ruby sells her vegetables harvest in the public market of her town. Esterlita had been in this business for 6 years and earns approximately PHP 1,300 per month. This is the core source of income of her family. 

Ruby came to the GDMPC office and requested a loan of PHP 2100 to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of her vegetables. Ruby's revenues will be reinvested back to her business to double the return, and a portion of the profit will be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy fertilizers

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Remedios has a mini store that sells spices and charcoal.  She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more stocks of charcoals and spices.

Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy charcoal and spices to resell

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en: Jacinto is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has no children yet. Jacinto primarily grows rice crops to sell. He works hard to keep his farm productive. He has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor. Jacinto hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en:
Him, 49, is a villager from the Thmor Koul district in Battambang Province. She has four children, two of whom are still dependent on her. To overcome the family's hardship, she has been farming on 1.5 hectares of farmland for two years. Now she has formed a group with another member to be a first-cycle client with VisionFund.

Him is requesting a loan amount is 1,000,000 KHR, whilst her co-member is applying for 100,000 KHR.   Him will use her loan’s portion to buy seeds (480,000 KHR), fertilizer (120,000 KHR) and to plough her land (400,000 KHR). She hopes to receive more crop yield and earn more income to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: buy seed, fertilizer and to pay for land ploughing

loans.name: Feye

texts.en:
Feye works hard to support her family. She is single and has a snack food business in the Philippines.

Feye has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for 23 years.

In the future, Feye would like to save money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is fifty years old and married with three children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials and raising livestock.

Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en:
Venancio is a 42-year-old fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with two children, ages seven and eight years. While he is busy earning a living through fishing, Venancio's wife also helps by selling fish in the neighborhood and also at the market. They are working together to provide their children with a good life. 

Venancio is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets and gasoline for his boat. His income will keep his children in school and provide healthy food for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and gasoline.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 46 years old, married and blessed with 7 children. He is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, where his business of rice production is located. Samson has experienced many difficult times in his life, but in spite of this he has remained determined to pursue his business to earn an income. 

Samson is engaged in an agricultural business sector, specializing in planting and harvesting rice for sale.  He has been cultivating this land for about five years. He told GDMPC loan officers that he doesn't mind the scratches and itches brought about by his work, as long as he can earn income. He earns PHP 6000 a month. 

Samson  joined GDMPC to gain financial access to improve his living conditions. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase manure for the good growth of his crops and to enhance production. When the crop matures and is harvested, the revenue will be allotted for expanding his business to enable him to earn further income and to sustain his family's daily needs.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Flordelize

texts.en:
Flordelize works hard to support her family. Flordelize is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 1 year now, and also earns additional income from selling firewood.

Flordelize requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle.  In the future, Flordelize would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy motorcycle tools and equipment

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. 

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from clothing sales and E-loading.  

Josephine has requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like snack foods, detergent and other miscellaneous items.  She has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Violita

texts.en: Violita is 44 years old and comes from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. In this place, fishing and the seaweed farming business thrive. Violita is also engaged in seaweed farming for 10 years now. This is her means to provide for her three children ages 16, 20 and 27. Violita is asking for a loan to buy rolls of plastic rope and seaweed seedlings needed for her business. Her income will be for family daily consumption, school fees and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy rolls of plastic rope and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

NWTF is relisting Denia's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Merlita has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April works hard to support his family. He is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

April requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy oil and gasoline for his motorcycle. He has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, April would like to save enough money so he could afford to send his kid to school.

loans.use: to buy oil and gasoline for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Unidas”, porque justamente las mujeres que integran este grupo trabajan unidas y siempre se ayudan para ser mejores y sobresalir. Gracias a su trabajo ya están en el ciclo 5to. Del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
La Directora es la Sra. Zunilda es parte del grupo, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida con la cual abastece a los miembros de su comunidad. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que luego gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación lo ha podido ir mejorando.
Hoy solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de bebidas, azúcar, yerba, carne y demás insumos de primera necesidad, con lo cual desea poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en: The committee is named "Mujeres Unidas," or "United Women," because the women that are a part of this group work together and always help one another to do better and to succeed. Thanks to their work they are already in the 5th cycle of the program for enterprising women. The director is Mrs. Zunilda, and is a member of the group, she has a store that is well stocked from which members of her community are supplied. She says she began with a small business, but now thanks to effort and dedication, she has been able to grow. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva and the Paraguayan foundation to purchase drinks, sugar, herbs, meat and more supplies of basic necessity, with which she wants to stock her store.

loans.use: purchase drinks, sugar, herbs, meat and more.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 38 years old, married and has 4 children.  With 3 children in school, Jinky works very hard to provide for them.

Jinky runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, eggs, noodles, sugar, shampoo, etc.  She has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

In the future Jinky would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 41 years old, married and has 5 children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and clothing sales.

Lydia has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, detergent, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.  Lydia has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea is 57 years old, married and has 6 children. 

Matea is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines.   She has been farming vegetables for 33 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Matea requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her vegetables.   In the future, Matea would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizers for her vegetables

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 43 years old and single.  Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Elena has requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.  Elena has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan.   She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 15 years.  She also earns more income from hog raising.

Araceli is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to buy more fish for her dried fish business.

Araceli has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is  39 years old.  She is a widow with 4 children.

Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.    She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fish vending.

Margie has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Margie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: buy more items to resell

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Violita works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending.  Violita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Violita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Angelin

texts.en:
Angelin is 45 years old and married with three children.

Angelin is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Angelin has been farming vegetables and rice for ten years now. She has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain her business.

Angelin is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ana Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ana Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from the direct selling of Avon and ready-to-wear products. Ana Joy is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Ana Joy has been sustaining her business activities by means of her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Norlita has been in this business for eight years. Norlita earns more income from crab dealing and oyster culture.

Norlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for fishing

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es:
José, está dedicado a la agricultura, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solamente sus hijos dependen económicamente de sus ingresos, él comenzó esta actividad por el apoyo de sus padres cuando aún era joven viviendo con ellos, hoy en día lo realiza para el sostenimiento de su hogar, no tiene un horario establecido para atender las labores.
Él solicita un préstamo que le facilite los insumos necesarios para iniciar la siembra de la temporada comprando con este abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, esta compra le permitirá obtener lo necesario a través de los fondos del préstamo ayudándole a aplicarlo para obtener una cosecha libre de plagas.
La aspiración de Jose en su trabajo agrícola es tener buenas cosechas, con esto poder darle lo mejor a sus hijos y vivir en una condición más estable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
José makes a living in agriculture, he lives with his wife and two children; Only his children depend economically on his income.

He started in this activity with his parents' support when he was still young and lived with them, today he does it to support his homestead. He doesn't have an established schedule to do his work.

He requests a loan to facilitate himself the supplies necessary to start the sowing of the season. with the loan he wants to buy  fertiliser, insecticides and pesticides; This buy will allow him to get what he needs. with the funds of his loan he will be able to apply them to his crops to have a plague free harvest.

The aspiration of José  in his agricultural job is to have good harvest and thus give his children the best and live in a more stable condition with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, insect-killer and pesticide.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y sus hijos, solamente él trabaja en su hogar realizando las siembras de granos básicos, este proceso lo aprendió junto con sus padres trabajando diariamente, en la actualidad realiza sus propios cultivos para el sustento de su familia, no tiene un horario establecido para realizar las labores.
El está iniciando el nuevo proceso de siembra para esto solicita un préstamo que le facilite los insumos agrícolas como el abono, los insecticidas y los pesticidas, que son quienes le ayuda a prevenir en el cultivo las plagas y a fortalecer la producción de granos básicos, este préstamo le permitirá a José contar con lo necesario para realizar su trabajo.
La aspiración de José es trabajar con su familia obteniendo buenas cosechas, que son las que le permiten ayudar en la alimentación y los gastos familiares.
texts.en: José is a farmer and he lives with his family that is made up of his wife and children, he is the only one who works in his home, planting seeds to grow basic grains. He learned this process alongside his parents with daily work and now he has his own cultivation that sustains his family. He has no established schedule to finish his work. He is beginning a new planting season and is asking for a loan that will ease the purchase of agricultural supplies like fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides, which are items that help prevent plagues and strengthens production. This loan will allow José to obtain all that is necessary to see his job through. José's aspiration is to work with his family to get good harvests, because it is the harvest that helps him to feed his family and pay for other household expenses.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 41 years old and married with two children.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Analiza has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from oyster farming.

Analiza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Eldy

texts.en:
This is Eldy, 39, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Geraldine, a housewife. Eldy, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Eldy maintains a "tricycle" business. He owned and drives a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working as early as 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.   He earns a minimum of Php 300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting an amount of Php 10,000 as a loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Eldy dreams of growing his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y su hija, su esposo trabaja y hija el dependiente de ellos, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos este oficio lo aprendió junto con su esposo quien siempre se ha dedicado a la ganadería y a la crianza de cerdos, trabaja en su casa no tiene un horario fijo para realizar las labores que demanda la granja, cuenta con una experiencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos pequeños para iniciar el proceso con ellos de engorde, esta compra le permitirá crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar, aumentando el número de cerdos en la granja ya que esto le permitirá disponer para ofertar al cliente.
Su objetivo es a través de los préstamos poder crecer en el negocio y crear un buen historial de pagos, ya que esto le abrirá las puertas para desarrollarse en la crianza de cerdos, además dentro de su familia quiere generar una condición más estable.
texts.en: María lives with her husband and daughter. Her husband works and their daughter is dependent on them. She dedicates herself to raising pigs, a skill she learned from her husband, who has always worked with cattle and pigs. She works from home and does not have a fixed schedule to finish her work that the farm demands and relies on her experience. She is asking for a loan to purchase small pigs to begin the fattening process. This purchase will allow her to grow her business and to have all that she needs to see her work through and increasing the number of pigs on the farm which she will be able to provide to her clientele. Her objective through these loans is to grow her business and create a good payment history, as this will open doors to develop further in the raising of pigs, as well as within her family generate a more stable situation.

loans.use: purchase small pigs.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.en:
Silvino is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 61 years of age, married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker - talking care of the children and doing the household chores. To make a living, Silvino owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising and harvesting corn for sale. Silvino sells his corn harvest to a contract buyer. Silvino has been in this business for 15 years and earns approximately 12,300 PHP  per month. This is the primary source of income of the family. 

The previous loan taken out by Silvino for construction materials has flourished and runs smoothly. Silvino is also engaging in another line of business to earn extra income. 

He came to the GDMPC office and requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the good growth of his corn. Silvino plans that the return will be reinvested back into the business to double his received income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the good growth of his corn

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 54 years old. Myrna is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Myrna plants and harvests rice for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for more than nine years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Prior to this loan Myrna had a loan in the amount of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This money has been used and the rice matured and harvested. Myrna has been able to pay her obligations at GDMPC. Now for the next crop she needs fertilizer again because she has additional areas of her rice farm to cultivate. She needs fertilizer for it.

Without a doubt, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and buy another area of rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, tiene 18 años y está cursando el 1° año de la Carrera de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Católica. Vive con sus padres junto con a sus dos hermanos. Su madre y su padre siempre han trabajado  para poder darle a el y a sus hermanos todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante.
Luis dice que su sueño es poder terminar su carrera para poder ayudar a sus padres, y que ya no tengan que hacer trabajos pesados para ayudarlo. Es por ello que solicita el crédito para el pago de sus cuotas de la universidad, como así también para sus gastos de transporte, ya que con esto podrá aligerar un poco la carga a sus padres.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva, pues gracias a esto estará cada vez más cerca de cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en:
Luis is from the city of Ybycuí.  He is 18 years old and in the first year of a Business Management degree at the Catholic University.  He lives with his parents and two siblings.  His mother and father have always worked to provide him and his siblings with everything they need in order to make progress in life.

Luis says that his dream is to finish his degree to help his parents so that they no longer have to work hard in order to help him.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to pay his college fees and transport costs.  This will help lift some of the burden from his parents' shoulders.

Luis is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving from Kiva because it means that he will move closer to fulfilling his dreams.

loans.use: to pay his fees and cover his transport costs

loans.name: Poy's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Eng Phnom district of Battambang province, Poy is a 61-year-old widow with four children. However, she has to support only one daughter who works as a construction worker and helps with the family's additional business, pig raising. Poy grows paddy rice as their main source of income while she raises pigs and works for others for pay as extra income. She can earn up to about 30,000 KHR. She has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully repaid the entire loan. 

The past loan has helped her improve her living standard especially enabling her to set aside something for future needs. This is the third loan for Poy and she has formed a group with another member who has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Poy is requesting a loan of 600,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Poy will use a portion of her loan to buy piglets and fix the pigpen while the remainder is to be used to buy petrol for the water pump for her rice farm. She hopes to raise healthy pigs and make a better living

loans.use: To buy piglets, fix the pigpen, and pay for gasoline for the water pump for her rice farm.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is 49 years old and married. Evelyn has only three grown dependents. Evelyn owns and operates a service-based business to earn a living. Evelyn has been in this business venture for about 11 years and she is able to run the business well. The net income of the of her internet cafe each month is 16,000 Php.

Evelyn needs to make an additional investment to purchase additional desktop computers and computer accessories to give better service for the computer users in their community.

She came and joined GDMPC again to have access to financial services. She is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 40,000 to purchase the above-mentioned needs. 

Evelyn is hoping that in the near future she can have her own space for her internet cafe and not rent anymore.

loans.use: to purchase additional desktop computers and computer accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural and chemical medicines for her business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, tiene 18 años y  está cursando el 1° año de la Carrera de Derecho en la Universidad Politécnica y Artística del Paraguay. Vive con sus padres, quienes solventan los gastos de sus estudios por medio de su arduo trabajo.
María nos cuenta que su sueño es poder ser una gran profesional, que pueda ayudar a las demás personas. Quiere poder ayudar a sus padres, ya que ellos le han apoyado en todos los proyectos que ella tiene.
Solicita el crédito para el pago de cuotas y también para la compra de sus libros, pues así aligerara la carga a sus padres. Comenta que sigue esta carrera, pues quiere poder ayudar a aquellas personas más  necesitadas.
texts.en:
María is from the city of Ybycuí. She is 18 years old and is in her first year studying at the Polytechnic and Artistic University of Paraguay, where she is studying law. She lives with her parents, who help pay for her tuition through their hard work.

María's dream is to become a great professional who can help others. She wants to be able to help her parents, since they have supported her in all her life endeavors.

She is requesting this loan in order to pay monthly tuition quotas and to pay for her school books. This loan will lighten her parents' financial load. She is pursuing a career in law so that she can help the people who need it the most.

loans.use: to pay university tuition and purchase study materials.

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
Nelson, atiende un taller automotriz, vive con su esposa, este taller lo tiene desde hace un año,lo atiende de forma independiente, trabaja todos los días de la semana, el aprendió este trabajo siendo empleado de otro taller.
Nelson, está solicitando un préstamo para complementar la compra de un vehículo usado, ya que éste le permitirá desplazarse para desarrollar su trabajo a los clientes a domicilio, este préstamo ayudará a facilitarle la cantidad de dinero que le hace falta para poder adquirir el vehículo, siendo una herramienta importante para el desarrollo de su trabajo y la generación de ingresos.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente crear un buen historial de pagos, poder adquirir el vehículo y a futuro tener un hogar propio donde poder ubicar el taller.
texts.en:
Nelson works in an auto repair shop.  He lives with his wife.  He has had his workshop for one year and is self employed.  He works every day of the week and learned this trade while he was an employee in another garage.

Nelson is requesting a loan to put together with some money he already has in order to buy a used vehicle.  This will allow him to get around and develop his business by serving customers at home.  This loan will give him the money he still needs to buy his vehicle.  The vehicle will be an important tool in making progress in his work and making income.

Nelson's goal is to work hard, build up a good repayment history, acquire his vehicle and, in the future, to own his own home where he can set up his workshop.

loans.use: to add to some money he already has in order to buy a used vehicle

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, es madre soltera de sus hijos de 36 y 39 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, se decidió a atender esta actividad desde hace cinco años trabajando todos los días, hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente con el negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita comprarse mercadería para la producción de alimentos comprándose aquellos que son más utilizados como los condimentos, aceite, arroz, frijoles, carnes, entre otros productos que son necesarios para que ella pueda elaborar los alimentos, este préstamo le ayudará a fortalecer el negocio con el dinero que invertirá así también le dará la oportunidad de generar mayor venta y ganancias.
Su aspiración es mantener el negocio fuerte y estable ya que esto les sirve para poderse mantener y contar con un ingreso necesario para poder subsistir junto a  Su familia, a futuro tiene el proyecto de mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a single mother of two adult children, ages 36 and 39. She makes a living selling food, and she decided to begin her small business five years ago. She works every day, and she has had success with her business.

She is requesting this loan because she needs to purchase input items for making her food dishes. She plans to purchase her most popular ingredients, including: condiments, oil, rice, beans and meat, among other products necessary for making her food items. This loan will help her to strengthen her business and give her the opportunity to increase her sales and profit.

Her goal is to maintain and strengthen her business, since it is her source of income for her family. She hopes to use her income to improve her house and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, oil, rice, beans and meat.

loans.name: Jesenia Argentina

texts.es:
Jesenia es una humilde habitante de Granada, de 40 años de edad, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 20 años,  casada, su nivel académico es hasta secundaria. Inicio su negocio con poco inventario, después de un tiempo vio que el negocio era rentable pues generaba ingresos diarios, luego con  ayuda del esposo fue invirtiendo en productos básicos para la pulpería siendo este su primer negocio el cual administra sola pues no tiene apoyo de nadie, su esposo es asalariado y aporta para los gastos del hogar como otros ingresos, ella dice que le gustaría poner otro tipo de negocio en otro lugar pues desea poner una tienda de ropa interior para obtener mayores ingresos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, huevo, frijol, aceite, pan y cosméticos, todos los insumos necesarios para surtir su pulpería, el cual estima será de ayuda ya que podrá invertir en su negocio para estar preparada para el mes de agosto que es la temporada de buenas ventas, sus planes futuros es diversificarse en productos, mantener el negocio activo para mayor atracción de clientes, su meta próxima es poner su tienda de ropa interior con el objetivo de tener mas ingresos, poder salir adelante y tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Jesenia is a humble resident of Granada.  She is 40 years old and works in commerce.  She has owned a grocery store for 20 years.  She is married and studied up to high school.  She started out in her business with just a small amount of stock.  After a while, she saw that her business was profitable as it made her daily income.  With the help of her husband, she invested in buying basic products for her grocery store.  This was the first business that she had owned and she runs it alone as she doesn't have support from anybody.  Her husband earns a salary and contributes towards their household expenses.  Jesenia says that she would like to set up another type of business somewhere else as she would like to have a lingerie store in order to make more income.

Jesenia is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, beans, oil, bread and cosmetics.  These are all products that she needs to stock her grocery store.  She believes that the loan will be helpful as she will be able to invest in her business and get ready for the month of August which is when she makes good sales.  Her future plans are to diversify her products, keep her business running and attract more customers.  Her next goal is to establish her lingerie store so that she can make more income, get ahead in life and enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, beans, oil, bread and cosmetics

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 9, 8 y 4 años de edad, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol esta actividad lo realiza desde hace 15 años, trabajando desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde donde realiza la labor necesaria, Cristobal ademas trabaja como seguridad, los dias libres realiza las actividades de la agricultura.
Por el momento está iniciando su nueva siembra de temporada para esto necesita comprarse algunos materiales que le ayuda a prevenir las plagas en la milpa, para ello solicita un préstamo que le facilite los recursos económicos e invertirlos en abono, herbicidas, otros materiales como insecticidas para poderlos aplicar a la siembra y así tener mayor seguridad de una buena producción.
La aspiración de Cristóbal es trabajar para apoyar a su familia, ya que todos dependen de él, por eso su deseo de superarse en el cultivo de maíz y frijol obteniendo mejores cosechas.
texts.en:
Cristóbal lives with his wife and three children, ages 9, 8 ​​and 4 years old.  He is devoted to growing corn and beans and has been doing this activity for 15 years, working from six o'clock in the morning until three in the afternoon in the place where he gets the necessary work done.  Cristobal also works as a security guard, and on his free days he works in agricultural activities.

At the moment he is starting to plant a new seasonal crop and for this reason needs to buy some materials that will help prevent pests in the fields.  For that reason he is asking for a loan that will help him with the financial resources to invest in fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and other materials that can be applied at planting so that he can be more confident of having good production.

Christopher's aspiration is to work to support his family, since they all depend on him, so his desire is to excel in the cultivation of corn and beans and thus obtain better harvests.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides for planting crops.

loans.name: Wilmar

texts.es:
Wilmar, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y de frijol, vive con su esposa, no tiene hijos, se dedica a este oficio desde hace 10 años, éste le aprendió por su padre trabajando todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, hasta la fecha no ha presentado ningún riesgo y ningún problema con sus cosechas.
El está iniciando la nueva siembra de la temporada para esto necesita comprarse los insumos necesarios, para lo cual busca la ayuda a través de un préstamo e invertirlo en el abono y herbicidas para poderlos aplicar al terreno y a la plantación, con el objetivo de prevenir que las plagas y de fortalecer las cosechas, este crédito será una gran ayuda pues le permitira comprar lo necesario de una sola vez y poderlo aplicar al inicio de la siembra.
El propósito de Wilmar es poder tener un cultivo más productivo, de donde el maíz y los frijoles sean sanos y poder generar ventas con los clientes.
texts.en:
Wilmar makes a living farming corn and beans, and lives with his wife. He has worked as a farmer for ten years, and learned farming techniques from his father as they worked side by side from six in the morning until three in the afternoon. He has never had issues with his harvests, and has worked very hard to produce high quality crops.

As he is starting into a new planting season, he needs to purchase necessary materials for taking care of his crops, and is therefore requesting this loan in order to purchase manure and herbicides to put on his lands. He hopes these materials will prevent pests and will strengthen his crops. This loan will be very helpful to Wilmar, as it will allow him to purchase all the manure and herbicides he needs right at the beginning of the season. 

Wilmar's goal is to increase the productivity of his lands, and to grow healthy beans and corn for sale to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase manure and herbicides.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La Señora Elsa tiene 23 años y es soltera, vive con sus padres pero económicamente es independiente. Se dedica al comercio de papa y compra su mercadería en la feria de Colomi los días jueves de los agricultores para venderla en Yapacani, Santa Cruz, donde tiene un mercado consolidado; ella realiza esta actividad hace más de 1 año.
